loans.name: Ndukue

texts.en: Ndukue U. sells household items like microwaves, blenders, etc. He is married with a child and he is sixty years old. He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more household items to sell. Ndukue says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more household items to sell

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is 37 years old and is married with three children. His business is to sell carpets of different sizes. He is familiar with this business and provides good customer service. He has many clients, and his business keeps growing.

In order to increase the range of his carpets, he now needs a loan of $1,500 which he will use to purchase more inventory. 

Nidal appreciates your help!

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Pamella Nabuuma ‘S Group

texts.en:
Pamella is a leader of five members of a group.  She is 33 years old and married with four children aged between 3 and 10 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she is staying with five people. Pamella takes care of additional family members. There is no electricity and piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area, which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Pamella owns a retail shop in Lubaga ben Kiwanuka zone and so she incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. She sells to an average of 30 people a day and sells to all categories of people.  She works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for both home and business, and feeding the family. Besides this retail shop, she also owns a charcoal stall.  She has been in this business for the last two years Pamella has been with MCDT for over five years and is servicing her 12th loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more commodities for her shop. Pamella is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to own a permanent business premise and home. 

.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Erlinda Elizabeth

texts.es: Erlinda Elizabeth F. L. reside en el municipio de Apopa del departamento de San Salvador. Erlinda cuenta con 34 años de edad,se encuentra casada con Alfredo quien trabaja en la PNC y tiene una niña de cinco años de edad llamada Vanessa. Erlinda y su esposo se apoyan mutuamente en los gastos económicos ella se desempeña en su propio negocio una tienda de productos de consumo, siempre la acompaña su pequeña hija ya que no hay quien cuide de ella, y tampoco la han podido inscribir al kínder, Erlinda desea aumentar su inventario a través de este crédito solicitado, que  le ayuda a incrementar sus ventas al igual que  sus ganancias y dándole la oportunidad a Vanesa de poderla inscribir en el kínder; ya que requiere de muchos gastos por tantos materiales escolares y didácticos que le solicitan.
texts.en:
Erlinda Elizabeth resides in Apopa county in the state of San Salvador. Erlinda is 34 years old, married to Alfredo who works at the PNC, and has a 5 year-old daughter named Vanessa. Erlinda and her husband help each other with household's expenses. She works in her own business, a store with food products, always in the company of her small daughter since there is no one else to take care of her and who she hasn't been able to enroll in kindergarten. Erlinda wishes to increase her store's inventory with this loan which will help her increase her sales and her profits to give Vanessa the opportunity to be enrolled in kindergarten given the many expenses required for the many school and didactic materials they ask for.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Zamora, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replenish store stock

loans.name: Las Hermanas Group

texts.es:
El Grupo las hermanas está formado por tres mujeres trabajadoras quienes a raíz de las necesidad de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las condiciones de sus negocios, se unieron para formar este grupo característico por la comunión y solidaridad que existe entre ellas.

Sofía Esperanza G. es la coordinadora del grupo quien posee una pulpería que ha logrado levantar gracias a los créditos que ADIM le ha proporcionado. Cuando inició su negocio, solamente tenía unas verduras y golosinas. Actualmente cuenta con un poco más de productos y su crédito pretende invertirlo en la mejora de ésta.

Ayudada de sus hijos, han sacado adelante su negocio y su hogar, han hecho mejoras a su casa y ha podido lograr que su familia tenga un mejor futuro.

Martha Lorena B. G. otra integrante del grupo, trabaja en la venta de cosméticos de marcas reconocidas como (Zermat, Avon, Vogue) y Teresa de Jesús E. B. quien vende ropa al crédito.

loans.use: Surtir su pulperia con otros productos

loans.name: Farrukhdjon

texts.en:
T. Farrukhdjon has a small business capitalizing on the huge demand in Tajikistan for cell phones and related accessories. He started selling phones a year ago and now has a small stand in a market. He is not married yet but despite his young age he supports his parents. Farrukhdjon’s business is very personal. Often he will get a request for a specific phone or accessory and he will make a special effort to find it if he does not have it in stock. At the same time Farrukhdjon provides the service of repairing cell phones. Farrukhdjon has requested a loan to give him extra capital to purchase an instrument that is required for the diagnostics of cell phones. IMON International is happy to be able to provide the means for Farrukhdjon to strengthen his business and continue working toward his goals.  
 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase an instrument required for the diagnostics of cell phones

loans.name: Ebele

texts.en: Ebele is 29 year old and single without a child. She lives in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria. She has a boutique where she sells male and female clothes. Ebele hopes for the loan amount of  N140,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Loveth has a fish farm. She is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She has been in the business for long. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more fingerlings. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fingerlings

loans.name: Petronila De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Petronila R. tiene la edad de 60 años habita en el barrio los Ríos ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, ella es madre soltera , el apoyo que recibe son de sus dos hijas , las cuales están casadas , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones del cultivo para poder tener un mejor ingreso y lograr comprar un terreno para que heredar a sus hijas , doña Petronila desde hace 25 años , se dedica a la agricultura gracias al apoyo de sus padres que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierras ya que era la fuente de trabajo de su familia , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es el humo del volcán que en ocasiones ha quemado el gran parte de la plantación  y no ha logrado sacar ni lo que invierte, se siente contenta por el apoyo que Afodenic ha dado el cual ha logrado superar la crisis comprando los  fertilizantes necesarios para tener una buena cosecha y así poder vender a buen precio los productos. Lo cual espera en este año reponerse para sastifacer sus necesidades personales como pagar en tiempo y forma el préstamo. Comprar abonos y venenos para la obtención de un mejor fruto.
texts.en:
Petronila R., 60, lives in the Ríos neighborhood in the town of Ticuantepe. She is a single mother. Two of her married daughters help her out economically. Her plans for her family is to improve her planting conditions so that she can increase her earnings to buy a plot of land to leave to her daughters. Petronila has been a farmer for the past 25 years. She learned her farming skills from her parents who, as life-long farmers, taught her to work the land. The greatest difficulty she has faced lately is the smoke from the volcano which has burned much of her crop causing her yields to be so poor that she hasn't even recouped her investment. She is happy for Afodenic's help in purchasing fertilizers which will insure a better crop yield and products that she can sell for a better price. She hopes to recover enough this year to meet her personal expenses and repay her loan in a timely fashion. She will buy fertilizers and insecticides in order to get a better crop yield.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Lilia Dolores

texts.en:
Lilia Dolores C. P. lives with her husband in the Paraiso district of Guayaquil and has four older children. They live in a very fragile home made of wood and cane. Ms. C. and her husband have a chicken coop in their backyard to sell chickens, but she wants to branch out into encebollado production and sales. Encebollado is a very popular Ecuadorian dish; it is a soup-like dish made of fish, yuca, rice, tomatoes and onions and generally sprinkled with lemon/lime juice.

Ms. C. began making encebollado with her sister and is currently selling from her home for $1.50 each dish. She sells approximately $35 worth daily (even more on weekends). She wakes up at 3 am in order to have her encebollado stock ready by 7 am. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients and supplies for encebollado – especially yuca, fish and rice. In the future, Ms. C. hopes to fix her home and have a proper store.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for "encebollado"

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Mrs. Tessie A. is from the village of Landing in Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. She is married and blessed with 3 adult children. To make a living, Tessie provides transportation on her motorcycle to members of the local community. She has been engaged on her business for more than 5 years and earns 5,000.00 monthly from her business.

Tessie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.Tessie is requesting a new loan of 36,000.00 PHP to purchase a motorcycle to transport passengers. This will be Tessie's 8th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to transport passengers

loans.name: Jestine

texts.en:
Jestine P. is currently in the business of selling charcoal out of her home and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Jestine is 27 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida G., 44, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Rico G., a driver, and they are blessed with four children. She helps her husband earn money so that their family can have a better life. She has been making and selling rags and doormats for her business.

Aida has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT)* for more than two years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow seven times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses all the money she borrows to buy raw materials needed to make rags and doormats. Her business earns 3,600 Philippine pesos per month.

Now with your help, she is applying for a 17,000 PHP loan. This money will be mostly used as added capital to expand her business by buying strips of recycled clothes to be used for her rag-making business. She dreams that her business will continue to improve so that her livelihood will improve as well. She also prays that someday all her children will have a bright future.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy recycled clothes for her rag-making business

loans.name: Mirla Liliana

texts.es: Doña Mirla  vive en la Colonia Venecia desde hace diecisiete años, su negocio es Taller de costura, tiene clientas fijas todos los meses, Mirla elabora pantalones, faldas, vestidos, camisas y cameras, dandoles un acabado muy bonito a todo lo que hace, le encanta lo que hace, asi mismo le gusta confeccionar joyas como ser cadenas, aritos y pulseras. doña Mirla necesita el credito  para poder comprar telas y otros materiales para la fabricacion de sus trajes, en estos momentos Mirla solo cobra por mano de obra ya que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para mantener inventario de telas y asi poder tener mayores ganancias. doña Mirla esta casada, su esposo es comerciante y juntos luchan por mejorar su calidad de vida, su sueño es llegar a tener su taller muy grande y poder ofrecerle empleo a varias personas.
texts.en:
Doña Mirla has lived in the Venecia neighbourhood for seventeen years. She runs a sewing business and has a regular clientele. Mirla makes pants, skirts, suits, shirts etc. Everything she does is beautifully finished; she really enjoys her work. She also makes jewelry such as necklaces, earrings, and bracelets. Doña Mirla needs a loan to buy material and other items to make suits. At the moment she charges for each piece of clothing as she makes it as she doesn’t have enough money to keep material in stock. If she could, she would earn more money. She is married, and her husband is a businessman. Together they are working hard to improve their quality of life. Mirla’s dream is to own a bigger workshop and be able to employ several people.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sewing items

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad L. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Natividad owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling fish to the local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Natividad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Natividad is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Doña: María Pelicó C. de 45 años de edad, unida de hecho, se dedica actualmente a la agropecuaria, crianza y venta de ganado porcino, esta persona tiene aproximadamente 10 años de dedicarse a la agropecuaria, doña maría ella es la encargada de velar por la familia ya que el esposo de ella falleció  hace 5 años y desde entonces ella ha venido manteniendo a su familia junto a  sus hijos, doña maría se vio en la necesidad de comprar un lote de terreno ya que servirá de mucho para el futuro de sus hijos ya que tendrán un lugar donde poder construir una vivienda, pero como no cuenta con los suficientes recursos económicos por ello fue que doña maría  acudió a la Asociación ASDIR..
texts.en:
Mrs. María Pelicó C. is a 45 year-old widow. She currently works in agriculture and the raising and selling of pigs. She has worked approximately 10 years in agriculture. María is in charge of watching over her family since her husband died five years ago. Since then, she has maintained her family together with her sons. María saw the necessity in buying a lot of land that will serve her children in the future by giving them a place where they can build a house. She does not have the sufficient economic resources to buy the land, which is why María has come to Asociación ASDIR.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying property

loans.name: Marling Lili

texts.es:
La Sra. Marling Lili L. P. tiene una venta de comida en el casco urbano de Condega.

Ella solicita un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de comidas tales como aceite, arroz, verduras, etc. Ya que estos ah subido deprecio y quiere comprar más productos para elaborar más comida y satisfacer la demanda.

Ella empezó este negocio surge al establecerse una fabrica de puros en las cercanías de su casa de habitación por lo que los trabajadores de dicha empresa demandaban alimento, este negocio tiene de tenerlos desde hace unos 8 años y empezó vendiendo comida en pequeñas cantidades aumentando a medida que los trabajadores aumentaban. Ella se dedicaba a la costura antes de dedicarse a la venta de comida.

Marling L. espera con este financiamiento comprar mas materia prima y aumentar mas su negocio y lograr satisfacer la demanda y por ende sus ingresos.

Ella es una a mujer soltera con hijo en edad universitaria, al que ella le costea dichos gastos de estudio.

Este es el crédito numero 4 que ella tiene en Ceprodel en un periodo de 10 años. Ella dice que sus créditos con Ceprodel le han ayudado a crecer su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marling Lili L. P. sells food in greater Condega. She is asking for funding to buy ingredients for her meals like: cooking oil, rice, vegetables, etc. because prices for these items have risen and she wants to have more ingredients available to prepare more food and satisfy customer demand. She started her business when a cigar factory opened up near her home. Employees of the factory needed food and, for about 8 years now, she has provided meals for them; first in small numbers but gradually increasing as the number of employees grew. Prior to going into meal preparation she was a seamstress. Marling hopes to use the funds to buy more ingredients to increase her volume, meet customer demand thus increasing her income. She is a single mother of a university-age son; she pays all his educational expenses. This is her 4th loan with Ceprodel in a 10-year period. She says that her loans with Ceprodel have helped her business grow, her income increase and thus improved her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, cooking oil, gas, rice and flour.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus D. is from the village of Brgy. Magsaysay, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old. Venus is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Venus owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Venus has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Venus joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Venus has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Venus is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the third loan taken out by Venus from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Antonio Elmone

texts.pt:
António Elmone Monteiro Durão nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique tem 29 anos de idade solteiro e pai de 1 filho de 02 anos de idade, ainda não vai a escola. Fez 12ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa cedida pelos pais com o seu filho e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, tem um negocio próprio há mais de 6 anos e conta com ajuda de um empregado. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária na.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através da sua mãe que também é cliente desta instituição a longa data. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar (cimento, pó de pedra e areia) para o fabrico de blocos e vender no seu estaleiro.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros, no futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar no seu negócio.
texts.en:
António Elmone Monteiro Durão was born in the city of Maputo, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is 29 years old, is single, and is the father of a two-year-old son who does not yet go to school. António finished twelfth grade but did not continue for financial reasons. He lives in his parents' house and does not support anyone else. He has never left Maputo. He has had his own business for more than six years and has one employee. He earns about 5,000 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses. He also manages to save some money in his bank account. António has never taken out loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through his mother, who is a long-time customer at this institution. This is his first loan. He is asking for 10,000 meticais, which he will use to buy cement, gravel and sand to make concrete brinks and sell them at his stand. He promises to pay off this loan on time so he can take out more loans. In the future he would like to ask for more loans to use for his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw material for manufacture of concrete blocks (cement, gravel and sand)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Merissa

texts.en: Merissa R. is from the village of Tamil, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 32 years old, is married, and has five children. Merissa owns and operates a business selling barbeque in the barangay (village). However, the main source of income for the family comes from the income of her husband as a driver. Merissa has been engaged in her business for six years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Merissa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Merissa is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital and to buy ingredients for her barbeque business

location.town: Liloy-Tamil, Jose Dalman Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Ismayil

texts.en: Ismayil  H. is a 43-year-old farmer who has bred cattle for the last ten years. He is married and has three children. Ismayil buys baby calves, fattens them and then sells them to local butchers and residents. Once every two months, he brings the animals to the livestock bazaar. Ismayil is requesting a loan of 800 AZN to purchase three baby calves to raise and sell by August for the highest price.

loans.use: to purchase three calves

loans.name: Alagush's Group

texts.en:
Alagush S., 59, helps her husband in the cattle-breeding business. They have been doing this for 10 years, beginning with 6,000 KGS. Today, they make a monthly profit of 10,000 KGS. Saving up, little by little, they have been able to buy a vehicle. Alagush also works as a bookkeeper. She has four daughters who are all married. She is asking for a loan in order to repair the family’s animal shed, where they sometimes keep their cattle.

Alagush has four partners, all of whom work in a lab at a veterinary clinic (among other things):

Kuliypa A., 55, lives by herself and has a cattle-breeding business. All her children are married. Her younger son helps her with her business which she started five years ago with 2,000 KGS and now makes 3,000 KGS per month. Her first achievement was that she was able to contribute money for her son's wedding. Now she is asking for a loan to buy three calves. She is planning that the calves will graze in the mountains until August.

Gulnara A., 43, works in a veterinary clinic. She is a widow and has four daughters ranging from ages 12 to 19. She plans to use the loan to pay for medical expenses for one of her daughters .

Damira Z. wants to use the loan to buy furniture for her home. She is 55 and married, Her husband used to work on a collective farm but when the collectives broke down, he started breeding cattle. They started this seven years ago with an initial investment of 5,000 KGS. Now they make 4,000 KGS per month and with this profit, they were able to build a house. Damira has one son who is 20 years old and currently at college.

Ainagul A., 58, has a daughter who is a student. Ainagul's husband is retired, so Ainagul and her husband breed cattle to make money. They have been doing this for six years, starting with an initial investment of 3,000 KGS. Now they earn 3,000 KGS per month. With the money received from the loan, Ainagul would like to pay for national mandatory military training. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the Mol Bulak Finance staff.

loans.use: To repair the family's animal shed

loans.name: Elvin

texts.en: Elvin S. is a 26-year-old man who works as a barber in Imishli city. He started his business in 2009 and since that time has gained respect among local men as he is very good with men's haircuts. He applied for a loan of 900 AZN so he can purchase new tools and improve his working conditions. He dreams of building his own barber shop one day.

loans.use: To purchase new tools and improve his working conditions

loans.name: Maria Basilia

texts.es:
María Basilia tiene 36 años, reside en el municipio de San Carlos, departamento de Morazán, es casada vive con sus hijos Geovany, Ángel, de 17 y 9 años y la pequeña Ibeth de 10 meses, ella elabora y vende tortillas de maíz.
Aprendió  el negocio gracias a la madre quien le enseño a elaborar tortillas, este negocio permite solventar las necesidades de la familia y actualmente esta solicitando un préstamo para compra de materia prima Maíz, cal, leña. El crédito le ayudara el cliente a mejorar la situación económica ya que está generando empleo.
El sueño de la cliente es que lo hijos terminen los estudios de bachiller, ya que ella y el esposo no les dieron la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
María Basilia is 36 years old. She lives in the town of San Carlos, Morazán Department. She is married and lives with her children: Geovany and Ángel, ages 17 and 9, and little Ibeth, who is 10 months old. María Basilia prepares and sells corn tortillas. She learned the business thanks to her mother, who taught her to make tortillas. This business allows her to meet her family's needs, and she is currently requesting a loan for the purchase of the raw materials corn, lime and wood. The loan will help this customer to improve her economic situation since it is creating work. The customer's dream is for her children to finish their college studies, since she and her husband were not given the opportunity to study.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, lime, wood

loans.name: Mame Bouye

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Bouye Cisse est une jeune dame de 33 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Dagoudane dans la localité de Yoff. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants  dont l’âge varie entre 2 et 14 ans.
Madame Cisse  a choisi d’exercer le commerce sous l’influence de sa sœur et surtout a cause de  l‘aspect lucratif de l’activité. Elle pratique la vente de languîmes, salade, tomates fraiches et  concombres depuis qu’elle a quitté l’école primaire. 
Elle est sociétaire a la caisse de Yoff depuis juin 2009.Elle n’a jamais bénéficié  de prêt a l’IMCEC. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs pour renforcer son fond et mieux développer  son commerce. Avec l’accroissement de ses bénéfices  elle souhaite améliorer  les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mame Bouye Cisse is a young woman, 33 years old, who lives in the Dagoudane district in the town of Yoff [north of downtown Dakar]. She is married and the mother of three children, between 2 and 14 years of age. She has chosen this line of business thanks to her sister’s influence, and mainly because it was paying well. Ever since dropping out of primary school, she has been selling vegetables, [such as] lettuce, fresh tomatoes and cucumbers. She has been member of the Yoff mutual fund since June 2009. She never had a loan from IMCEC before. She is seeking a loan of 200,000 West African francs to bolster her business capital and to grow her business. She hopes to increase her revenues in order to improve the life conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her business capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: constituer un stock de maïs pour préparation et vente de mets

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Purevsuren D. lives with his wife and nineteen-year old son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. He and his family have lived together in their own yards since 2000. His son, Chimegserchin, has recently graduated a secondary school and will attend a university this year. 

He started up his business by selling a variety of meats to his customers at a rented stall in the local market, in 2002. Also he began an extra business to operate a taxi service within his town. He is a very communicative and open minded person who says " I try my best to provide my child with a higher education." Purevsuren is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian tugrug (MNT) loan to use for several purposes such as: pay his child's tuition fees, pay accomodation fees, and purchase a variety of meats to sell.

loans.use: To pay child's tuition fees

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita B. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Teresita is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Teresita runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Fatima Lizeth

texts.es: Fatima Lizeth tiene 33 años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, pues ella busca la forma de generar ingresos para su hogar, siempre sale a todos los días ella utiliza una chaqueta para protegerse del sol, por lo que la mayoría de sus clientes viven en zonas muy lejanas. A pesar de las dificultades que atraviesa como es el abono de las cuotas de los productos que le ofrecen. Este financiamiento es para la compra de lápiz labial, pintura de uñas, polvos, tratamientos y cremas. Sueña con agrandar su negocio, para proporcionarles a sus 3 hijos lo necesario.
texts.en:
Fatima Lizeth is 33 years old and has been selling cosmetics for more than three years in order to generate income for her household. Every day she heads out with a jacket to protect herself from the sun since most of her customers live in areas that are far away. One of the difficulties she faces is being paid in installments for the products she offers.

This loan will be used to buy lipsticks, nail polishes, powders, treatments, and crèmes. Her dream is to expand her business so that she can provide for the needs of her three children.

loans.use: Purchase lipsticks, nail polishes, powders, treatments, and crèmes

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 32 years old, married and a father of three.  To raise his family, he sells clothes. He started the business 10 years ago and Faulu Kenya has helped him to expand.  He has even managed to employ one person. He hopes to buy a plot of land in the future.  He has requested for 20, 000 Kenyan shillings to buy supplies of clothes.

loans.use: To buy supplies of clothes

loans.name: Siria

texts.es:
La señora Siria P. de  Valdez  esta casada tiene 55  años de edad,  vive en en Barrio Pacua cua en casa propia   tiene 2 hijos. 
La señora Siria   es comerciante, posee un puesto de venta de ropas para damas y caballeros  bien surtida  viaja a Buenos Aires y San Pablo para la compra de sus mercaderías.  Mediante esta actividad pueden solventar  sus gastos y cubrir cualquier imprevisto que se le presente se dedican a esta actividad hace mas de 20 años.  

Ella ha solicitado este crédito para la compra de más mercaderías, remeras, vestidos, blusas, shorts y otros.
texts.en:
Siria P. de  Valdez is married and is 55 years old.  She lives in the Pacua neighborhood in her own home, and she has 2 children.

Siria works in retail trade.  She has a well-stocked post where she sells clothing for men and women.  She travels to Buenos Aires and San Pablo to purchase her merchandise.  Through this activity she can pay her bills and cover any unexpected expenses that might arise. She has been in this line of work for more than 20 years.  

She has requested a loan to buy more merchandise: T-shirts, dresses, blouses, shorts and other items.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, dresses, blouses, shorts and other items of clothing

loans.name: Rouayda

texts.ar:
رويده عوض الساحلي: رويده في عمر 40 سنة متزوجة ولها ولد تعمل من اكثر من 9 سنوات تعمل في بيع الاحذية الاوروبية المستعملة
محل خاص لها لكنه بمبلغ مرتفع تحب تحسين وضع عائلتها المادي والاستفادة من عملها
فهي تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة شراء بضاعة جديدة للمحل وزيادة مدخولها الشهري زبائنها كثر وهم من محيطها
وجيرانها تاريخها الاقتراضي مع المجموعة جيد وقد اثر هذا القرض على حياتها بشكل اجابي
texts.en: Rouayda Awad as-Sahily is a 40-year-old wife and mother of one who has nine years of experience in selling used European footware. She runs her own shop, although the rent is somewhat high. Since Rouayda is keen to improve her family’s financiA. situation and further make the most of her work, she is seeking a loan from A. Majmoua to purchase new merchandise. Rouayda’s many customers come from her neighbors and colleagues. She has a good credit history with A. Majmoua, and the last loan very positively affected her life.

loans.use: Purchase new merchandise for shop.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana M. C. es un microempresaria  en el área de turismo, en la Palma de Puerto Jimenez en el Sur del País. 
En este momento ella necesita un préstamo de ₡400 000 (Cuatrocientos  mil colones) para la reparación de uno de los autobuses que utiliza para transportar a los turistas. De esta manera podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y hacer crecer su empresita.
Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal  Raíces Capitales, una de las más de 100 organizaciones  socias de EDESA.
texts.en:
Luisa M. C. is a small business owner in the area of tourism in La Palma de Puerto Jimenez, located in the southern part of the country.

At this time, she needs a loan of 400,000 Costa Rican Colones (CRC) to repair one of the buses that she uses to transport the tourists.  This way, she will be able to offer better service to her customers and help her small business grow.

She is a member of the Raíces Capitales Communal Credit Enterprise, one of the more than 100 member organizations that make up EDESA.

loans.use: To repair a tourist bus

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bales of used clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Silvia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Silvia D. 33 años D. edad, resiD. en Corinto departamento D. Morazán, vive con su esposo Ramón Antonio tienen cuatro hijos Adonis D. 15 años, José Neris D. 13, Dania Marlenis  y Brayan Ulises D. 6 años D. edad, quienes dependen económicamente D. ellos, ella se dedica a la venta D. antojitos y papas fritas realiza las ventas a diario desD. muy temprano se prepara para preparar la venta y luego sale a trabajar a casas D. los vecinos a realizar los oficios domésticos y por la tarD. se coloca en la venta en su carretón.
Ella está necesitando un préstamo para arreglar el carretón ya que en este realiza las ventas D. papas fritas, también comprara insumos para la preparación D. antojitos (papas, aceite, condimentos), esta ayuda le será muy importante ya que tendrá en buenas condiciones la herramienta importante para la venta que es su carretón, y también contara con los materiales necesarios para seguir en su negocio.
Sus sueños son grandes como ver a sus hijos superados sacarlos adelante con el apoyo D. préstamos a través D. esta institución e ir mejorando la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia is 33 years old.  She lives in the Corinto department of  Morazán with her husband Ramón Antonio.  They have four children (Adonis who is 15,  José Neris who is 13, and Dania Marlenis and Bryan Ulises who are 6 years old) who depend on them economically.  She works selling snacks and french fries, making sales daily.  Very early she gets ready to make sales, and later she goes to work at the houses of her neighbors to do her domestic work, and in the afternoon she works selling in her small cart.  

She needs a loan in order to fix her cart in which she already sells french fries.  Also, she will buy ingredients for the preparation of snacks (potatoes, oil, condiments), this help will be very important so that this important tool for her work, her cart, is in good condition.  Also she will have the materials necessary to continue her business.  Her dreams are big, like seeing her children overcome. to move her children ahead in life with the help of loans through this institution, and to continue improving the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: To repair Silvia's food cart and to buy potatoes, oil, and condiments

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a food selling business for the past one year, selling as retail to her neighbors and passersby. Beatrice faces the major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase on credit. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes and vegetables to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of tomatoes and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es:
Ana es madre de tres hijos, casada, una mujer con su propio negocio, una pulpería con varios años en ventas, iniciando con el apoyo de su mama quien envió remesas desde los Estados Unidos.
Luego atreves de financiamiento con Afodenic, hace crecer sus ventas, aumentado el margen de ganancia, lo que para ella ha sido de mucha satisfacción poder tener su propio negocio. Y poder apoyar a su familia.
Son ocho ciclos lo que ha logrado hacer mejora  a su casa también. Siendo el más viable  por la facilidad de plazos.
 Hoy con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en productos de consumo como: granos básicos, cereales, golosinas, gaseosas. A si como ropa y cosmético logrando más variedad en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is married and the mother of three children.  She has had her own grocery store for several years.  She was able to set up her business with the money her mother sent her from the United States.

She has been able to increase her sales and profits through loans she was given by Afodenic.  She is very happy to have her own business and be able to support her family.

Over an eight year period she was able to use the loans, thanks to their good payment terms, to carry out some home improvements.
 
With this new loan she plans to buy products such as basic grains, cereal, sweets and softdrinks.  She also plans to add a line of clothing and cosmetics to offer more variety at her store.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, cereal, sweets, clothing and cosmetics to increase sales

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a married woman who lives in Cadiz City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a transportation (tricycle) business. Her husband Vicente, who is 63 years old, drives the tricycle to help his wife in earning a living for their family. They have three children who are 15 to 24 years old. Marina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13000 helped her earn a monthly income of PHP 12000, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her eighth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15000, which she intends to use to pay the annual registration of their existing tricycle and buy a new tricycle so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education and house repairs. Marina C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle equipment

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a married woman who lives in Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a general store, a pig fattening business and an e-loading business. Her husband Rey, who is 33 years old, works as a security guard to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. Fe joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Fe has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,800, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 to buy more stock for resale so that she can continue to save up for future business improvement and home repairs. Fe is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi E. is a hairdresser in Korfofordo near Jukwa, Cape Coast. She has received a junior high education. She has been a hairdresser for eight years now. She needs a loan to be able to buy more hair products to use when cutting and styling her customers' hair. She is unmarried, so most of her income is used toward the payment of utility bills and her accommodation. Profits from the loan will be reinvested back into her business by building a shop.

loans.use: To buy more hair products to use when cutting and styling her customers' hair

loans.name: Germaine

texts.en:
Germaine is 39 years old and lives in the Sémé-Podji district of Cotonou with her husband Justin and their four children. All of their children are in school.

For the past eight years, Germaine has been a travelling saleswoman, selling bolts of cloth around her district. This is her fourth loan with ALIDE, following successful past repayments. With this loan, she will purchase more inventory of cloth in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim is to strengthen her business in the short term.

loans.use: To purchase bolts of cloth

loans.name: Thanyaroh Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Thanyaroh” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is John B. S.. John is 25. He was born in northern Sierra Leone. John has 3 children. He sells mobile phones and mobile phone accessories, CDs, etc.. He has been running this business for 5 years now. With the help of this loan, he will expand his business by buying more mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, CDs, etc. to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy more mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, and CDs to add to his business

loans.name: Chhouy

texts.en:
Chhouy C., 24, is married and resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean Temples. 

C. is a watermelon seller, earning an income of about US $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of US $5 per day. They also have a rice farm as a source of income. Each month, the family has to spend US $60 on food and US $20 on other necessary expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of US $900 to purchase a mechanical plow to help plow the rice fields. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a mechanical plow to help plow the rice field.

loans.name: Sotheary

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotheary C. and her husband are teachers. In addition, she also weaves silk at home (as pictured above) when she is not at school and her husband raises cows. The couple has been marred since 2006 and has two young sons. They live across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia

Sotheary is asking for a Kiva loan of $1,200 to purchase silk material for her weaving business. She will use a part of the loan to buy one more cow to raise.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for her weaving business and buy another cow to raise.

loans.name: Panfilo

texts.es:
El señor  Panfilo, tiene 19 años de edad, recientemente se a casado, viven en la comunidad de Uchama baja del municipio de Mizque, del departamento de Cochabamba.
Trabaja en la agricultura, produce  papa, mani y frejol; y los comercializa en el mismo lugar. Es una persona muy respetada en su comunidad, por la dedicación a su trabajo y por ser el responsable de su nuevo hogar.
Esta solicitando el presente crédito para comprar mas semillas e insumos y aumentar mas superficie de sus cultivos y asi aumentar sus ingresos, y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Panfilo is 19 years old. He has recently got married and he lives in Uchama, a community of the municipality of Mizque located in the Cochabamba department.
He engages in agriculture, producing potatoes, peanuts and beans, and he sells his products in his own community. He is a well-respected member of his community, both for being dedicated to his job and for being in charge of his new family.
The loan he is requesting will be used to buy more seeds and materials in order to increase the extension of his lands, consequently increasing his earnings and improving the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and materials.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is 40 years old and her husband Mao is 37 years old. They live in a village that's about 25 kilometers outside of Phnom Penh and have two children, one son and one daughter. One of their children works in a garment factory and another is still in school. Ly is also a garment factory worker and her husband earns a living as a taxi driver. Unfortunately, his motorcycle is old and needs lots of repairs. Ly is applying for her first loan, for $1,000, to buy a new motorbike for her husband.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.es:
Espíritu Santo se denomina a el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Villa Elisa.
Gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Nilda, quien se dedica a la venta comidas y bebidas, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras,una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 6° ciclo,en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro sel programa.
La Sra. Nilda es una mujer muy emprendedora que lucha por sacar adelante a su familia, lucha dia a dia por procurar el sustento de ellos, gracias al credito pretende ampliar su local de venta de comidas y bebidas, para ofrecer asi a sus clientes mas confort y variedad.
texts.en:
'Espíritu Santo' (Holy Spirit) is the name of this excellent group of women from the city of Villa Elisa.

The current leader of the group, Nilda (who sells food and drinks), contacted a loan advisor during a weekly meeting that she had in her area to find out how the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Entrepreneurial Women) worked.  Once she had been advised about the program, she managed to get together a group of 17 women who are now working very happily on their sixth loan cycle.  They are working jointly and supportively within the program.

Nilda is a very entrepreneurial woman who works hard to get her family ahead in life.  She works hard every day to support her family.  She plans to use her loan to extend her business premises from which she sells food and drinks.  In this way, she will be able to offer her customers more comfort and variety.

loans.use: to buy drinks for her business (beer, soda, etc.)

loans.name: Jairo De Jesús

texts.es: Este cliente es trabajador activo del ministerio de educación desempeñándose como profesor de educación primaria con más de doce años de trabajar para esta institución es padre de dos hijos en edad escolar, y de estado civil  casado. Con la institución es el crédito número diez que solicita para la compra de materiales de construcción para ampliar y mejorar su casa de habitación así como su nivel de vida.
texts.en: This borrower is a primary school teacher employed by the Ministry of Education, and he has been working in this capacity for more that twelve years. He is married and he has two children who go to school. This is the tenth loan he has requested to this institution, and he will use it to by construction materials to enlarge and improve his house as well as his standard of living.

loans.use: To by construction materials to enlarge and improve his house.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha, a 59-year-old unmarried woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income to support herself by selling many different kinds of rices in front of her house. She has been engaged in this business for seven years.

Ha requires a loan to purchase rice in bulk from wholesalers and to repair her sewing machine to make clothes. She hopes that by buying larger quantities of rice in bulk she will be able to reduce her costs and offer her rice at more competitive prices to her customers. She also hopes to increase her capacity to make and sell clothing by repairing her sewing machine. 

Ha hopes that through the loan she will increase the turnover of her businesses, increase her income and save money for any future difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase rice in bulk and repair her sewing machine.

loans.name: Leonita

texts.en: Leonita is 45 years old, married and has three children attending school. Leonita's spouse works as a local farmer. With her determination to succeed and increase her family's income, she runs a sari-sari store (variety store) and this drives her daily schedule. Leonita usually earns about 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month. Income generated from the business goes to meeting daily needs at home and paying school fees and allowances of the children. Leonita wants to increase her sales capacity and that is why Leonita is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy soft drinks, canned goods, instant noodles, bread and eggs to sell in her store. She hopes this loan will grow her operations. In the future, Leonita would like to keep making better sales and earn consistent profits. She also would like to educate all her children to have a degree someday and assure them a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, instant noodles, bread and eggs to sell in her store.

loans.name: La Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Altagracia is one of the members of the Group La Esperanza 1 & 2 (Hope), located in the city of San Pedro de Macoris, where the primary economic activities are commerce, industrial cement plants, and household and cosmetic products. Altagracia sells all kind of fruits in a little stall next to her house. After two loans with Esperanza, she expanded has expanded her business. Now she is receiving her third loan.

With this new loan, she is planning to inveS.in more fruit and make some changes to her stand. She wants to attract more customers. She tells us that her challenge is to help her 3 children to grow with health and education, also to help her long-term partner by working hard and bringing extra income to their home. 

Altagracia´s dreams are to improve their lives with a better home, grow a bigger and sustainable business, and to see all her children become professionals and good people. She is planning to reinveS.her profits in the business and save. She wants to start building her house.

She thanks all of you for your support!!

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Juan; el tiene 42 años de edad y es casado y tiene 4 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de maíz, ella se dedica a la agricultura, el siembra maíz y luego lo vende al por mayor a en el mercado de Urubamba, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de maíz. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor. 
                                           
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”. The communal bank is in the district of Urubamba, in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco. 

The member, Mr Juan, is 42 years old. He is married and has 4 children. The member alternates his daily activities with the business of selling corn.

His wife works in agriculture. He sows corn and then sells it in bulk in the Urubamba market. With this business, he is able to give his children a better life. The member wants to expand and improve his corn-selling business. The member is asking for a loan to buy corn in bulk. 

The member is happy with the loan and agrees to the repayments of his loan on time.

loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing, blouses, pants and shorts.

loans.name: Monte De Bendicion 4 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Maria is a member of her group Monte de Bendicion 4 & 6 or "Mount of Blessing". Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. The members are dedicated to doing business around their community and other villages, selling clothing, shoes, cosmetics, underwear, and many other products. Maria runs a homemade sweets business. She offers coconut and other assorted fruit sweets, made in a traditional way.

Maria is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza, which she will use to purchase ingredients like coconut, milk, sugar, vanilla, and fruit. Maria likes the bakery, and she would like to have one in the future with more sweet varieties.

Maria lives with her husband, and she dreams of building her dream house. This would be a beautiful and big house where her family could live and she could run her business. She will reinvest her profits in her business. Maria enjoys working at her home and doing business. She thanks you all for your support!!

loans.use: to buy coconut, milk, sugar, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Isoel

texts.es: Isoel vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge, quien trabaja  con él  y sus dos hijos que se encuentran en las edades de 7 y 9 años respectivamente. Allí tiene una tienda donde vende ranchos, víveres, bebidas, refrescos etc, a una clientela, como las amas de casa de su sector,  que compran diariamente en muy pequeñas cantidades, que van desde 1 onza hasta 1 libra.   En este negocio Isoel tiene 4 años de funcionamiento y 1 de estar en ese lugar. Sus compras las realiza de contado en un mercado de abastos en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla, a 25 minutos de su municipio. En la actualidad el microempresario está solicitando su primer financiamiento a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual  comprará mercancías para surtir adecuadamente la tienda.  Su negocio presenta buena rentabilidad y maneja una buena capacidad de pago. Su meta más adelante es mejorar las condiciones del local  para brindar un ambiente más comercial a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Isoel lives in the town of Soledad with his spouse who works with him and with his two children who are 7 and 9 years old respectively.  He has a store there where he sells snacks, foodstuffs, beverages, soft-drinks, etc. to a clientele consisting of local housewives who daily buy in small quantities ranging from one ounce up to one pound.  Isoel’s store has been in operation for four years and has been in its present location for one year.  He pays cash for the supplies he buys in the central supply market in Barranquilla twenty-five minutes away.  

At present, this micro entrepreneur is asking for his first Fundación Mario Santo Domingo loan which he’ll use to buy merchandise to properly stock his store.  His store earns good profits and he has good capacity to repay the loan.  His goal for later on is to make improvements to the locale to provide a more commercial environment for his customers.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Mrs. Him is a creative woman and the mother of five children. She lives with her husband and her children in Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh city. Mrs. Him decided to work indoors so she can take some time to take care of her little children at home. 

To earn a living, Mrs. Him cuts unnecessary thread off the clothes that are brought from the garment factory nearby. Her income depends on the amount of clothes she is able to finish. She typically earns approximately 2.5 USD each day and works hard to support her family. Her husband also helps to earn the profit for the family by selling fish, which he buys from his suppliers.

Currently, Mrs. Him needs some funds from Kiva, a partner of HKL, in order to support her husband's business. She will use this loan to buy some additional fish to sell. With the remainder of the loan, she wants to fill ground under her wooden house. It is in a low area that always suffers from water in the rainy season.

In the future, she hopes that she will be able to send her children to be educated to a high level.

loans.use: to buy some additional fish to sell

loans.name: Diana Mariela

texts.es:
La Señora. Diana es socia del banco comunal 10 de Agosto, vive por la parroquia Santa Ana (Cuenca), esta parroquia es de clima frió, lugar que tiene una gran belleza natural y desde su centro se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.

La Señora. Diana tiene 29 años, casada y su esposo labora en un taller de  mecánica industrial. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de familiares.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de calzado en un local que es de propiedad, labora hace 6 meses en él de lunes a sábados sin un horario específico.
 
Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la comprar de calzado para su negocio.
 
Su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Diana is a member of the “10 de Agosto” communal bank.  She lives in Santa Ana Parish (Cuenca).  This parish is cold climate.  It has a natural beauty and from its center one can admire a large part of the city of Cuenca.  Its residents raise livestock and farm; many work at various jobs in the city.

Diana is 29 years old and married.  Her husband works at an industrial machine shop.  She does not own a house; she lives with relatives.

She sells all types of footwear in a locale she owns.  She’s been working for six months from Monday through Saturday with no fixed work schedule.

This is the second loan she’s taken with the communal bank and she’ll use it to buy footwear for her business.  Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy footwear.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 59 years old, married, and has five children in school.  To earn a living, he does poultry farming.  He has been in the business for three years.  He also practices crop farming for extra income.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in financial management.  This has helped him to invest his money into his business. He hopes to become the major supplier of eggs in his region in five years.  He has requested 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy chickens (layers).

loans.use: To buy chickens (layers).

loans.name: Ikram

texts.en:
Ikram  is a 44 year old farmer who raises seasonal fruits and vegetables.  He also sells home furniture in his shop.  He has three years of experience. 

Ikram is married and has three sons. 

Ikram`s businesses generates a stable income of about 230 AZN per month.  

He applied for a 600 AZN loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers to enhance his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to enhance his farming business.

loans.name: Marcia Leonor

texts.es: Marcia Leonor tiene 39 años, ella es comerciante de productos varios. Tiene 2 hijos bajo su cargo siempre ha sido una mujer responsable y dedicada. Ella está solicitando este crédito que será destinado para la compra de materiales de construcción como bloques, piedrín, cemento, arena, alambre, hierro y zinc  ella necesita realizar una construccion de una pared en la parte trasera de su vivienda para tener mayor seguridad. Desde hace cuatro años estaba pensando en realizar estas mejoras pero como no tenia los ingresos necesarios no había podido hacerlo, espera que con este crédito pueda realizar su sueño.
texts.en: Marcia Leonor is 39 years old, and she is a retailer selling different products. She has 2 children she is responsible for and she has always been a devoted and responsible woman. She is requesting this loan to invest it in the purchase of construction materials such as blocks, piedrín (a type of building stone), cement, sand, iron and zinc. She will build a wall in the back part of her home so as to make it safer. She has been planning to make these improvements for four years but she was not able to do it because she hadn’t enough money. She hopes she will be able to make her dream come true thanks to this loan.

loans.use: To buy blocks, piedrín (a type of building stone), cement, sand, iron and zinc.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu, 52, is married and has four children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past eight years, she has operated a vegetable stall business, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality.  Especially during the dry, hot season, the availability of vegetables for sale is lower compared to demand. She dreams of establishing a cereals shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Abeteraine Rusolera Group

texts.en:
Pakarasio, aged 48, is a Ugandan male and a father of 5 children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He wants a loan to buy maize and bean produce for resale. He is a produce dealer and has been in this business for four years having started with farming. He is challenged by lack of transport and fluctuating prices of his produce. His dreams are to buy a car to enable him to transport his produce to the market and to educate his five children.
He is a member of a group where by policy each member guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: To buy maize and bean produce for resale

loans.name: Sreyna

texts.en:
Sreyna, age 38, sells Khmer noodles in her village. Khmer noodles or "Num Banh Chok" are considered the national dish of Cambodia. The dish can be served with a green curry soup and banana flowers, bean sprouts, water lily stalks, and cucumber. Her husband, Thy, age 38, is a teacher. The couple has been married since 1995 and have three children who are in school. They live in a village near Phnom Penh City.

Sreyna wants to supplement her business by selling new products including dessert and "Toek Krolok." Toek Krolok is a Khmer word that means smoothie. 

She is asking for her first loan of $800 to buy supplies for her business such as a blender and some tables and chairs.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business such as a blender, table, and chairs.

loans.name: Roeun's Group

texts.en:
Roeun, 47, is married and has five children who are all still in school. She and her husband are maize farmers in the local Ratanak Mondul district. This has been their main business for more than ten years. Sometimes, they work for others for pay to better support their family. 
Roeun has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for three years while other group members have been with VisionFund from one to eight years. The loans have helped Roeun afford sufficient food and make a better living. She has paid back her loans from VisionFund. 
Roeun's group is requesting another loan. As the group leader, she wants to buy maize seed and fertilizer for her maize plantation. She hopes to grow more maize to earn a better income in order to improve her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy maize seed and fertilizer for her maize plantation.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en: Mwanajuma is taking another Kiva loan of KSHS 20,000 to boost her food stall business. With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase more sacks of potatoes. She dreams of expanding her business to get more profit and boost her living standards. Thanks to Kiva lenders and Yehu for giving her an opportunity to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of potatoes.

loans.name: Arelis Iris

texts.es:
Arelis es una persona muy emprendedora, tiene 24 años de edad y vive en el Distrito de Santiago junto a sus padres y sus 2 hijos.
Al ser madre soltera tuvo que luchar sola para sacar adelante a sus hijos y poder darle todas las comodidades que ellos merecen. Desde hace casi 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy proactiva, entusiasta y muy amable con todos los clientes. Ella también está estudiando la carrera profesional de Lengua y Literatura para poder tener una profesión y encontrar un trabajo más remunerado.
Arelis está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para surtir el negocio y de esta manera pueda tener más ingresos y con esto más adelante podrá cumplir su más grande sueño: "Tener su casa propia y darle una educación de calidad a sus hijos".
texts.en:
Arelis is a very enterprising person. She is 24 years old and lives in the District of Santiago with her parents and two children. Being a single mother, she had to struggle to provide for her children and to be able to give them the things they deserve. She has been working for almost two years in the sale of clothing and it is doing well because she is a very proactive and enthusiastic person and very friendly with all of her clients. 

She is also studying for a degree in Language and Literature in order to have a profession and to find a better paying job. Arelis is very appreciative of the the Kiva lenders because, with the assistance they have given her, she will be able to buy merchandise to supply her business. In this way she will be able to have more income and, in the future, realize her greatest dream: to have a her own house and to provide a good quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve on capital

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga D. was born in Aného in 1970. She is married and the mother of four. Aside from her children, she also is responsible for two sisters in apprenticeships. The income from her business did not allow her to cover all household and family expenses. So to make ends meet, she traded a little in various items. Since setting up her hair salon, she has been refining her art of hairdressing, something that draws in the customers. Today, her 15 years of experience in this business has earned her the title of greatest hairdresser in her neighborhood.

Ms. D. is requesting a loan of $800 to acquire hair dryers and to better meet the needs of her customers. Then she will be able to win their loyalty, to gain other customers, and thus augment her bottom line. And that all adds up to financial independence for her.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1970 à Aného, Madame D. Olga est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants. Outre ces derniers, elle a à sa charge deux (02) sœurs en apprentissage. Les revenus de son activité ne lui permettent pas d’assumer toutes les dépenses du foyer. Pour joindre alors les deux bouts, il fait de petits commerces de divers. Depuis l’installation de son salon, elle développe un art de faire ses coiffures, qui attire sa clientèle. Aujourd’hui, elle possède une expérience de 15 ans d’activités qui lui confèrent le titre de la plus grande coiffeuse de son quartier.

Elle sollicite un crédit de $800 pour acheter des séchoirs et satisfaire plus les besoins de sa clientèle. Ainsi, elle pourra fidéliser sa clientèle, en gagner d’autres qui feront augmenter son chiffre d’affaires synonyme d’autonomie financière de Madame D..

loans.use: To buy hair dryers

loans.name: Be Be Ko

texts.en:
Be Be Ko is 40 years old. She lives in District 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives with her family and her husband is sick at home and can't work.

She took her 3rd loan cycle and opened a general store for her son. His business is good. Now his mother wants to take anther loan to expand the business so that her son can help support the whole family.

loans.use: to buy extra thing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her bead and clothing sales business

loans.name: Sayaad Ramzhan

texts.en:
Sayaad Ramzhan lives in district 13 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and is an educated man. He has the responsibility of taking care of his family and his brother's family because his brother died a few years ago. He is supporting their children.
