Rhesa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Rhesa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like canned goods & snack foods. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rhesa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods & snack foods.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 30 years old and married. She has two children, aged 2 and 3. She is a farmer working in Banga, South Cotabato. Grace tills her land, where she grows rice and corn crops. Grace does her best to improve her earnings and provide for the needs of her household.

Grace's loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes to earn better and be able to save for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married with four children. Rosemarie is 43 years old and lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. 

Rosemarie owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 5,000 to purchase more products such as soap, shampoo, and toothpaste for her general store.

Rosemarie has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to use the additional income from the business to supplement her family's income and use for their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as shampoo and soap for her general store

location.town: Liloy-La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Jesús Salvador

texts.es:
La Tienda de Jesús es el nombre que este emprendedor decidió darle a su negocio de venta de productos de la canasta familiar, ubicado en Medellín, a sus 60 años de edad la falta de oportunidades para conseguir trabajo hicieron que desde hace cuatro años, Jesús iniciara con su negocio. 

Actualmente Jesús necesita de un préstamo para comprar algunos artículos que le permitirán ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes como harina, arroz, aceite, fríjoles, entre otros, así incrementará sus ventas y mejorarán sus ingresos.
texts.en:
“La Tienda de Jesús” (Jesús’ Store) is the name this entrepreneur decided to give his business.  He sells basic household items and is located in Medellín.  

At the age of 60, employment opportunities were few which led Jesús to start this business four years ago.

At present, Jesús needs a loan to buy some items like, rice, oil, and beans, among others, that will make it possible for him to offer greater variety to his customers thus increasing sales and improving profits.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, flour and beans, among others.

loans.name: Teresa América

texts.es:
En la ciudad turística de Catarina, reside doña  Teresa América, quien labora para la institución de Alcaldía Municipal desde hace catorce años, como Responsable de Finanzas, es casada con cinco hijos  menores, trabaja  arduamente para darle las condiciones necesarias.
Unas de las necesidades que está atravesando la familia de doña  Teresa es ampliar su casa para la construcción de la habitación de sus hijos,  ya que tres están en edad adolecente y necesitan sus habitaciones para mayor privacidad es por eso que  se acerco a las oficina de Ceprodel  para solicitarnos un crédito para poder comprar materiales de construcción como piedras, cemento y arena y así brindarle mayor seguridad a sus hijos y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa América lives in the tourist city of Catarina.  She has worked as the head of finances for the government of the municipality for 14 years.  She is married and has five minor children.  She works arduously to give them the necessities.  

One of the necessities that Teresa’s family is experiencing is expanding their house to build a room for their children.  Three of them are adolescents, and they need their rooms for greater privacy.

That is why she came to the Ceprodel office to request a loan from us.  The loan is to be able to buy construction materials like rocks, cement, and sand.  That way they will give their children greater security and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal roofing and roofing beams.

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en:
Lanh, 41 years old, is married and has a daughter. She lives with her husband and her daughter in Ho Chi Minh City.

Lanh's husband earns money as a bricklayer. Lanh supports her family by sewing masks at her house. Lanh intends to use her loan to buy fabric and materials to increase her production of masks and also to make small repairs to her house.

Lanh hopes her business runs smoothly and that will help to improve her family's living conditions and send her daughter to school.

loans.use: to buy fabric, materials and repair her house

loans.name: Dung's Group

texts.en:
Dung, the leader of this 5-member group loan, was born in 1966 and lives in Khu 5 village, where she has two children who are going to school. Her husband is a carpenter, and her family has a workshop where she and her husband work, earning a monthly income of about 7.000.000 Vietnamdong(VND). This will be her first loan from SEDA as she seeks to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy wood.

The other members of the group are:

Gai, a 49-year-old mother of two children, who wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy chicken feed;

Oanh, a 33-year-old mother of three, who wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy wood;

Dan, a 42-year-old mother of two, who wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to breed the pigs and poultry;

Dinh, a 33-year-old mother of two, who wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Nayla Johanna

texts.es:
Nayla de 32 años camina mucho ofreciendo su mercadería, ella recorre todos los dias de 7:00 am a 20:00,  vende ropa de damas, caballeros y niños con la dificultad que amenaza a su barrio que es la delincuencia y la competencia aunque piensa que para todos hay mercado.Su esposo Edicto es albañil pero cuando la demanda está baja se dedica a hacer fletes en su camioneta, tienen 2 hijos los cuales estudian en la escuela, los que dice son su orgullo.
Ellos quieren comprar cemento, hierro y fierro para terminar de construir su casa que es mixta, motivo por el requieren un préstamo para seguir con su negocio y hacerles un dormitorio a cada uno de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nayla, 32, walks a lot to sell her merchandise.  She wanders daily from 7am until 8pm.  She sells women’s, men’s and children’s clothes despite her neighborhood’s high crime rate and competition, although she believes that there’s market enough for everyone.  Her husband’s a bricklayer but when demand is low he does delivery services with his truck.  They have two children going to school and she says that they are her pride.

They want to buy cement, iron rods and metal to finish building their house, which is mixed, which is the reason why they need a loan to stay in business and to build bedrooms for each of their children.

loans.use: to buy cement, iron rods and metal.

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Purificacion; ella tiene 54 años de edad y es casada y tiene 7 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras y también se dedica al negocio de agricultura, ella siembra maíz y luego vende las verduras como tomates, cebollas, zapallos entre otras verduras y también vende maíz en forma ambulatoria, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar verduras como zapallos, tomates, zanahorias y comprar semillas para las tierras de cultivo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Sra. Purificacion, 54, is a member of the VIRGEN NATIVIDAD community bank in Urubamba, a district in the "departamento" of Cusco.  

Sra. Purificacion is married and has 7 children.  She spends part of her workday tending her farm and the rest working as a street vendor, operating a vegetable-sales business.  She sells tomatoes, onions, pumpkins and other vegetables, along with maize.  She grows maize on her farm, as well.  She works from 8:00am to 7:00pm.  The businesses have been her means of supporting her children.  Sra. Purificacion is applying for a loan, part of which she will use to buy pumpkins, tomatoes and carrots for her vegetable-sales business and the rest to buy seeds for her farming business.  

She is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business and seeds for her farming business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 38 años, una mujer fuerte y valerosa, que en compañía de su esposo Erasmo, cuidan de sus hijos: Johan y Kevin. Ellos son una familia unida y con aspiraciones, que viven en la zona rural de Casacoto. Ella menciona que la mejor herencia que dejará a sus hijos, es el estudio; por eso está trabajando muy duro para pagar la universidad de sus dos retoños adolescentes. A pesar de su edad. Juana afirma que son muy responsables y que la ayudan en el cuidado de sus cultivos. Ya tiene 16 años dedicándose a ello y como buena agricultora, la mayor parte del día la pasa en sus sembríos de papa y hortalizas; los que en cada cosecha, según cuenta, le brindan buenas utilidades, pues viaja al mercado central de la capital, donde comercializa sus productos al por mayor; sin embargo en tiempos de escasa producción, los vendedores minoristas de su ciudad comprar sus cultivos a menor precio, eso la molesta mucho. Pero no la desanima, al contrario le da fortaleza para seguir adelante, ya que vende carne de ovino los días miércoles y domingo en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde obtiene un dinero extra. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Miraflores de casacoto” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo de los integrantes de su banco comunal, augurando muchos éxitos, ya que son buenos y honestos. Asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Juana tiene sembrado papa de la variedad “andina”, por ello de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y el pago del salario a los peones que le ayudan en la cosecha.
texts.en:
38-year-old Juana is a strong and brave woman who, together with her husband Erasmo, cares for her children Johan and Kevin.  They are a united family with aspirations who live in the rural area of Casacoto.

Juana mentions that the best inheritance she will leave her children is an education.  For this reason, she is working very hard so that she can pay for her two growing teenagers' university education.  In spite of their age, Juana tells us that they are very responsible and help her in caring for her crops.  Juana has been in this business for 16 years and, as she is a good farmer, she spends most of her day amongst her potato and vegetable crops.  She tells us that every harvest time they provide her with good profits as she travels to the central market in the capital where she sells them wholesale.  However, during periods of lower production, the retailers in her town buy her crops at a lower price.  This bothers her a lot.  However, she does not lose heart.  On the contrary, it gives her the strength to get ahead.  On Wednesdays and Sundays she sells meat from sheep in the wholesale market in town.  This makes her additional money.

Juana belongs to the 'Miraflores de Casacoto' community bank and this is her fourth loan from MFP.  She is grateful for the support of the other members of her community bank.  She predicts a lot of success as the bank members are good and honest people.  For her part, she pledges to make her loan repayments punctually.  Juana has sown 'andina' variety potatoes and, with your support, she will invest the money she has requested in buying natural fertilizers and in paying the salary of the laborers who will help her with her harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and hire laborers

loans.name: Las Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS VENCEDORAS” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Fabiana es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejidos artesanales, macramé, tejido a máquina, tejido de mantas, artesanías en aguayos

La señora Fabiana,  indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía en tejidos que viene trabajando hace años atrás.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará en diferentes ferias de la cuidad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la discreción del personal.
texts.en:
The Las Vencedoras ["the winners"] borrowing group will be taking out its third loan with Pro Mujer Bolivia [Kiva field partner] as a part of the Panamericana regional office. The group is composed of nine women and is led by an executive council, of which Fabiana is the president. The businesses run by the members are various and include artisanal weaving, macramé, loom weaving, blanket weaving, crafts, and colorful aguayo fabrics. 

Fabiana says that she has worked with Pro Mujer for a year and became involved with the institution through the invitation of a promoter. Currently, she has an artisanal fabric business that she has been operating for years. This loan will be used to buy wool, which she will purchase at the Ceja market and then weave and sell in various markets and festivals in the city of El Alto. This line of work allows her to build up resources to support her family, as she is a single woman. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she appreciates the personal independence.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora verónica tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo de cinco años.

Ella tiene seis años de dedicarse a elaborar pan de forma artesanal, fue su mamá quien le enseño este oficio, ya que su mamá quedo viuda y creció a sus tres hermanos sola, por lo que les enseño a defenderse y a ganarse la vida. Ellas hacían tamales y pupusas antes de que falleciera su padre.

Para comprar los materiales que necesita para realizar su trabajo como maíz, harina, queso, entre otros, ella debe trasladarse hasta la ciudad, para esto ella aborda un bus que tarda unas cinco horas de ida y vuelta a su casa, esto lo hace una vez por semana.

Ella solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar suficientes materiales para tener a disposición por los pedidos que le hacen en la comunidad, tiene mucha demanda ya que su pan es elaborado de forma artesanal y no es común como las quesadillas, tortas y pastelitos. Ella elabora el pan y lo sale a vender tres veces a la semana de casa en casa a pie a las comunidades.

Con el préstamo espera obtener más ganancias y de esta forma podrá ayudar a su compañero de vida con los gastos del hogar como alimentación, salud, educación y comprar medicamentos para su hijo, ya que padece de una enfermedad y tiene un tratamiento costoso y los ingresos actualmente no son suficientes.

Ella quiere ahorrar con los ingresos que genere el aumento de la producción de pan para ayudar a su compañero de vida a comprar un lote y construir su casa, ya que ellos viven en casa de un familiar del esposo, además  quiere que su hijo asista a la escuela el próximo año.
texts.en: Verónica is 28 years old and lives with her husband and their 5-year-old son. For the past six years she has made a living baking artisan bread. Her mother taught her this trade. She was a widow and had to raise Verónica and her three siblings on her own, so she taught her children how to fend for themselves and get ahead in life. They made tamales and pupusas before her father died. To buy the materials she needs to make her products, such as corn, flour, cheese and other items, Verónica has to travel to the city once a week, boarding a bus that takes five hours round trip from her house. She is requesting the loan from Kiva partner Fundación Campo to purchase the ingredients she needs to fulfill the orders she has in her community. Her demand is really high since her handmade products, such as quesadillas, tortas and cupcakes, are uncommon. She bakes the bread and goes out to sell it door to door through the community three times a week. With the loan, she hopes to earn more profits and in this way she can help her husband with household expenses like food, health and education, and pay for medicine for her son, who is sick and has costly treatments, and right now their income isn't enough to cover it. Verónica wants to save what she makes from increasing her production to help her husband buy a lot and build a home, since they live in the house of one of her spouse's relatives. Furthermore, she wants her son to attend school next year.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make larger quantities of bread.

loans.name: Adija

texts.en: Adija is a determined businesswoman.  Twenty-eight years old, she is single and blessed with two children. She has been selling skins and hides for the last five years to make a living. Previously, she sold handbags. Adija has retained her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next five years, she wants to become the distributor of the skins and hides in her region. With the loan she has requested for 40,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy hides and skin for resale. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business with a previous loan.

loans.use: to buy hides and skin.

loans.name: Las Tejedoras Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la ciudad de Caacupé. Las Señoras del comité Las tejedoras, son personas muy trabajadoras,  ellas están muy agradecidas con la fundación porque gracias a las facilidades pueden invertir en sus negocios y otras las nuevas miembros iniciar una actividad comercial.
La presidenta, la Sra. Norma, vive con su marido e hijos, ella se dedica al comercio de todo tipo de cosas, como ser, ropa, artículos de mercería y otros. Comenta que hace poco paso por una de las peores experiencias, pues falleció su bebe recién nacido, pero ella de igual manera sigue siendo muy activa en el grupo e incluso ayuda a otros grupos de la zona. Ella junto con sus compañeras realiza constantes actividades y de ese modo fomentar la integración entre las compañeras y tratar de adelantar sus cuotas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, como ser remeras, pantalones y demás para tener más variedad de prendas para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The women in this group are from the city of Caacupé.  They are members of the sewing group and are very hard-working.  They are very grateful for the foundation's assistance in growing their businesses and commercial activities.
The group's director, Norma, lives with her husband and children and sells varied articles such as clothing, accessories and other items. Sadly, she recently lost a newborn baby, but despite this continues to be active with the group, working with other women in her area.  The women realize that by working together they can achieve greater productivity to meet their orders.  Norma seeks this credit to buy clothing such as shirts and pants, and to offer a greater variety of items to her clients.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants and other clothes

loans.name: John

texts.en: John used the previous loan to buy a motorcycle and this enabled him to overcome his challenge of having to remit his daily income to his boss. He now has hardships of high fuel costs and seasonal weather challenges.  He would like to buy land for construction and growing crops. John intends to use this loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Nailepu

texts.en:
Nailepu is a very hard working woman who practices mixed farming. She has been in this business for over ten years. She is 37 years old and married, they have five children. 

She is applying for her second  loan. She plans to use the loan to buy farm inputs including maize seeds and fertilizers. 

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees. She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future

loans.use: to buy farm inputs including maize seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LLANCASUN DE ARIN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sabina; ella tiene 27 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno donde cultiva cebollas, zanahorias y maíz y luego lo vende en el mercado de Calca desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de  agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "LLANCASUN DE ARIN", which is located in the district of Calca, in Calca Province, in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Sabina is 27 years old and has a common-law husband and three children.  In addition to her daily activities she also has a patch of land where she grows onions, carrots and corn which she sells at the market in Calca.  She works from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and is able to provide for her children through her work.  She wants to increase her agriculture business and has requested a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her cropland.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for her cropland.

loans.name: Bayanjargal

texts.en:
Bayanjargal, 31, lives with his wife and three children, all of whom attend school, in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd Province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business, a wool-felting enterprise which he started earlier this year that produces handmade felt products such as slippers and boots.

Because his felting machine is old and very slow, in order to meet customer demand he is requesting 700,000 MNT to buy a new one.

loans.use: to buy a new felting machine.

loans.name: Sarybay

texts.ru: Сарыбаю 54 года, женат, воспитал пятерых детей. В поисках  средств дохода для своей семьи, в 2002 году Сарыбай начал свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. На 3,0 га орошаемой земли Сарыбай выращивает картофель, кукурузу и пшеницу, а также имеет в хозяйстве 3 головы коров и 5 баранов. Благодаря упорству и настойчивости Сарыбая, его хозяйство на сегодняшний день приносит от 5,000 до 25,000 сом (KGS)в сезон. Также, в несезонное время Сарыбай предоставляет услуги такси. В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Сарыбай обратился в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян пшеницы и картофеля, боронирование земли и покупку минеральных удобрений. Доходы от кредита Сарыбай планирует вложить в постройку более удобного  и вместительного сарая и постройку забора.
texts.en: Sarybay is 54 years old, married and has raised five children.  In search of income sources for his family, he started his own animal husbandry and farming business in 2002.  He grows potatoes, corn and wheat on three hectares of arable land, and also has three heads of cattle and five sheep.  Thanks to Sarybay's tenacity and persistence, his business yields from 5,000 to 25,000 som (KGS) per season today.  He also provides a taxi service during the off-season.  In order to further expand his business, Sarybay requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase wheat and potato seeds, treat land and purchase mineral fertilizers.  He plans to invest the profit from this loan into building a more comfortable and spacious barn and building a fence.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is a married woman and has two children. She is 43 years old and resides at Dalapang, Ozamis City, Philippines. She owns and operates a coco land (fertile ground planted in coconut trees). She plants & harvests coconut for sale to earn a living and she's been 10 years in this business. Each month, she earns 3,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 7,249 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2008, Rosalita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Saybatou

texts.fr: Saybatou est cultivateur âgé de 72 ans il est marié et père de 15 enfants, il a commencé à exercer cette activité depuis qu'il est tout petit.Avec ce crédit,il va acheter du semence de tomate, d'onions, d'herbicide et d'engrais.
texts.en: Saybatou is a 72-year-old farmer, who is married and father to 15 children. He started this business when he was very young. With this loan, he will buy onion and tomato seeds, herbicide and fertilizer.

loans.use: Achat de semence de tomate, d'onions, d'herbicides et d'engrais.

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar is a 25-year-old married man, from Batumi city. He lives with his parents, wife, and young daughter. His father is a sailor and his mother works at the local restaurants as a chef. Nodar had started his own private trading, after several unsuccessful attempts to get any stable job. So he buys pillows and mattresses at wholesale prices and sells them himself in various regions. However he doesn't generate significant income and has a great desire somehow to increase turnover and increase living conditions for his family. He planned to purchase a bench and manufacture the product himself. 

Nodar will have a small factory and produce pillows and mattresses at much lower prices. Nodar has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Nodar and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life.

loans.use: to start manufacturing pillows and mattresses

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.en:
Juanita is 38 years old, married with a technical electrician and mother of three children Jair, Christian and Miriam- she lives for her family. Juanita started a small business of renting video games and built in front of her house a small place to run the business along with a groceries store. Juanita wanted to have extra income to support her husband with the family expenses and support her children’s education. She also loves her children and wants to give them professional studies.

She is requesting a loan of $650 USD to purchase merchandise for her business and face the demand increase from the next discharge season of sales. She requires 5-10 months to return the loan.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Juanita es una mujer de 38 años muy trabajadora, ella esta casada y su esposo es técnico electricista, tienen tres hijos, Jair, Christian y Miriam, de 15, 14 y 10 años respectivamente.

Ella inició un pequeño negocio de renta de videojuegos y luego construyó un pequeño local en el frente de su casa para ir complementándolo con venta de abarrotes, la idea que tenía en mente era obtener un ingreso adicional al de su esposo para poder solventar los gastos del hogar y sobre todo la educación de sus hijos, ya que quieren apoyarlos para que estudien una carrera profesional.

En estos momentos Juanita necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 650 USD para poder surtir de mercancías su negocio y de esa forma poder hacer frente al incremento en sus ventas que se da en la próxima temporada del año. El plazo que requiere para pagar es de 5-10 meses.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.en:
Born in 1979 in Aklakou where he presently resides, Yaovi S. is a young barber, married and the father of four children. After secondary school, he began as an apprentice barber and did brilliantly. In the 15 years since he opened his own barbershop, he has never disappointed his clientele. This amount of experience raises him above other barbers in his area. Having lost their parents at a young age, his brothers and sisters also live off of the revenue of his business, which is meager due to his lacking the means to purchase adequate supplies for his work.

He is now asking for a loan (his first one) of $1000 to permit him to move his shop to a better area and modernize his business by buying a new stock of barbering supplies such as electric clippers, etc. This will allow him to satisfy a maximum of clientele and increase his profits in order to improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: Re-opening of a barbershop and purchase of new stock

loans.name: Nelly Margarita

texts.en:
Nelly is 32 years old and she is from Monterrey. She is married to David; he is an employee in a factory. They have a son and his name is also David and he is 10 years old.

Nelly has always has worked in her own business. She sells makeup and beauty products to friends, neighbors and relatives. She began to do it because she needed to help her husband with their family expenses. With this activity she is helping him and taking care of her son.

Now she is requesting a loan of $750.00 to increase her inventory for the next Mother’s Day that we are going to celebrate here in Mexico, so that she will be able to sell more and make her business grow.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Convert his vegetable stand into a grocery shop/stall

loans.name: Carlos Silva

texts.pt:
Carlos Silva S. is 46 years old, father of 2. He was born in Manhiça and raised by his parents. His family’s financial situation did not allow him to attend school. Since he was very young he started his own businesses. Today, he owns 3 small stores in Vila da Matola-Rio, Laulane, and in the city of Maputo. Carlos was introduced to HLUVUKU-ADSEMA by a friend. There he requested his first loans in hopes to expand his business. Carlos’ business is very close to the community, employing 3 full time workers (two men and one woman). Carlos supports his family with the income from the business.

With the loan of 38.600,00MT, Carlos plans on increasing and diversifying the stock of his stores in order to keep up with demand and compete with other stores. The business has a positive impact in his community because it creates employment for Carlos and his wife, as well as 3 other employees. In addition, the stores also bring quality products closer to the residents of Matola-Rio which is 15 kilometers away from the city of Maputo.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

LOCALIZACAO: Matola-Rio CLIENTE: Carlos Silva S. SECTOR DE ACTIVIDADE: Comercio VALOR DO EMPRESTIMO: 38.600,00 MT (1,544.00US$) Aplicaçao do montante: Venda de produtos da primeira necessidade e refrigerantes.. Inicio: 30/08/2007 Fim: 31/10/2007

Carlos Silva S., de 46 anos de idade, natural da Manhiça, pai de 2 filhos, cresceu sob a responsabilidade dos pais, a situaçao financeira da familia criou lhe poucas oportunidades para estudar. Desde jovem assume na integra a gestao de um negocio pessoal e possui 3 pequenos estabelecimentos comercias em pleno funcionamento da vila da Matola-Rio e em Laulane na cidade de Maputo. Atravez da conversa com um colega, soube da existểncia da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA, tendo solicitado um emprestimo para ampliaçao do seu negocio. A sua actividade esta bem inserida na comunidade e providencia emprego a 3 trabalhadores (dois homens e uma senhora), com os rendimentos do negocio, garante a sobrevivencia da sua familia.

Com o emprestimo de 38.600,00 MT pretende aumentar o volume de mercadoria, diversificar produtos de forma a evitar roptura de stock nas suas lojas e pretende concorrer em pế de igualidade de oportunidades com os concorrentes. A sua actividade tem um impacto maior na comunidade pois alem de providenciar emprego a sua esposa mais 3 trabalhadores, coloca o produto mais proximo dos residentes da Matola-Rio que distam 15 km da cidade de Maputo.

loans.use: To increase stocks in his shop

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Mrs. Helen O. a 21 years old, is married with six children, and she lives in Benin City. She sells engine oil to drivers in retail. She started her business in the year 1997. According to her if the loan amount of $350 is given to her, it will help her to buy more engine oil. She is a dedicated LAPO client.

loans.use: Helen would like to buy more engine oil to sell.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Doña Maria Teresa has a business in the central market in Leon. She sells natural drinks, sodas, juices, purified water, cookies, etc. She has been working this business for 18 years, having started with $6 dollars for the sugar and the fruits to make her first sales. Her mother also had a restaurant and encouraged her to start the refresquería (beverage store, juice stand).

Maria Teresa was a housewife, even though she has not children, she helps her mother and father financially. Her loans are for investing in her business, buying the different products she sells there. She has been working with loans for 3 years, and has had 16 loans. This is a way for her to support her business, and has allowed her to increase her inventory and working capital for the benefit of her business. She feels very thankful for the help she receives.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Doña Maria Teresa tiene un negocio en el Mercado Central de Leon, vende refrescos naturales, gaseosas, jugos, agua purificada, galletas...etc. Tiene 18 años trabajando en este negocio, comenzó con 6 dólares para el azucar y las frutas y hacer sus primeras ventas. Su mamá tennia comidería y la indujo a poner al refresqueria.

Ella era ama de casa, aunque no tiene hijos, ayuda economicamente a su mamá y a su papá, sus créditos son para invertir en su negocio en la compra de los diferentes productos que ahi vende. LLeva 3 años trabajando con los créditos,ha tenido 16 créditos y esto es para ella una manera de mantener su negocio, le ha permitido aumentar su inventario y capital de trabajo para el beneficio del negocio, se siente bien agradecida por la ayuda que recibe.

loans.use: Working capital (buying fruits and merchandise for juice store) (Capital de Trabajo)

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
After looking for a job for several days and not being able to find anything, Concepcion decided to start her own business that would generate income. She decided to work in transportation with a used bus she bought with her savings. In the beginning her income was low, but little by little her clientele grew.

However, right now she is not able to work because her bus is used and has several problems. This has affected her household finances negatively, because she has 4 children to support. This is why Concepcioon is requesting a loan for US $925, which she is willing to pay in a period of 4 months. With this money she will be able to buy spare parts for her bus, and so continue offering the service to her customers. With your help Concepcion will be able to overcome this problem that stopped her business, and at the same time help support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Después de buscar por varios días trabajo y no encontrar, Concepción decidió iniciar su propio negocio que le dejara ingresos, el cual decidió dedicarse a manejar transporte público que con sus ahorro compró un camión usado, los primeros días fueron pocos sus ingresos, pero poco a poco fue adquiriendo clientela.

Sin embargo actualmente no a podido trabajar debido a que su autobús es usado ya tiene varias fallas, y esto está afectando la economía de su casa, puesto que tiene 4 hijos que mantener. Es por eso que Concepción está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses, y con este dinero Concepción podrá comprar refacciones para su transporte, y así seguirle brindando el servicio a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Concepción podrá salir delante de este problema que paró su negocio y al mismo tiempo ayudar a solventar los gastos de sus hijos.

loans.use: repairing her bus (Reparar el autobus)

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with two children. Her family lives in Mukachevo, where Nataliya runs a small business selling leather purses and wallets in the local shopping mall. She has been in this trade for 10 years. Her business venture has been marked by stability and high demand for all her inventory. Currently, Nataliya has about $800 in inventory on hand. 

Nataliya would like to get a loan of $1200 to increase her turnover capital and assorted inventory. She has invested tremendous effort in her trade and is not going to stop where she is at right now. Nataliya believes that her business and marketing abilities, in combination with financial assistance, will help increase her income and success.

loans.use: To increase inventory and turnover capital

loans.name: Salelavalu Tai Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
Salelavalu Tai is a fishing village next to the capital town of Salelologa on the Savaii Island of Samoa. The village has a well-organized womens' committee. When one of the villagers heard about South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) opening up in Savaii over the radio, she immediately headed to the SPBD field office to ask for details.

A SPBD staff member visited the village and conducted a preliminary meeting to orient them to microfinance. The first group of women attended four sessions of training and were assisted in drawing up their respective business plans. Most of the ladies have existing fishing activities. Their husbands and sons do the fishing, and the wives and daughters sell the fish in the Salelologa market, which is about 20 kilometers from the village. They are very hardworking ladies and they look forward to the loans from SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase wooden canoes, fishing nets, swimming shoes, a spear, a torch (flashlight), goggles and other fishing gear

loans.name: Teresah

texts.en:
Teresah is the operator of a traveling bag (suitcase) and dressing bag business. She has operated the business for three years, but recently got sick and was unable to restock her inventory. She has now rejoined her trust group and is planning on using this loan to restock her inventory. She was a long-term member of the trust group and started by selling simply lingerie and undergarments and then expanded to more expensive bags.

In addition to running her business, Teresah is taking care of her sister’s four children. Her sister passed away recently.

Teresah is a member of the trust group Nyame Nsa Wom (God’s Hand Is In It). The trust group uses peer pressure as a type of social collateral that ensures each member repays their share of the loan.

loans.use: To restart her traveling and dressing bag business

loans.name: Kintu Rebecca, Kavule Effort Group

texts.en:
Beatrice N. and Rebecca K. are members of the Kavule Effort in Mukono. Beatrice has a dairy on Nabuti road and she would like a loan to help buy more milk for her customers.

Rebecca makes delicious half cakes, donuts, and other confectioneries that she supplies to shops, supermarkets, and school children on their way to school. Rebecca is married with four children and cares for thirteen grandchildren. Although the burden of paying school fees is sorted by her son, who stays in the United States.

loans.use: Rebecca would buy more flour and cooking oil for her business. Beatrice would buy milk for her dairy and complete payment for her children's school fees.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha A. A. was born in 1950. She is one of three wives married to a polygamist and a mother of six children, all above the age of 15. However, she cares for two young grandchildren: “My son’s wife died leaving me a young baby; then my daughter who was unmarried died , leaving a two-month-old baby with me. She further explains, “I am the only person left to take care of the family; my children are not doing anything to bring in a living and my husband is a subsistence farmer who brings no income to the family.”
	Tabitha has being a member of GHAPE for three years now and has successfully repaid two loans, both of which she invested in the buying and selling of kola nuts, animal feed, beans, and farming crops like beans, maize, cassava, corn, and potatoes. The profits have helped her to pay school fees for her children and other basic needs of her family.
	Tabitha is requesting a loan to expand her kola nuts business and to increase the size of her farm by adding more land. She is convinced her business is going to succeed because nearly all men eat kola nuts no matter how the economy suffers. Her farm currently provides her family with all the staple crops, and if she farms more land, she may be able to sell the surplus.
She plans to repay this loan in 18 months and the first installment repayment begins four months after disbursement.

loans.use: To buy kola nuts and beans

loans.name: Comité Alegría Group

texts.en:
This group was formed in July of 2006. The group contact is Teresa Dejesus V., who learned about the group thanks to members of the group “United Women of San José, Lambaré. This group is made up of 20 women of the settlement “San José of the neighborhood of San Isidro of Lambaré.”

This system of credit helps the women know each other as more than just neighbors – as friends. They sell items such as chicken, hamburgers, and sausage, in order to raise petty cash together as a group. They are in solidarity with one another.

They are requesting the loan in order to buy merchandise for their business, such as clothing, lingerie, ingredients for cakes and different meals, jewelry, and other stuffs.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for their business, such as clothing, lingerie, ingredients for cakes and different meals, jewelry, and other stuff

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Mrs. Im C. is a farmer in Veay Tonsay Village in Kampong Speu Province. Her husband, Mr. Hen Huy, sells firewood and helps his wife in the field. Mrs. Im C. does not have enough animals to plow her rice field. Because her family is too poor, she cannot afford to buy another cow. Therefore, Mrs. Im C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to help the old cow that now plows her rice field.

Mrs. Im C. is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. Previously, Mrs. Im C. obtained a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer to support her field. She has already fully paid back the loan. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy another cow to plow her field.

loans.name: Ekoué

texts.fr:
Né en 1967 à Zowla dans la préfecture des Lacs, monsieur S. Ekoué est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Il a mis en place un centre de traitement de textes et de vente des articles scolaires depuis l’année 2000 et assure la charge de ses enfants. Il a une fois bénéficié du crédit auprès de WAGES et a bien remboursé. 
A l’approche de cette nouvelle rentrée scolaire, il sollicite ce second crédit pour acheter trente cinq (35) cartons de cahiers, quinze (15) livres de lecture et des stylos.
texts.en:
Born in 1967 in Zowla in the Prefecture of the Lakes, Mr. Ekoué S. is married and the father of 2 children. He established a center for word processing and the sale of school supplies in the year 2000 so that he can support his children. He has received one prior loan from WAGES and reimbursed it correctly.

For the new school year, he is requesting a second loan to buy 35 cases of notebooks, 15 readers, and some pens.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of cloth and other materials for her dressmaking activities

loans.name: Sein

texts.en: Mrs. Sein K. was born in 1976 and she now lives in Lo Ngeang Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a vegetable farmer who grows potatoes. She does not have enough money to hire laborers to work in her field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Kao Moeun, is a driver who makes a small income to support his family. They have two children, both of whom attend the local school. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To hire laborers

loans.name: Mama

texts.en:
Mrs Mama Tye is married and has six childen who are currently in school, She is 36 years old and lives in the town of Koforidua, Ghana. Mama sells food such as cassava dough, corn dough and maize in the local market. Cassava and corn dough are produced by milling fresh cassava and maize to obtain the main ingredient for banku, a popular Ghanaian food dish. She has been selling food products for the past 8 years and has built up a large clientele. 

Mama T. is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her children with a quality education for their future careers. She is requesting this loan to purchase an additional stock of cassava and maize to produce both cassava and corn dough to satisfy her customers’ needs. She is a member of a borrowing group called the Mawu Ngoo (meaning God is good) Trust Group. In this group members provide support to one another in managing repayment. She does not sell on the days of her group meetings and her picture was taken during her group meeting. She would be grateful for this loan assistance.

loans.use: To purchase bulk stock of cassava and maize.

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee tiene 34 años, es casada, vive con su esposo e hijos. Aprendió desde muy joven a bordar, ahora tiene la gran bendición y oportunidad de desempeñarse como una de las más solicitadas bordadoras de su zona, tiene sólo un año en esta labor, pero los pobladores ya tienen una muy buena opinión acerca del trabajo que realiza, por la entrega y creatividad de doña Aydee. Ella está muy gustosa en su labor, está trabajando muy duro porque se viene una muy buena temporada donde habrá mucha demanda, y está iniciando un duro trabajo tomando mucho tiempo en los adornos y lentejuelas que se ponen en las faldas, ya que es lo más difícil de realizar. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y espera crecer económicamente, además de comprometerse a ser puntual y responsable con su préstamo. Aydee invertirá en la compra de telas e hilos, que son materiales necesarios e indispensables para su labor.
texts.en:
Aydee is 34 years old, married and lives with her husband and children. She learned how to embroider at a very young age and now has the great blessing and opportunity to work as one of the most popular embroiderers in her area. She has only worked in embroidery for a year, but her neighbors have a very high opinion of the quality of her work and her presentation and creativity. She enjoys her work and she is currently working very hard because the coming season is when demand is the highest. She is starting the most difficult part of her work, taking significant time to finish the decorations and sequins that are placed on skirts. This is her first loan from Prisma Microfinance and she hopes to grow her business while being punctual and responsible in the repayment of her loan. She will invest the money in the purchase of fabric and thread which are the most important raw materials for her work.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and thread for her embroidery

loans.name: Krub

texts.en: Krub K. is 52 years old, married, and has eleven children, one who is married and ten who live at home. He grows vegetables and rice, and sells them to other sources for income in Khnar Village in the Siem Reap Province. He has been working with his wife almost 30 years earns around $3 per day. Two of his sons are employed as construction workers and another raises pigs and poultry for sale. With his large family, K. works almost everyday to generate revenues for to support his family's living. Because of his family relying on vegetable growing and rice farming, K. needs a loan to purchase insecticide to for his crops and with his saved money, to buy a motorcycle for the family.

loans.use: to purchase insecticide to use for his crop and remaining to plus with his saved money to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Grusca

texts.en: Ms. Grusca is 64 years old and she lives in Chisinau City in Republic of Moldova. For S. it's very difficult to survive there because her whole life she lived in the village and agriculture was the main activity to gain a profit. In Chisinau S. has a garden where she can cultivate cereals and vegetables. All the harvest she gets after her work she sells her produce at a market in Chisinau City. The purpose of the loan is to increase working capital.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Subita

texts.en:
Mrs. Subita L. lives in Chetrapati. Chetrapati is located in Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this area are engaged in small businesses like grocery stores, small hotels, and stationery stores.

Mrs. L. lives with her husband and two children. Her husband works in a government office. She has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade 4 and her son is in grade 3.

Mrs. Subita L. is engaged in her own small restaurant. She opened her restaurant 3 years ago. She sells different types of food items in her shop, especially she sells Nepali food. She also serves tea and coffee. Now Mrs. L. is requesting Rs 10,000 loan to purchase necessary food ingredients for her business.

loans.use: To buy food materials for her work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Libertad

texts.es:
La señora Libertad, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manos Unidas”, vive en el Jr. Leoncio Prado Nº 151, Distrito de Tarapoto, Departamento de San Martín. Es Divorciada, tiene 51 años y es madre 03 hijos, y uno que dependen de ella.

Se inicio con de S/. 200.00, que fue por iniciativa propia se dedico a la venta de  comida preparada y Refrigerios. Tiene 3 años trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, donde ella prepara a diario sus alimentos y postres para su refrigerio.

 Con el préstamo de S/3,000.00 que cancelara a plazo de 06 meses, desea invertirlo, comprando insumos para la preparación de los alimentos como carnes en sus diferentes variedades, sacos de arroz y azúcar, cereales, verduras, todo esto al por mayor a fin de estar abastecida, también vasos, platos, cucharas. También comprará insumos para la preparación de sus postres. 

Ella toma las decisiones en los gastos y ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, siente que sus ventas se incrementaron. Se siente una Mujer independiente y más responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

Libertad, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer.
texts.en:
Liberty belongs to the Community Bank “Manos Unidas” and lives in Jr. Leoncio Prado 151, Tarapoto District in the Department of San Martin. She is divorced, 51 years old and is the mother of 3 children, one of which depends upon her. She began with 200 Peruvian soles and, using her own initiative, she sells prepared food and refreshments. She has been working with the Bank for 3 years. Now she is continuing with the same business where she prepares food daily for her desserts and snacks. With the loan of 3,000 soles that will be repaid over 6 months, she wishes to purchase wholesale stock such as different varieties of meats, sacks of rice and sugar, cereals, vegetables, also glasses, plates and spoons. She will also buy ingredients for the preparation of her desserts. She takes the decisions on the costs and profits of her business herself. Personally, she feels that her sales have increased. She feels a more independent and responsible woman by settling her accounts. Libertad would like to thank Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow both as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies:  rice, sugar, cereals, vegetables etc-. To buy ingredients to make desserts.

loans.name: Fuente De Vida - Group 2

texts.en:
The members of this group of microentrepreneurs are all engaged in retail activities. Most of them have small shops at their own homes where they offer their merchandise. The products they offer are convenience items for homes, personal care products, clothing and jewelry.

The group coordinator is Filonila H.. She sells clothes. She will use this entire loan to buy more clothes to sell to her faithful clients and those new clients her old ones refer to her. Filonila hopes her hard work will pay off and allow her to have a house for herself and her husband. She has no children.

Thank you for helping us to continue to help! We appreciate your support.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing items

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica tiene 29 años, es soltera y madre de un pequeño de dos añitos, en la actualidad, ella vive con su madre sus 4 hermanos. Se dedica a la venta de frutas regionales (cocona, naranjas, mandarinas, etc.) en un pequeño kiosco construido por ella misma en un espacio fuera de su casa. En este negocio ya lleva 4 años y le va muy bien. Además le gusta su trabajo porque se relaciona con varias personas, reconoce que la rentabilidad de su negocio es debido a que en su zona es la única persona que ofrece estos deliciosos productos, y ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes regulares que degustan diariamente de sus frutas. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque son personas responsables y unidas. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a arreglar su kiosco adecuadamente, construirá un piso para dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes y para su propia comodidad, ya que hasta el momento su negocio está sobre tierra.
texts.en:
Jessica, 29, is single and has a small child who is two. She is currently living with her mother and four siblings. She sells regional fruits like “cocona” (a tropical fruit resembling a persimmon), oranges and tangerines in a small kiosk. She built the kiosk herself in a space outside of her home. She has been in this business for four years, and it is going very well. Also, she likes the work because she connects with different people. She recognizes that the profitability of her business is due to the fact that she is the only person in her zone who offers these delicious products. She has a good number of regular customers who taste her fruit daily. This is her third loan with MFP. She likes to work with her community bank because the people are responsible and united. The loan is to adequately fix her kiosk. She will build a floor to give a better reception to her customers and for her own comfort. Now her business has a dirt floor.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix up her kiosk

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica P. is from the village of Calaca-an. She is fifty years old and married with two grown children. To make a living, Jessica owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling health and medicinal products in the local community. Jessica has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $45 a month for these activities.

In 2004, Jessica joined the Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Jessica has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC. Jessica is requesting a new loan which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her seventh loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gelien

texts.en:
Gelien D. lives in the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 19 years old, married and makes a living selling fish in a stall in the local market. This is not her only source of income, but most of the money she makes comes in this way. The business is new but off to a good start.

In 2009, Gelien joined HSPFI in order to gain access to financial services, help improve her life and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Gelien is requesting this loan, her first, to expand her business and better support her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: Сохибназаров Ахмад проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 54 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Сыновья находятся в России на заработках. Ахмад более 10 лет работает преподавателям. В данный момент он занимается животноводством, т.е. откормом и продажей скота. Клиент просит кредит для закупа скота и корма.
texts.en:
Ahmad S. lives in the Rumy district. He is 54 years old, married and has 4 children. His sons work in Russia. Ahmad has been working as a teacher for over 10 years. Currently, he is involved in animal husbandry, i.e. feeding and selling livestock. Client is requesting a loan for the purchase of livestock and feed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying coffee and cocoa for re-sale to exporters

loans.name: God's Favor Group

texts.en: Harrison is a high school graduate and a single parent to four children (ages one through ten at the first grade level). He also cares for two orphans.  For the past three years, he has been involved in a dry goods business. He has been facing financial difficulty for several months now but plans to have a shop of his own and dreams of caring for his children's educational and medical needs.

loans.use: To purchase goods such as sardines, butter, onions, etc

loans.name: Flor De Amapolas Group

texts.es:
En el centro focal Cascada ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, hace más de once años, se formo la asociación “Flor de Amapolas”, Paulina T. que actualmente es la presidenta, es una de las fundadoras, invitando a sus vecinas y amigas a formar parte del grupo.
Las integrantes de este grupo en su mayoría son comerciantes, venden todo tipo de productos, por ejemplo; frazadas, colchones, verduras, fruta, chompas, aguayos, cereales y otros. Necesitan comprar  mayor cantidad de productos para obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
In the Cascada communal banking group in the city of El Alto, the “Flor de Amapolas” association was formed more than eleven years ago. Paulina T., who is currently the president, is one of the founders who invited her female neighbors and friends to become part of the group.

The members of this group are mainly merchants selling all types of products such as blankets, mattresses, vegetables, fruit, sweaters, woven wraps, grains, and more. They need to purchase greater quantities of product in order to obtain greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Product Purchasing

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en: Sultan M. B. is a Tanzanian an entrepreneur business married man. He runs a business of a fruits shop. He sells varieties of fruits at Mji Mwema Ward at Kigamboni in Dar es Salaam including: Paw paws, Bananas, Oranges, Mangoes and Avocados. She also sells green vegetables. He purchases the business goods direct from the producers in whole sales and some times purchased from the city market and selling in retail to consumer customers. Business income helps him to meet his daily family demand and paying children school fees. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to purchase more business goods

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz A. is from the village of San Roque. She is 49 years old. Paz is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Paz owns and operates a "sari-sari" (general) store, where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Paz has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Paz joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paz has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Paz is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Paz from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marianela

texts.es: La señora Marianela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras”, Distrito de la Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 32 años y 02 hijos que aun dependen de ella.Marianela, lleva varios años dedicándose a la costura, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, se dedica a la venta de sabanas y edredones y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, se encuentra establecida en su misma casa, donde atiende a sus clientes. Trabaja con pedidos de sus clientes anticipadamente.En la actualidad continua con su negocio y tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su casa, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con la amabilidad que le caracteriza. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará sabanas de diferentes colores y modelos, edredones de buena calidad.Marianella, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Marianela belongs to the Las Triunfadoras Communal Bank in the Banda de Shilcayo district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 32, single, and she has two children who are dependent upon her. Marianela has been working as a seamstress for several years. Little by little she has been earning her own income and saving money. She makes sheets and quilts. She tells us that things are going very well for her. She is set up in her own house, which is where she waits on her customers. She works by special order. She is currently in the same business and has faithful customers who go to her house every day to put in orders. She personally attends her customers with the kindness that she is known for. With this loan for 1,700 PEN she will buy different colors and types of good quality sheets and quilts. Marianella now feels like an accomplished woman with a big desire to achieve and make her dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and for helping other women who want to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheets and quilts

loans.name: Luis Guillermo

texts.es: Juis Guillermo Godiinez N. tiene 36 anos, vive en union libre y tiene 2 hijos que son su primer prioridad. Sus hijos tienen 13 y 6 años.  William cultiva café y cria vaccas pero quisiera cultiva mas cafe. El tiene campo libre pero necesita fertilizantes para prepararlo y por esta razón solicitó un préstamo de FUDECOSUR. Es el primer préstamo con FUDECOSUR y piense que pueda crecer su campo con este préstamo. Le gusta los prestamos fudecosures por que hay menos requisitos. él desea brindar a su esposa e hijos un futuro mejor y estable y quiere producir mas cafe de un mejor calidad.
texts.en:
Luis Guillermo Godiinez N., lives with his common law wife and has two children who are his main priority. His children are 13 and 6 years old. William grows coffee and rears cows but he would like to grow more coffee. He has a field available but needs fertilizers to prepare it and for this reason has requested a loan from FUDECOSUR. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he thinks that he would be able to grow his field with this loan. He likes the FUDECOSUR loans because they have fewer requirements. William would like to be able to offer his wife and children a better and more stable future and would like to produce more coffee of a better quality.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To contract labour help and purchase fertlizers.

loans.name: Vivina

texts.en:
Vivina L. is from the village of Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 49 years-old and married with six school-aged children. Vivina owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making "puto" (rice cakes) and other delicacies and meats for sale in the local community. Vivina has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2007, Vivina joined Kiva partner GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Vivina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Vivina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients.

loans.name: It Is Well Group

texts.en: Efua is 32 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana. The fishing business is the major occupation of the people. Efua is a fish monger. She is the leader of a trust bank group called It is well. The members of the group are mainly traders. The group requests for a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. It is their desire to give their children the best of education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn P. is from the village of Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Rosalyn is married and has five grown children. To make a living, Rosalyn sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Rosalyn has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month through her business.

In 2008, Rosalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Rosalyn is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosalyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Alexis Fernando

texts.es: Don Alexis  tiene  un año de laborar como tecnico de Castratro , tiene 2 hijos  y su esposa, ellos son una familia  de escasos economicos pero muy unida y felices , está solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (reparar su cocina), tiene su propia casa con ayuda de sus padres ya que le dieron herencia para comprarla, y poco a ido mejorando la infraestructura de la misma, el sueño de Alexis es que sus dos hijos estudien , tener estabilidad laboral y una vivienda mas bonita.
texts.en:
Alexis has been working for a year as a cadastre technician, he has a wife and 2 children. Despite being a low income family, they consider themselves very close and happy. He is requesting a credit in order to improve his home (repair de kitchen), which he acquired with the help of the inheritance his parents left him. He has been improving the infrastructure step by step. His dream is for his 2 children to study, for him to have a work stability and to have a nicer home.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Wright, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair kitchen

loans.name: Komildjon

texts.ru: Узункулов Комилджон проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 43 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Узункулов Комилджон имеет среднее образование. Животноводством занимается более 5 лет. Узункулов Комилджон разводит крупно- рогатый скот. Кредит берет для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Komildjon U. lives in the Vose district. He is 43 years old, married and has 6 children. Komildjon has a secondary education. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 5 years. Komildjon breeds cattle. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
La Sra. Bertha Alicia tiene un taller  de Costura en su casa que está ubicada en el municipio del viejo.
Ella va a utilizar el crédito para comprar telas hilos, tijeras, etc. Ya que le encargaron 30 uniformes   para niños.
Además trabaja como asalariada en una escuela de personas especiales de miércoles a sábado, para recibir un mayor ingreso.
Ella dice que con el crédito que  le brinde CEPRODEL,  podrá hacer todos los uniformes necesarios que tiene encargados y para vender por aparte, además dice estar muy agradecida con la institución ya que con estos 4 créditos que ha tenido ha podido comprar otra máquina y electrométricos que utiliza en el hogar.
texts.en:
Bertha Alicia has a tailoring workshop in her home, which is located in the Del Viejo municipality. She will use the funds to buy fabric, thread, etc. because she has 30 children's school uniforms on order. She also works as a salaried employee, from Wednesday to Saturday, at a school for persons with special needs to earn extra income. She states that with the funds that CEPRODEL provides her she will be able to make all the uniforms that she has on order and some additional ones to sell separately. She also states that she is very grateful to the institution because these four loans have made it possible for her to buy another sewing machine and some home appliances that she uses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, sewing machine needles, scissors, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Absa

texts.fr: Absa D. est une femme de 56 ans, Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de THILMAKHA depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle a 13 de fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle fait de la transformation de vente d'huile d'arachide. Cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de participer au bien-être familiale.
texts.en:
Absa D. is a 56-year old woman. She is married and mother to three children. She has been a member of the Village Bank in THILMAKHA for six and a half years. She has 13 consecutive loans and has never had any problem repaying them. She processes and sells peanut oil. This activity brings her sufficient profits to contribute to her family's well being.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and promote her activity

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica, la señora Mayra R. se dedica a laborar arduamente con el fin de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para brindarle a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y que ellos se sientan muy satisfechos del apoyo brindado por ella.

Actualmente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para soliictar un crédito que será utilizado en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar las condiciones de dicha vivienda y así continuar mejorando en su localidad. Ela comprará zinc, cemento, bloques, madera, clavos, entre otros materiales.
texts.en:
Mayra is a client who is originally from the mining town of El Limón. She was an elementary school teacher, but had to retire because of illness. Mayra currently runs a business from her home. She sells clothing and manages a grocery store. Mayra has the support of her husband, who works for the Triton Mining Company.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase zinc, cement, blocks, sand, wood, and nails

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie Y. is a very happy and lovely woman. She is 38 years old, married, and has four children: a boy and three girls.The first child is in college and the last three children are in secondary school. Her husband works as a general secretary in one of the motor parks. They live with their children in Grassfield Lumley. 

Marie owns a shop where she sells cooked food and palm oil around Lumley market, an area of Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. Marie has been in this business for 15 years now. She joined LAPO,SL as a client in July 2008. Since then, she has taken three loans.With her previous loans she has been able to open two more centres for her cookery business. She is seeking a loan of 3,000,000 SLL from Kiva lenders through LAPO,SL for her to expand more and more in her business and also to help her family.

loans.use: This loan will be used to buy food items and palm oil.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 28-year-old young married woman living with her husband and their three children in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon.

In order to help with her family’s expenses, Manal opened a beauty salon in a room of her home where she offers beauty services like hairdressing, make-up, hair removal and more to her clients. She has become well-known in her region and her clients feel comfortable coming to her.

With the loan she has requested, Manal plans to expand her home business by purchasing additional equipment and products; for example, she plans to buy new beauty products. She says that her business productivity and income will both increase as a result since she will be able to attract new clients.

loans.use: To purchasing additional equipment and products

loans.name: Rizafe

texts.en:
Rizafe V. is from the village of Dawo. She is 27 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rizafe owns & operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing repair services to local community members. Rizafe has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month.

In 2008, Rizafe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for motor cab repair.
