Rizafe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to register her vehicle. This will be Rizafe’s 5th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to register her vehicle

loans.name: Luz Del Transito

texts.es: Luz del Transito tiene 36 años, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa. Tiene 2 hijos que son menores de edad y están a su cargo. Ella inicio este negocio hace 5 años, por lo que se le presento un problema de salud con el último embarazo, pues es necesaria otra fuente de ingresos necesaria a su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como pantalones, camisas, faldas, ropa interior y trajes. Su deseo es mejorar las condiciones de de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz del Transito is 36 years old and is in the clothing sale business. She has two sons who are minors and depend on her. She started this business five years ago, since she had a health problem with her pregnancy and needed another source of income for her family. The loan requested will be invested in the purchase of pants, shirts, skirts, underwear and suits. Her desire is to improve the living conditions of her family

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
K. Farida is a dynamic and ambitious 41-year-old woman. She is married and has one child. For 15 years already she has had a small business processing apricots. Thanks to the quality of her products and the experience she has gained in this sphere of business, she has earned a solid reputation among her customers and the demand for her goods has grown, allowing Farida to contribute significantly to the household. 

Now Farida requests a loan amounting to 5000 Somoni. She is going to spend the loan purchasing apricots with the purpose of processing them and making dried apricots. Farida hopes that she will be able to continue providing her children with schooling so they will be able to get an adequate education. She expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing apricots to process for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beverages and other inventory

loans.name: Save The Children Group

texts.en:
Alie B. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Alie was born in Mambolo village, about 28 years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple have one child. For over ten years now, Alie has been selling items such as sprays, creams, ready-to-wear-clothes, etc. This is the first loan that Alie and his group members have requested from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Alie will use his share of the loan (500,000 leones) to expand his business; he will buy sprays, creams, and ready-to-wear-clothes, etc., at wholesale prices to add to his stock. 

Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To buy sprays, creams and ready-to-wear-clothes, etc.

loans.name: Bolivia

texts.es: La Sra. Bolivia esta casada con el señor Pedro, ellos tienen tres hijas de las cuales dos asisten a primaria, la Sra Bolivia se dedica a la venta de comida y su esposo trabaja como chofer de micro de la línea 86, ellos se levantan muy temprano para atender a su familia y luego comenzar a trabajar, la Sra Bolivia esta vendiendo salchipapas, hamburguesas y pollo frito todos los días por las noches de 18:00 a 23:00, durante el día ella se dedica realizar sus compras necesarias para su negocio y luego a ayudar a sus hijas con las tareas del colegio. El crédito que ella necesita es para comenzar la construcción de un cuarto en un lote que compraron gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo y el de su esposo, actualmente ellos viven en anticrético. Ella se caracteriza por ser persona responsable y muy trabajadora, es cliente antigua de Emprender y es por ello que es la segunda vez que accede a un credito KIVA.
texts.en:
Bolivia is married to Pedro. They have three daughters, and two of them go to elementary school. Bolivia sells food, and her husband drives a small bus on route 86. They get up very early to see to their family, and then they start to work. Bolivia sells “salchipapas” (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables), hamburgers, and fried chicken every evening from 6:00 until 11:00. During the day she shops for the things she needs for her business. Then, she helps her daughters with their homework from school. She needs the loan to start building a room on a lot. She and her husband bought the lot thanks to their work efforts. They currently live in “anticrédico” (a special type of rental arrangement in Bolivia). She is a responsible and very hard-working person. She has been a client with Emprender for a long time. This is the second time that she has accessed a loan from Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room

loans.name: John A.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is pleased to present to you teachers of the Baptist Model Secondary School, in Waterloo, a small town where “Shine on Sierra Leone” has partnered with SMT to start a branch. Baptist Model Secondary School was established by the Baptist mission primarily to educate the children of Allen town and its environs. The school is staffed with fifty teachers and has 2,100 pupils.

These hard-working and dedicated teachers have come to SMT to seek a loan of SLL 7,400,000. With the help of this loan, these teachers can embark on some meaningful project that their mere salaries alone cannot do. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to buy house building materials, buy a piece of land or pay school fees for their children, while some of them will invest the loan in a business. 

John A. B. is the leader of this group of teachers. He is age thirty-eight. Abu is married and has two children. Mr. B. will use part of his share of the loan to pay school fees for his children and will use the remainder of the loan to pay school fees for himself to pursue further studies.

loans.use: pay school fees for his children and  for himself

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El Señor Pedro vive en el barrio Porvenir del Municipio del el Torno de la Ciudad de Santa Cruz, hace 19 años que llego desde el departamento de Chuquisaca capital de Bolivia  en busca de tiempos mejores para su familia, su esposa con la cual tienen dos hijos, en edad escolar, por lo que  se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos los cuales son pequeños; su actividad principal es el transporte de materiales de construcción se dedica a esta actividad hace dos años, el destino del crédito solicitado es para construcción de su domicilio, necesita comprar material de construcción como cemento, pintura, tejas, etc. esta agradecido con la institución ya que le da la oportunidad de seguir creciendo económicamente y así tener un futuro mejor para su familia
texts.en:
Señor Pedro lives in the Porvenir neighbourhood of the El Torno municipality of Santa Cruz. He arrived there nineteen years ago, from Chuquisaca department where Bolivia’s capital is located, seeking a better life for his family. His wife looks after their two school-aged children. Pedro has earned his living transporting construction materials for the last two years. He plans to use the loan to build a house so he needs to buy construction materials such as cement, paint, tiles etc. Pedro is grateful to the institution since it gives him the chance to develop economically and therefore provide a better future for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction material

loans.name: Fema Grace

texts.en:
Fema Grace A. is from the village of Agay-ayan, Gingoog City. She is 37 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Fema Grace owns and operates a specialized retail store selling used-clothing or ready-to-wear clothes in the local community. Fema Grace has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Fema Grace joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fema Grace is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosene

texts.en:
Rosene G. is a 54 year old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Purok Palasan, Brgy. Pilar, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.

By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Rosene is now borrowing PHP 12,000, so that she can purchase more stock to sell.  This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rosene aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Julia Maria

texts.es: Julia tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación por lo que se siente muy contenta con este medio de vida como es el destace de cerdo. Hace más de 17 años que tiene este negocio pues ha logrado obtenerlo con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, es una persona que tiene el espíritu de salir adelante pues lucha por sus 2 hijos que son menores de edad y que están a su cargo es por esto el motivo del financiamiento que es para la compra de materia prima como cerdos, ya que le han realizado muy buenas propuestas y no le gustaría perderlas.
texts.en:
Julia has been a Fundación client for a long time.  She is very happy with her life’s work which is butchering pigs.  She has been in this business for over 17 years.  She has made it succeed through much effort and sacrifice.  She is a person with the determination to get ahead because she fights for the two minor children in her care.

The purpose of the loan is to buy raw materials like pigs because they are being offered at good prices and she doesn’t want to miss out on the opportunity.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Oñondivepa Group

texts.es:
Comité Oñondivepa,así se denomina el grupo de mujeres conformado en Capiata en fecha 29 de julio de 2009, gracias a que la actual Directora de Finanzas,quien se dedica a la venta de ropas artesanales.
Mediante una charla informativa de la asesora acerca del Programa logró juntar a 21 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 4° ciclo,en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La Sra. Gabriela es una de las integrantes y posee un comedor, se dedica a la venta de comidas, ya sean comidas rápidas y el plato principal de mediodía, posee clientela formada, teniendo en cuenta la calidad y buena atención en su local.
 Desea abaratar los costos de producción adquiriendo en cantidades los productos no perecederos para la fabricación de las comidas, como son aceites, condimentos, fideos, arróz, harina, huevos, etc., así también ampliar con la varidad de bebidas, teniendo en cuenta el calor de la temporada que provoca gran demanda de gaseosas, refrescos y jugos naturales.
texts.en:
The Oñondivepa Committee is the name of this group of women, which was formed in Capiata on July 29, 2009, thanks to the current Financial Director, who sells handmade clothing.

By means of an informational talk about the Program, 21 women got together.  They are now in their fourth loan cycle and are working well together in the program, being very well-coordinated and united.

Gabriela is one of the members and has an eatery where she sells fast foods and lunches.  She has steady customers, who take into account the quality and customer service of her business.

She wants to lower her production costs by purchasing non-perishable products in bulk, such as oils, condiments, pasta, rice, flour, eggs, etc.  She would also like to increase the variety of beverages she has, taking into account the seasonal heat that leads to high demand for soft drinks and juices.

loans.use: Purchase products to make meals

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen lives in Mian Channu, which is a small city in Pakistan. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family.   She is 40 years old, married to N. M., and has 3 sons.  Her eldest son left his education after 5th class and started doing labor work to financially support the family. Her 2 younger sons are enrolled in school and are getting their education.
 
Her husband has a business selling construction supplies. He operates a shop in the market where he fulfills the demands of his customers. He is experienced in his business and known in the area for his quality of service.

Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies such as cement, bricks and sand in bulk quantity.  That will enable him to increase his sales and earnings.  She is hopeful that this investment will be a productive one for her husband and make him better profits in the future.  She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for resale

loans.name: Dalila De Los Angeles

texts.es: Dalila De Los Ángeles tiene su negocio que vende granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, pan y detergentes. Inicio su negocio debido a que su familia se hacía cargo del negocio con el paso del tiempo decidieron que Dalila se encargara hace aproximadamente 21 años y con ello ayudó a sus hermanos su negocio lo desarrolla en compañía de su hijo y familiares. Este es su tercer financiamiento con Fundación y con él planea comprar materia prima, pues se acerca el mes de Diciembre y debe estar preparada para la gran demanda de productos que se avecina. Su gran sueño es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Dalila De Los Ángeles has a business that sells basic grains, snacks, refreshments, bread and detergents. She started out working because her family had the store, and about 21 years ago she took over the business. With the help of her siblings, she was able to develop the business alongside her son and relatives. This is her third loan with Kiva partner Fundación Leon and she plans to use it to purchase more merchandise since December is fast approaching and she needs to be prepared for the high demand. Her biggest dream is to make improvements on her home.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Migdonio Reineres

texts.es:
Migdonio de 48 años de edad, vive con su esposa Minerva Tinoco y sus Hijos en la comarca Santa Rosa Finca Santa Fe, en el Municipio de Comalapa, donde se dedican a las actividades Ganaderas por el cual obtiene sus ingresos para el sustento de su Familia, el Sr. Migdonio explota su propiedad realizando tambien actividades agricola de modo que esto le genere mayor ingresos y asi cubrir sus obligaciones de pago.  

Solicita su credito para compra de Ganado de Desarrollo para repastarlos y ponerlos a la venta cuando esten en buen peso, pues cuenta con la ayuda de Kiva para realizar este pequeño proyecto y asi obtener ganancias y continuar en el mercado del Negocio.  

Su mayor sueño es que su propiedad tenga mejores condiciones para su Ganado y tambien mejorar las comodidades del hogar para su Familia.
texts.en:
Migdonio is 48 years old.  He lives with his wife, Minerva Tinoco, and their children.  They live in the area of Santa Rosa Finca Santa Fe in the Comalapa municipality.  Their business activity is livestock, which gives him income to support his family.

Migdonio cultivates his land and also does agricultural work.  This way he generates greater income and covers his financial obligations.

He is requesting a loan to buy cattle to raise.  He will let the cattle graze, and he will sell them when they are a good weight.  He counts on help from Kiva to carry out this small project.  That way he will get income and continue in the business.

His greatest dream is for his land to be in better condition for his livestock.  He also want to improve the household comforts for his family.

loans.use: To buy calves to fatten

loans.name: Lizbeth Giovana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MINKA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Lizbeth Giovana, La socia tiene 34 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; la socia se dedica  ala compra y venta de cerveza ella tiene un depósito en su casa y vente al por mayor y menor la cerveza, la socia dice que es increíble pero este negocio sale como pan caliente, lo que a ella le rinde es este, la socia tenía una tienda de abarrotes al inicio y era un tanto exclavizante manifiesta y vendía poco y lo que ganaba también era muy poco, entonces ella decidió abastecerse más de cerveza que de otros productos y fue así como dio un giro a su negocio, la socia ahora solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería y con una parte cubrir todos los gastos de estas fiestas ya que desea comprarle una bicicleta a su hijo y dar regalos a sus parientes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su mercadería y para dar obsequios en estas fiestas a su hijo y parientes.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “MINKA” Communal Bank which is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco. Ms. Lizbeth Giovana is 34 years old.  She is unmarried and has one son.  

Ms. Giovana buys and sells beer.  She has a storage area in her house and sells wholesale and retail beer.  She says that it is incredible but, in this business, the products go like hot cakes.  

She had a grocery store to start and was somewhat of a slave. She sold little and earned very little.  Then she decided to supply more beer than other products and this was how she gave a twist to her business.  

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise and will use the other portion to cover the expenses of the holidays as she wants to buy a bicycle for her son and give gifts to her relatives.  She is requesting this loan to invest in merchandise and to give gifts to her son and relatives for the holidays.

She is happy to receive the loan and agrees to make the payments according to the established terms.
.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to invest in merchandise and to give gifts to her son and relatives for the holidays.

loans.name: Marvin Esperanza

texts.es:
Marvín, tiene 32 años de edad, reside en Concepción Batres, departamento de Usulután, posee casa propia viviendo con sus tres hijos de 9,  13 y 15 años de edad, se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura, posee 20 reses y cultiva una manzana de maíz y una manzana de tierra de maicillo, ella está al frente de estos trabajos que desarrolla con la ayuda de mozos.
Por el momento solicita un préstamo para la compra de ganado de repasto y en la reparación de los terrenos, con esta ayuda aumentara su número de ganado y mejorara las condiciones de los terrenos para los cultivos y para mantener el ganado.
Su objetivo es velar por que su trabajo este bien, los terrenos en las mejores condiciones, aumentar el ganado y alimentarlo para poder comercializarlo a buen precio, de esta manera estará mejorando los ingresos a la familia y ofrecerles una calidad de vida diferente.
texts.en:
Marvin is 32 years old and lives in Concepcion Batres in the department of Usulutan. She has her own home and lives with her three children ages 9, 13 and 15. She dedicates herself to livestock and farming. She has 20 heads of cattle and cultivates 7000 square meters of corn and 7000 square meters of sorghum. She is at the forefront of this work which she does with the help of porters. 

Currently, she is requesting  a loan to purchase cattle and to fix her land. With this help she will increase the number of livestock and she will improve the condition of her land for her crops and to support the livestock. 

Her goals are to ensure that her work goes well, that her land is in the best condition and to increase the number of livestock and feed it so that she can sell it at a good price. This way she will be improving the family's income and she will be able to provide them a different quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase livestock and repairing land.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: El señor Pedro vive en una comunidad muy distante del Torno se llama la Planchada a 38 km del Torno donde tiene su tierra el trabaja con su esposa y sus 5 hijos en la agricultura se dedican a la siembra de maíz, papa, yuca y maní. Ellos viven en esa comunidad hace bastante tiempo también se dedican a la ganadería  donde tienen 30 cabezas de ganado de ahí tienen leche para vender, a una fabrica de leche, el dinero del crédito lo utilizaran en la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa y maíz y también para el preparado de la tierra, todos los productos que siembran lo comercializan en el mercado de el Torno, con la ayuda de sus hijos, el Sr, pedro es un hombre trabajador  y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.  En la foto el sr Pedro esta acompañado de su Hijo Mayor.
texts.en: Mr. Pedro lives in a community very far away from Torno called Planchada some 38 km from Torno where he has his land and works with his wife and 5 children in agriculture. They work growing corn, potatoes, yucca and peanuts. They have lived in the community for a long time; they also have 30 cattle where they get milk to sell to a factory. The money from the loan will be used to buy seeds for their potato and corn crops and to prepare the soil. All of the products that they grow they sell in the market in Torno with his children’s’ help. Mr. Pedro is a hardworking man and is very thankful to the institution for the support given to him. In the picture, Mr. Pedro is with his eldest son.

loans.use: To buy potato and corn seeds.

loans.name: Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.en:
Former member of the San Francisco committee, Ms Eda Espinola, took action to create this committee. She contacted her neighbors and friends to form the committee in their community. The committee is called "Mujeres Alegres" and is starting its first cycle with 16 members. It's a group that is known for its shared responsibility and caring membership.
Ms Faustina Gil has a small general store alongside her house where she tries to sell the basic necessities for her neighbors. Her wish is to increase the quantity of her merchandise. So she is asking for a loan to buy a variety of top quality products. The women are requesting a loan of Gs 500,000 in order to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying additional food for her restaurant

loans.name: Maritza Felicita

texts.es: Maritza tiene 58 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de repuestos usados. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio pues han sido de gran ayuda. Hace más de 18 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha sido muy difícil salir adelante con todas las cosas que ha atravesado. Ella es una persona muy luchadora que disfruta de su negocio y de interactuar con sus clientes. Este crédito es para la compra de llantas, repuestos, herramientas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Maritza is 58 years old and has a business selling used parts. This is not the first time she has received financing and the loans have been a great help to her business. Maritza has been in this business for more than eighteen years and it has been difficult to get ahead due to all the things she has had to face. She is a determined person who enjoys operating her business and interacting with her customers.

This loan will be used to buy tires, parts, tools, and other items.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy tires, parts, tools, and other items

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa A. is from the village of Binahalan, Gingoog City. She is 22 years old. Melissa is married and has two small children. To make a living, Melissa sells green and sweet bananas in the local community. Melissa has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Melissa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Melissa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Melissa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Melissa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve  and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 55 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su hijo que tiene 12 años, el cual cría y educa para que tenga un futuro prometedor.  Viven en la ciudad de Chiclayo, exactamente en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz.

Juan se dedica a la venta ambulante de sandías y caña en su comunidad.  Actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace 10 años, antigüedad que le permite a la fecha haber acumulado el número de clientes fidelizados con los que cuenta. Los ingresos que obtiene los utiliza básicamente en la educación de su hijo.


En esta ocasión, Juan en apoyo a la educación de su hijo quiere comprar útiles escolares para poder mandarlo al colegio.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 600 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Juan, 55, is single living with his 12 year old son, whom he supports and educates so that he will have a promising future, in the city of Chiclayo, exactly in the district of José Leonardo Ortiz.

Juan is an itinerant watermelon and sugar cane merchant in his community.  He’s been in this occupation for 10 years.  This length of time has made it possible for him to have a well established base of regular customers.  Income he earns he basically uses for his son’s education.

On this occasion, Juan wants to support his son’s education buying him school supplies to send him to school.  Because of this, he’s deemed it convenient to get a 600 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for his son.

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi B., 37 years old, is married with two adult-aged children. Her family is from the village of Cabisera 9-11, San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela. To make a living, she provides general clothing services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $83 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Levi joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business. 

Levi is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and sewing materials. This will be her 6th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and sewing materials.

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
Lory works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 3,500 through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Lory is aware that by using the solar lamp she is saving money. She is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To purchase a Solar Lamp.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Editha is 51 years old and has a child who is in school.

Editha has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. Editha requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving business.

Editha has been in this business for 20 years.  In the future, Editha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her abaca weaving business

loans.name: Chita

texts.en:
Chita is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Chita has a shop that sells different varieties of fish. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy additional stocks of fish.

Chita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Chita hopes to succeed on her business so that she could experience a well life living together with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Mirando Al Futuro Group

texts.es:
Éste banco comunal se llama “Mirando al Futuro” conformado por 17 socios que se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre ellos elaboración de empanadas, tortillas, ventas de leña y carbón, además ventas de abarrotes en un minimarket. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillán.   
Nancy quien en la foto aparece en primera fila y segunda del lado derecho, viste una chaqueta color negro, una polera color rosado y calza botas encima de sus jeans. Se dedica a la realización de costuras desde hace 21 años, para esto cuenta con un taller de corte y confección al interior de su casa.  
Nancy realiza sus confecciones de acuerdo a las temporadas del año y pedidos que le realicen sus clientes. Sus clientes frecuentes son estudiantes durante la temporada de colegio, para la temporada de fiestas patrias (fiesta costumbrista de la independencia de Chile), sus confecciones son en base a trajes folklóricos. A partir del mes de agosto en adelante sus ventas aumentan debido a la confección, arriendo y venta de disfraces. 
En su taller Nancy cuenta con la maquinaria necesaria para desempeñarse en sus labores, una overlock, una maquina multipunto y una maquina recta. Comenta que le va muy bien con sus ventas. 
Su mercadería la compra en tiendas especializadas en ofrecer insumos de  costuras.
Con el crédito comprará género, elástico, hilos y lentejuelas, específicamente insumos para la confección de disfraces.
Sus metas son seguir trabajando en su negocio para aumentar sus ingresos, le gustaría perfeccionarse en la confección de disfraces y anhela tener una tienda especializada en el arriendo y venta de éstos. 
Nancy vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 11 y 3 años de edad, sus sueños a nivel familiar es que sus hijos algún día se independicen y sean profesionales. Además se encuentra ayudando a su marido con el negocio de venta de abarrotes que quiere comenzar.
Nancy está muy contenta y agradecida del apoyo brindado por Fondo esperanza, comenta que las reuniones han sido un espacio para compartir y conocer otras experiencias desde otro punto de vista. De ésta manera se ha generado confianza y solidaridad con las demás socias del grupo del banco comunal. Además es un grupo solidario y comprometido.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Looking at the Future" and is composed by 17 members who are dedicated to differing activities, among them the making of empanadas, tortillas, sale of firewood and coal, also sale of groceries in a mini market.  They are all from the city of Chilan.  Nancy, who in the picture is in the first row, second from the right, is dressed in a black jacket, pink polo shirt and boots on top of her jeans.  She has been a seamstress for the last 21 years, and has a shop in her home. 
Nancy makes her clothing based on the season and the orders she receives from her customers.  Her customers are frequently students during the school season, for the independence holiday season (Chilean independence day festivities) her clothing is based on native folk attire.  Starting with the month of August her sales increase due to the making, renting and selling of costumes.  In her shop Nancy has the necessary machinery to carry out her craft, an overlock machine, a multipoint and a straight machine.  She says that her sales are doing well. 
She buys her supplies in stores that specialize in sewing supplies.  
With the loan she will buy material, elastic, thread and sequins, specifically supplies to make costumes.
Her goals are to continue working in her business to increase her income.  She would like to perfect her ability to make costumes and she wishes to have a store specializing in the sale and rental of these.
Nancy lives with her husband and two children of 11 and 13 years of age.  Her dreams for her family are for her children to become independent and professionals.  She also finds herself helping her husband with the start of a grocery store business.
Nancy is very happy and grateful with the help that she gets from the Esperanza Fund.  She says that the meetings have been a way to meet and share experiences from different point of view.  This way confidence and solidarity is generated with the other member of the communal bank group.  Besides, the group is very caring and committed.  
Chillán is a community in the south central area of Chile.  The name means " seat of the sun" in mapudungun, the language of the indigenous Mapuches.  Chillán is known as the "cradle of the country" or "land of artists", due to several famous persons in Chile's history being born there, as for example the known pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to purchase material, elastic, thread and sequins, specifically supplies for the making of costumes.

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
Анна торгует женской обувью на рынке. Она начала этот бизнес 7 лет назад. За это время она смогла хорошо освоиться и развить бизнес. У нее много постоянных клиентов, которые у удовольствием покупают обувь у Анны. 

Анна – оптимистична и предприимчива. Именно  качества позволяют ей идти дальше, невзирая на экономические трудности и невзгоды. Анна хочет открыть еще одну точку на рыке и увеличить оборот. Анна просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 20,000 гривен. Она надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить свой быт. Анна замужем, они с мужем имеют одного сына.
texts.en: Anna sells women's shoes at the market.  She started this business seven years ago.  During this time, she was able to familiarize herself with and develop the business well.  She has many loyal customers, who buy shoes from Anna with satisfaction.  Anna is optimistic and entrepreneurial.  These qualities allow her to go further, regardless of economic difficulties and adversities.  Anna wants to open one more retail outlet at the market and increase her goods turnover.  Anna is requesting a loan in the sum of 20,000 hryvnias.  She hopes to get an additional profit and improve her livelihood.  Anna is married, and her husband and her have one son.

loans.use: to obtain summer merchandise and increase selection

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Urubamba, Provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia; la socia nacio el año de 1972; la socia es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos;   La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa, la socia viaja cada 6 meses a trer ropa al por mayor para señoritas, señoras, señores; la socia trae ropa según la estación y los cambios que en el año se encuentran, la socia tambien tiene un stand en el terminal terrestre de venta de todo tipo de abarrotes principalmenten galletas, acaramelos, chocolas, gaseosas jugos en cajas, kekes, agua mineral, sandwich entre otros. La socia desea el credito para invertir en la compra de mercadería productos para implementar sus stand en el terminal de Uurbamba. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería para el stand.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Tercer Milenio” (Third Millennium) Communal Bank.  The bank is in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

She was born in 1972, she has a life partner, and she has five children.  She buys and sells clothes.  Every six months she travels in order to get women’s and men’s wholesale clothing.  She gets clothes according to the season and the changes that are found during the year. 

This member also has a stand at the bus terminal.  She sells all types of groceries.  She primarily sells cookies, candy, chocolates, soft drinks, juice boxes, cakes, mineral water, and sandwiches, among other items.

She wants the loan to buy merchandise (products) in order to stock her stand.

She is very content and grateful for this support and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her stand.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline, a 26-year-old single lady who runs a wholesale business that has been in operation for two years, earns a monthly income of KES.200,000. With a good credit history, this will be her second loan from KADET LTD with which she will purchase bundles of plastic bags, diapers and cartons of baby jelly for resale. Caroline hopes to open a supermarket in future.

loans.use: to buy diapers, bed sheets, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita, a 56-year-old mother of four grown children, believes that "strong faith and determination" will make it possible for her to achieve her goals. The operator of a dress-making business for almost 10 years to generate additional income for the family, Merlita usually earns a monthly profit of P7,000 which she uses for food, clothing and allowances for the children.

Now requesting a loan of P7,000 to buy threads, needles, textiles and other materials needed in making dresses, Merlita hopes that she will be successful in working out her business plan. She aims to improve her enterprise to earn a higher income in order to reinvest it and renovate their house to live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy threads, needles and textiles for dress-making.

loans.name: Lizeth

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Yucay, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Lizeth; tiene 26 años de edad,  la socia es soltera; la socia trabaja con su familia, ala socia se dedica  a la agricultura, ella y su familia producen maíz blanco de primera , este es un grano grande y rico en sabor, este maíz es cotizado y por ello ellos se dedican a la exportación de este tipo de maíz de primera calidad; la socia junto a sus familia invierten todo su tiempo en mejorar su producción, la socia desea el crédito para invertir en uno de los terrenos de la familia y en la compra de semillas para la nueva época de siembra, para lo cual requiere arar la tierra y prepararla para la nueva siembra después de esto abonar el terreno. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maíz de primera en semillas para la nueva siembra, abono y preparar la tierra.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD” communal bank. The bank is located in the Yucay district, in the province of Urubamba, Cusco department.

The member is Lizeth. She is 26 and single. She works with her family in agriculture. They produce high quality white corn. White corn is a large grain, rich in flavour, which is highly sought-after. For this reason, they export this highest quality variety of corn. Lizeth and her family invest all of their time in improving their production. She wants this loan to invest in one of her family's plots of land, and in the purchase of seeds for the new sowing season. She needs to plough her land and prepare it for the new crop, and then fertilize the land. She is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of high quality corn seeds for the new sowing season, as well as fertilizer, and for preparing the land.

She is grateful for the support that we are offering and promises to repay her quotas in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of high quality corn seed for the new sowing season; to purchase fertilizer; and to prepare the land.

loans.name: Soklav

texts.en:
Soklav is a farmer and her income is $1 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and can earn $4 per day. Soklav has seven children: two are studying and four are working in a factory, with an income of $14 per day for all. Every month she has to spend $40 on food, $7 on electricity, $15 on house rent fee, $10 on school fees, $18 on transportation and $16 on other expenses.

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy cows to resell. The reason she wants to buy a cow is because her neighbor sells them for a cheap price so she can buy and resell to get a profit.

In the future, she wants to sell fertilizer and animal food at home if she has enough money. For her children, she wants to support them to study at the university.

loans.use: to buy cows to resell

loans.name: Claudelina

texts.es:
La señorita Claudelina tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de banderas y remeras de los Clubes populares de Paraguay, también ropas interiores para damas y caballeros. Cada mañana se coloca en las Plazas que son lugares transcurridos para ofrecer sus productos.
Ella se considera una mujer trabajadora y muy sacrificada, ya que gracias a su esfuerzo ella ha logrado ayudar a su familia y estar con el negocio que tiene. Comenta que su trabajo es muy duro y sacrificado, pero que le gusta.
Claudelina solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, con las cuales podrá elaborar las banderas y las remeras que vende. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta e brinda.
texts.en:
Señorita Claudelina is 22 years old.  She is single and lives with her parents.  She works selling flags and T-shirts from the popular clubs in Paraguay.  She also sells underwear for men and women.  Every morning she sets up to sell her products in the busiest plazas.

She considers herself to be a hard-working woman who is very self-sacrificing, as thanks to her efforts she has managed to support her family and have her business.  She comments that her work is very hard and requires sacrifice, but she enjoys it.

Claudelina is requesting the loan for the purchase of fabric, with which she will be able to make the flags and T-shirts that she sells.  She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that is being provided to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making flags and T-shirts.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga is a 29-year-old man who lives with his wife and 9-year-old daughter. They live in a small barn. He is a crane man for a private construction company and was awarded as an employee of the company. Gantulga is a very diligent and helpful person. His wife is a janitress at a pharmacy.

With their low income they couldn’t fix their barn and it became hard for them to live in their barn during winter. In order to have better living conditions, he has asked for a loan to purchase the building materials to fix his house barn.

loans.use: to purchase the building materials to fix his house barn

loans.name: Rutshele

texts.en:
Rutshele is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Rutshele has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Rutshele has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rutshele hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is 29 years old, married, and has two children. To earn a living, she sells potatoes. She also does tailoring to earn extra income. Through Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business because she has been trained on business management skills. Diana hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 35,000 KES to purchase more potatoes.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes

loans.name: Toro Piru Group

texts.es:
10 mujeres de la ciudad de Santaní, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad se han unido con el objetivo de ayudarse las unas con las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Quieren salir adelante y piensan que el programa de la fundación le será de mucha ayuda.
Una de las miembros de ese grupo es la señora Lidia, quien se dedica a la cría y posterior venta de cerdos, comenta que es muy sacrificado su trabajo, pues siempre tiene que estar pendiente de sus animales para que nos les pase nada ni tomen alguna enfermedad, ya que ella ofrece muy buenos animales. Ella pese a ese esfuerzo quiere poder seguir creciendo y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de cerdos pequeños, como así también alimentos para los mismos.
Ella está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le da la fundación y kiva.
texts.en:
Ten women from the city of Santaní, all friends and neighbors from that city, have joined together with the goal of helping each other through their joint efforts.  They want to get ahead and believe that the Fundación’s program will be of much help to them.

One of this group’s members is Lidia who raises pigs for subsequent sale.  She comments that her work is very demanding because she always has to be watchful of her animals so that nothing happens to them or they get sick because she sells very good animals.  Despite the effort required she wants to continue to grow and this is why she’s asked for a loan: to buy piglets as well as feed for them.  She is very grateful for the opportunity the Fundación and Kiva give her.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Angamos Group

texts.es:
Con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio la Sra. Giovanna junto a su esposo han logrado comprar  su propio carro, durante muchos años su esposo se dedica al transporte público y manejaba carros de otras personas lo cual no le dejaba muchos ingresos además de ser muy sacrificado, ahora es diferente porque siendo su propia unidad las ganancias son mejores, la Sra. Giovanna es quien administra el carro está pendiente de todo lo necesario para el buen funcionamiento, por otro lado ella también se dedica a la limpieza de casas y departamentos cuenta con clientes fijos a quienes les realiza el servicio algunos días de semana, estos ingresos son de mucha utilidad para ella y su familia así  han construido su propia casa, quieren seguir progresando para ello ahorran porque quieren comprarse otro carro, el préstamo que EDAPROSPO le facilita le servirá para comprar la póliza del seguro y  el mantenimiento mecánico necesario, él grupo al cual pertenece se llama “ MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANGAMOS” son 7 socias vecinas del mismo lugar.

   •La Sra. Giovanna es la 5ta de la derecha esta vestida con polo negro (en la foto también aparecen 2 señoras invitadas)
texts.en:
With great effort and sacrifice, Giovanna and her husband have been able to buy their own car. For many years, her husband has worked providing public transportation. He used to drive cars belonging to other people, which did not provide him with much income, while also requiring lots of sacrifice. Now it is different, because having their own vehicle means that their earnings are better. Giovanna is the one who manages the car, taking care of everything that is needed for its good operation. At the same time, she also works cleaning houses and apartments. She has steady customers for whom she provides services several days a week. This income is very useful for her and her family, and they have been able to build their own house. They want to keep making progress, and they are saving their money because they want to buy another car. The loan which EDAPROSPO is facilitating for her will be used to buy the insurance policy and necessary mechanical maintenance. The group she belongs to is called “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS DE ANGAMOS” ["Entrepreneurial Women of Angamos"]. It has 7 members who are neighbors in the same area. 

   • Giovanna is the fifth from the right, and is wearing a black shirt. The group photo includes 2 women who are guests.

loans.use: to buy insurance and carry out maintenance on her car.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun, 57 years old, is married and has five children, three of whom are dependent. One sells clothes on commission and two are still in school. Khun has been farming on her own land for 37 years, supplementing her income by growing cassava. She currently earns less than US $10 per day and saves around US $3 per day for the future. 

This is Khun’s second loan with VisionFund, having completely repaid her first one. She is applying for another loan as her business is doing well. She wants to use all of this loan to buy fertilizer for her farm, to rent a plot of farming land to extend the farm, and to pay for plowing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her farmland so as to grow more rice and earn a greater income to keep her children in school and to set aside some money for the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to rent a plot of farming land

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a hardworking married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His current business is motorcycle transport, which he has been operating for the last two years. He faces challenges of price fluctuations and inflation, and high fuel and transportation costs. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home. James needs the loan to buy his own motorcycle for transportation, since he has been working for another person.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Yao Edem

texts.fr:
Yao est un homme âgé de 35 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse. Il a deux enfants.
Yao travaille comme revendeur depuis 2008. Il vend du pure water pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Il achète les produits à Lomé. Il travaille seul. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas pouvoir satisfaire la demande pour cause de stock insuffisant.
Yao a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter un congélateur et du pure water. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Yao voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Il dit qu’avec les profits, il prévoit d’assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yao is a 35-year old man, who is married to a retailer and has two children.

He has been working as a retailer since 2008 and sells "pure water" to all types of customer in his shop. He buys his products in Lomé and works alone. His main problem at the moment is that he does not have sufficient stock to satisfy customer demand. 

Yao has requested a second loan from WAGES so that he can buy a freezer and some "pure water". He wants to reinvest in his business and in the coming years he would like to expand. He says that he will ensure his family's well-being with the profits he makes.

loans.use: to buy sachets of "pure water"

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 33 years old, married, and has three children. He has been running a timber supplies business for the last 15 years, earning a monthly income of about Kes 20,000.

He is applying for his fifth loan with KADET ltd of Kes 30,000. He plans to use the loan to purchase additional stock of timber. He will save anticipated profits to open another branch.

His hopes and dreams are to become a timber distributor and be successful.

loans.use: To increase the level of his timber stock.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam is 28 years,married with two children.He lives in Makangarawe area of Dar es Salaam.Adam sells kerosene in retail using a hand driven fuel pump .The pump draws kerosene from a tank dug on the ground.He has been in this business for more than five years.
   The pump has recently cause the problem of malfunction.Some parts need replacement,the pump is 18 years old.Adam is in need of USD 750 to buy replacement parts of the pump and add another storage tank.The storage tank will act as cushion for stockouts.Adam did not like to loose his customers he has built a long time relationship.
    Most people in the area uses kerosene as fuel for cooking and boiling drinking water.The area has no public water services,people depend on water from shallow dug wells.Waterborne deseases are common especially chorella and amoebic dysentery.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Agbaï Maduka

texts.en:
Mr. Agbai Maduka K. was born on March 27, 1975 in Nigeria. He did not have a very strong education and was then forced to follow in the footsteps of his older brother [a storekeeper] and establish himself in Togo. A Togo citizen by filiation [lineage], he is a father of one child. He had difficulties beginning his business as a buyer and seller of second-hand clothing. Progressively, he acquired experience in this domain and received financing/funding which allowed him to buy in bulk quantities as well as open his own store in the Adawlato market in Lomé.

Today, he is asking for a new loan of $1200 in order to encourage his suppliers to provide him with clothes of better quality.

He is a very dynamic and serious young man whi has demostrated his passion and his seriousness and his ability to manage credit. If he has arrived at this point in his life it is due to his devotion and courage in a mostly un-favorable environment. He is deserving of our support to help him rise above this difficult situation.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Agbaï Maduka K. est né le 27 mars 1975 au Nigeria. Il n’a pas eu une scolarité brillante et doit suivre son grand frère commerçant pour s’installer au Togo. Togolais par filiation, il est père d’un enfant. Il a difficilement débuté dans le commerce par l’achat et la vente des vêtements de la friperie. Mais progressivement, il a acquis une expérience dans le domaine et a reçu des financements qui lui ont permis d’acheter en gros et même d’ouvrir sa propre boutique dans le marché d’Adawlato à lomé.

Aujourd’hui, il sollicite un nouveau financement de 1200 dollars pour inciter ses fournisseurs à leur concéder plus de stock de meilleure qualité.

C’est un jeune homme très dynamique et sérieux qui a démontré dans le passé sa rigueur et sa capacité de gestion de crédit. S’il est arrivé à ce stade c’est grâce à son dévouement et à son courage dans un environnement qui ne lui était pas favorable. Il mérite qu’on le soutienne pour lui permettre de sortir de sa situation difficile.

loans.use: Sale of second-hand clothing

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita has 12 years of experience selling meat and pork. She works in this business together with her husband. She has succeeded in taking the business forward little by little with her savings. Currently she sells pork and chickens by the pound. She works only weekends, from 7 a.m. to 12 a.m. She and her husband slaughter the chickens they later distribute to their clients in the food business.

Margarita wants this loan so that she can invest in more meat, which will allow her to increase her earnings. She hopes that with the investment she will be able to work every day of the week.

Margarita is married with 4 adult children. She lives with her husband, her mother and a grandchild whom she is raising. Her husband handles the distribution of the chickens and pork. She helps him prepare the carcasses. He also works making deliveries with a cart the couple owns. In addition to her business, Margarita works in an administrative position in a health clinic. She is hoping that with this investment she will be able to improve her life and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Margarita tiene una experiencia de 12 años en el negocio de venta de carne y de chancho, actividad que la trabaja junto a su esposo. Ella poco a poco con sus ahorros ha logrado sacar adelante el trabajo. Actualmente venden carne de chancho y pollos por libras. Trabaja solo los fines de semana. En horario de 7 a.m. hasta las 12 a.m. Junto a su esposo se encargan de matar los pollos que luego los distribuyen a personas conocidas del sector.

Margarita desea el crédito para poder invertir en carnes lo que a ella le daría mayor ganancia. Lo que espera con la inversión poder trabajar también todos los días de la semana.

Margarita es casada. Tiene 4 hijos los que ya están adultos. Ahora vive junto a su esposo, su mama y un nieto que ella lo esta criando. Su esposo es la persona que prácticamente se encarga de repartir los pollos y chanchos. Ella ayuda en pelarlos. El también trabaja en un carrito que tienen. Saliendo a realizar fletes. Margarita además de su negocio trabaja en un centro de salud en el puesto de Auxiliar de Servicio. Esperando que con la inversión que realiza poder ir mejorando su vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: Invest in a greater quantity of meat and chicken

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.en:
Maria Cecilia is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her husband works as a farm hand harvesting corn. She has a grocery store in her home and she wants to invest her part of the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store, like rice, tea, sugar, salt, pasta, etc. She is part of the group "Metze 1", together with Mrs. Gloria Petra V. Estrada, who buy corn wholesale and sells it retail to people in her community. She wants to invest her part of the loan to be able to buy more corn.

Translated by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer

MARIA CECILIA TIENE 37 AÑOS , CASADA , 3 HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA EN EL CAMPO EN LA COSECHA DEL MAIZ . ELLA TIENE EN SU CASA UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES Y SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO ESPERA PODER INVERTIRLO EN COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA PARA ABASTECER SU NEGOCIO ( ARROZ, TE , AZUCAR, SAL , PASTAS , ETC ) . FORMA PARTE DEL GRUPO MEZTE 1 JUNTO CON DOÑA GLORIA PETRA V. ESTRADA QUE SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA DE MAIZ EN GRANDES CANTIDADES Y LO VENDE AL MENUDEO CON LA GENTE DE SU COMUNIDAD.CON SU PARTE DEL PRESTAMO ESPERA AUMENTAR LA COMPRA DE MAIZ.

loans.use: grocery store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
"My business gives me great satisfaction," says Mrs. Rose O.. She sells local drinks to people in her community and she hope to increase her business if granted a loan of US$ 325.

Rose is 35 years old ,married with six children, and happy that she is able to send her children to school. She started this business back in 2000.

loans.use: To buy gallon quantities of local drinks

loans.name: Maris

texts.en: Mrs. Maris O. is 33 years old, married with two children, and lives in Benin City. She sells medication to people living in her community. She has been in this business since 2003 and she has been a LAPO client for one year. She learned her business of selling medication from the hospital. She is requesting a loan of $625 to buy more medications to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drugs and medications.

loans.name: Ahammd Farid

texts.en: Ahammd Farid lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is with two children. He lives with his own family. He has a retail shop and he has been involved in this business more than 4 years now. He wants to enlarge his shop so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his stock and increase his business so that he can make a good income for his family and help them better. He is happy about this loan and he would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Eeng

texts.en: Eeng H. is a 32-year-old woman who raises duck livestock at her house. She has to raise and fatten them before she can selling them. She can earn up to US$50 per month. Her husband, Apoi, has no fixed income. She requests a $150 loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo was retired, but she decided to start a business because she did not like being idle at home. Her husband´s income as a mechanic is also insufficient to pay for their home expenses. So she began making handicrafts, jewellry, and selling catalog goods. Slowly but surely she built up her client base.

Consuelo has to purchase more merchandise. On the photograph we see her with a picture in her hand and a small bracelet as this is the only way to display what she sells until she gets more stock. Consuelo needs a US $925 microloan to repay in 6 months. With this money she will purchase more merchandise to increase her sales. With your help Consuelo will be able to make her business flourish.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Olmahon

texts.en: Olmahon B. is 40 years old, married and has six children. She makes a living running a café located in her town's central market, where she attracts many clients. Her husband is a cook who also works in café. Today, Olmahon rents her location, but she dreams one day of opening her own shop. She also hopes to become more successful by running a bakery where she can make pastries with meat and the national bread known as lepeshka.  Olmahon is requesting a loan of $225 to buy ingredients such as meat, potatoes and onions. She has a positive credit history, and promises to make payments on time and accurately.

loans.use: To buy meat, potatoes and onions to cook in her café.

loans.name: Zulfa's Faraja Group

texts.en:
Zulfa is 30 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, aged 12 years old. Zulfa sells snacks. She started her business in 2004. Every day, she works from 5.30am to 5.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Zahara, who sells food.

loans.use: To buy more food for her business.

loans.name: Atubonekisye

texts.en: Atubonikisye M. is from Kyela Mbeya, Tanzania.  She is 32 years old, married, and has two children aged four and nine.  She also cares for nine dependents, who live with her because they are orphans.  In 1990, Atubonikisye established a farming business with the help of Selfina, an organization that works towards the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through sale and leaseback agreements for small farmers.  Atubonikisye now requires a new loan of $425 in order  to buy additional stock in bulk for her farm.

loans.use: To buy additional stock in bulk.

loans.name: Ana Amelia

texts.es:
Doña Ana is a 42 year-old single mother from La Libertad, she finished her secondary studies and has 1 young daughter who is dependent on her; she lives in the “Urbanización Virgen de la Puerta” in the town of Trujillo – Peru. Doña Ana sells beauty products as well as hamburgers from her front door. She has been doing this for 6 months as she knows she alone is responsible for her daughter and therefore has to carry out different activities. She received her first loan of S/.100 from Manuela Ramos two years ago and it was invested in beauty products. She is a member of “Banco Comunal SAN JUDAS TADEO”. The loan of S/.900, to be repaid in 4 months, will be invested in both businesses, buying cosmetics and some products for the preparation of hamburgers. Doña Ana dreams of having her own business, a better conditioned restaurant where she can sell her hamburgers.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ana es madre soltera, tiene 42 años, natural de La Libertad, cursó estudios secundarios completos, tiene 01 hija pequeña dependiente de ella; vive en la Urbanización Virgen de la Puerta en la cuidad de Trujillo – Perú. La señora Ana se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y también se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas, en la puerta de su casa aproximadamente lleva medio año en este negocio, sabe que sola debe sacar adelante a su hija y tiene que incursionar en diferentes negocios. Se inició con Manuela Ramos hace dos años concediéndole un primer préstamo de S/.100.oo, invertido la compra de productos de belleza. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “ SAN JUDAS TADEO”, Con el préstamo de S/. 900.oo, el cual cancelara en un plazo de 04 meses; lo invertirá en ambos negocios, en la compra de cosméticos, y algunos productos para la preparación de las hamburguesas. La señora Ana sueña con tener un negocio propio, un restaurante para poder vender sus hamburguesas en mejores condiciones.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to increase sales.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov S., 35, is married to Chhum Pheakdey, and they live with their two children in the Prey Veng province. She sells lottery tickets in the local market and is paid by commission, typically making $5 (US dollars) per day. Her husband runs a motor taxi service and usually makes $5 (US dollars) per day.

Pov S. has been looking for ways to increase her daily income and believes that her husband’s business has room for expansion. He can make higher profits and increase his daily income through the transformation of his motor taxi into a tuk tuk. A tuk tuk is a motorbike with a trailer attached where people can sit inside. It is popular among foreign tourists.

Pov S. is asking for a loan of $1200 (US dollars) to purchase this trailer for her husband to improve his current business and their standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase a trailer for motorbike

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce N. is 26 years old. She is a married woman with 2 children ages 8 and 3. She became a cow seller in 2003. Every day, she works from 7am to 1pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Joyce now hopes for a loan of $175 to increase her stock in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: José De Jesús

texts.es:
El señor José se casó con la señora Carolina, tienen 4 hijos quienes se dedican a estudiar.

El señor José se dedica en la compra de carbón en bolsas el cual empaqueta y lo vende en pequeña cantidad, esa actividad empezó hace cuestión de 3 años. Dicha actividad lo monto con los ahorros que iba acumulando de su salario, pues, cabe destacar que también trabaja como guardia de seguridad en una casa particular.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un lote de carbón cuyo costo esta en oferta. El cliente tiene como meta apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios para que en el día de mañana puedan tener una profesión.
texts.en:
José married Carolina, and they have four children who are in school.

José dedicates himself to purchasing charcoal in sacks, which he then repackages and sells in smaller quantities. He started this activity three years ago. Said enterprise was undertaken with savings he had from his salary as a security guard at a private home.

The loan he is seeking is for the purchase of a batch of charcoal which is being offered at a sale price. This client has as a goal to support his children in their educations so that tomorrow they can have a profession.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 100 sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
El caballero Abraham V. es originario del municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinanadega y se dedica al negocio de la agricultura con el cual mantiene a su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos en edad escolar. Con mucho sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante y se ha apoyado de los créditos que le ha brindado Ceprodel.

A pesar de la problemática económica que ha atravesado ha logrado con mucho sacrificio llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y es por eso que hoy en día se ha preocupado por mejorar su actividad de trabajo invirtiendo en los cultivos por medio de la asistencia técnica y de la compra de las hortalizas para su desarrollo.

Hoy en día el motivo por el cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los insumos para el cultivo. Con este crédito se beneficia tanto él como su familia a la que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Mr. Abraham V. is originally from the Somotillo municipality of the city of Chinandega and he is a farmer, which is how he supports his family which consists of his wife and two small school-aged children. With great sacrifice he has been able to be successful and has supported himself with the loans he has received from Ceprodel. In spite of the economic challenges that he has encountered, he has been able, with much sacrifice, to support his home and that is why today he is concerned about improving his work by investing in crops through technical assistance and by buying fertilizers for their development. Today he has approached Ceprodel for a loan that will permit him to buy supplies for his crops. With this loan it will benefit him as well as the family that he so loves.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for his crops

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad H., 44, is married with six children. They live with his parents in Shewa Nangarhar province, Jalalabad city. He is a teacher in his village school and also he works in animal husbandry because he has grassland.

H. has three sons and three daughters. It is important to him to educate his children. H. has a plan to make a canteen (school shop) in the school. For that he needs 50,000AF (US$ 1,050) as an individual loan for 24 months.

Therefore he got in contact with the lenders of AFSG to give him 50,000AF in an individual loan. With this money he wants to buy various things such as notebooks, pens, pencils, and sharpeners or other things for the canteen. He has his own capital of 32,000AF (US$ 654) to add to the loan and he can solve his problem. He says, "Thanks Kiva; thanks a lot to the lenders!"

loans.use: buying notebooks, pens, pencils, etc.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es: DON WILSON ES SEPARADO DE SU PRIMERA ESPOSA CON LA CUAL TIENE UNA HIJA, PASA PENSIONES PARA MANUTENCION. ACTUALMENTE VIVE SOLO JUNTO CON SUS PADRES QUE SON PERSONAS MAYORES, PERO DESEA FORMALIZAR CON SU SEGUNDA PAREJA, NO VIVEN JUNTOS PERO YA TUVIERON UN BEBE. TRABAJA EN LA POLICIA HACE 17 AÑOS. ES ASALARIADO POR LO CUAL NO TIENE COMPETENCIA. EL DESTINO ES PARA COMPRAR UNA COCINA INDUSTRIAL, GARRAFA Y UTENCILIOS DE COCINA. ES UN CLIENTE QUE EN LA INSTITUCION TIENE BUEN CUMPLIMIENTO CON UN PROMEDIO DE CERO DIAS DE RETRASO.
texts.en:
Don Wilson is separated from his first wife, with whom he had a daughter. He pays his first wife child support. Now he lives alone with his elderly parents, but he wants to marry again. He and his second partner don't live together, but they already have a baby together. He has worked in the police force for seventeen years. He has a salary, but it is insufficient. He will allocate the loan to buy an industrial kitchen, a carafe, and kitchen utensils. He is a client that has good compliance with an average of zero late repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a kitchen and utensils

loans.name: Hamis

texts.en: Hamis O. is a small businessman in Buguruni Ward in Dar es Salaam. He runs a shop, and the income generated is used to meet his family's daily needs. He sells a variety of items. He purchases from wholesale shops in Kariakoo Business Center and other shops in the area. He plans to open a wholesale shop because demand is much higher than his ability to supply. He requests a loan of T.shs 1,200,000.to boost his business.

loans.use: To build up the business

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Шарафутдинова Эльмира женщина в возрасте 54 года имеет одну взрослую дочь.Муж работает электриком.Эльмира арендует помещение в центре г.Худжанда и занимается реализацией лекарственных препаратов.Её аптека не такая уж большая, для увеличения товара она решила получить кредит.На сумму займа Эльмира хочет закупить самые необходимые лекарства при гриппозных состояниях человека.Сейчас время гриппа,и население имеет спрос на лекарственные препараты.Эльмира заранее благодарна, за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Elmira S. is a woman of 54 years and has one grown daughter. Her husband works as an electrician. Elmira rents a space in the center of Khudjanda city and sells pharmaceuticals. Her pharmacy is not so big and to increase her inventory she decided to apply for a loan. She wants to use the loan to buy all the necessary medicine for the treatment of flu. Because right now it's a flu season and the residents are in need of these drugs. Elmira is very grateful for the help and support in advance.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sending them to the market for sale at Katakyiasi near Cape Coast. Grace has received junior high education. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a merchant.

Grace has been selling fish since 2006. She is responsible for helping pay the children's school fees and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back for the expansion of her business selling processed fish.

loans.use: to increase her capital to buy fish in larger quantities

loans.name: Kulabako Faridah Group

texts.en:
N. is 27 years old and married with 4 children. She rents a one-room house and four people live in it. She has access to piped water and electricity. She does not have additional family to look after.
