She normally has four meals a day. Her greatest expenditure is food, because all the food they eat at home is purchased.

N. runs a salon / cosmetics shop which is located in the market centre. She works 5 days a week, and her only expense is market dues for her business.

She mainly receives women customers to her salon. She has done this business for over six years now, although previously she had tried to sell piped water to her neighbours. The only problem she sometimes faces in her business is the potential for losses, although it is not common occurrence.

She has been with MCDT for five years now, and the reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because she wanted to start a business. She is going to use this loan to increase her business.

loans.use: Buy beauty oils

loans.name: Elie

texts.en: Elie A. is 21 years old and married. He lives in the Ashrafieh district of Beirut. He opened a barbershop in 2005, after learning the business from a friend. Elie wishes to use this loan of $800 to improve his barbershop’s décor.

loans.use: Improve shop's décor

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en:
Pelenatete M., 49, is married and has four children.  She has two years of experience in the handicrafts business. She sells her items to the villagers and the general public four days per week. 

She has received one loan from SPBD.  SPBD loans are Pelenatete’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from the traditional banks.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

loans.use: to help pay for her children's school fees and home improvement

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El comité 8 de Diciembre se formó gracias a la unión de vecinas del barrio 8 de Diciembre de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Todas las integrantes del comité tienen un trabajo donde invertir el dinero que reciben o en algunos casos comenzarán su microemprendimiento a partir de la capitalización de este préstamo.  

Varias integrantes del comité son costureras dedicadas a la confección de ropas tradicionales y otros trabajos manuales. También integran el comité varias personas que se dedican a la venta de ropas y otros artículos.

Las integrantes del comité reciben en promedio un crédito de Gs.300.000

Las integrantes son: 

1	Perla Maria R.	Modista
2	Claudia C.	Venta de lencería
3	Maria R.	Venta de Ropas
4	Cira R.	Modista
5	Maximina E.	- Repostería - 
6	Patricia G.	- Venta de Quiniela - 
7	Angela B.	- Venta de cosméticos - 
8	Ramona A.	 - Venta de quiniela - 
9	Dominga C.	- Venta de quiniela  -
10	Myrian S.	-  
11	Gabriela G.	- Cantina  - 
12	Cirila M.	 - Almacén    - 
13	Victoriana Estigarribia	 - Venta de comidas - 
14	Celia B.    - Venta de Ropas - 
15	Silvia T.	- Venta decomidas - 
16	Elida G.	- Almacén - 
17	Julia M.	 - Venta de comidas - 
18	Percida M.	Venta de Frutas - 
19	Mariela C..	- Venta de carteras - 
20	Lucia A.	- Venta de quiniela
texts.en:
The group 8 de Diciembre (“8th of December”) was formed thanks to the joining together of women from the neighborhood of the same name, located in the city of Villa Elisa. All the members of the group have businesses to invest the loan funds into, or will use the funds to start their own micro-enterprises. Several members are seamstresses dedicated to making traditional clothing and other handmade items. Other members of the group sell clothing and other products. The members receive on average an amount of Gs. 300.000. The members are: 1. Perla Maria R. - Dressmaker  2. Claudia C. – Undergarment Sales  3. Maria R. – Clothing Sales  4. Cira R. -- Dressmaker  5. Maximina E. - Bakery  6. Patricia G. – Lottery Ticket Sales  7. Angela B. – Cosmetics Sales  8. Ramona A. - Lottery Ticket Sales 9. Dominga C. - Lottery Ticket Sales 10. Myrian S.   11. Gabriela G. - Café  12. Cirila M. – Grocery Store 13. Victoriana Estigarribia – Food Sales  14. Celia B. – Clothing Sales 15. Silvia T. - Food Sales 16. Elida G. – Grocery Store  17. Julia M. - Food Sales 18. Percida M. – Fruit Sales  19. Mariela C.. – Purse Sales  20. Lucia A. - Lottery Ticket Sales

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The loan funds granted to members of this group were used, in large part, for the purchase of merchandise such as clothes, fruits, vegetables, dairy products.  Said items were purchased by the women who are merchants.  The seamstresses bought items such as thread, fabric, needles, etc.

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
Mrs. Jovie E. is 25 years old and married with two children. She is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. Her husband is a salesboy in an establishment.

Mrs. E. has been a member of Paglaum MPC since April of 2009. She is seeking a loan for her sari-sari store to purchase additional stock, such as laundry items, seasonings, goodies, toiletries, drinks, and other household items. She aims to have a successful business with a concrete store and for her children to finish college degrees and have good futures.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Ayuru

texts.en:
Ayuru M. sells beer at the bar and is requesting a loan to purchase more crates of beer to sell. She is 30 years old and married to a cattle keeper. Ayuru has two children who are attending school at Juba Girls' secondary school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a bar as a selling point.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services. These are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret M. is fifty years old, widowed, and has given birth to four children: a daughter and three sons. Some are currently in the senior high while others are in the tertiary institutions and the junior high schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region.

Margaret is a trader, trading in cereals such as maize, beans, millet, etc. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She supplies to food vendors and retailers. Margaret also treks to other markets to sell. She has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Margaret aspires to expand her business and to sponsor all her children in school to the apex.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Salohat

texts.en:
K. Salohad lives in Istaravshan. She is married and has 4 children. She is a happy mother of 3 pretty children and one  daughter. Istaravshan is famous for its apricots and walnuts. Salohad has been engaged for 10 years in a home-based business of walnut processing and selling. It is the family business. Salohat applies to KIVA with the request of a business development loan of 1200 STJ to be used towards seasonal works implementation and business turnover increase. She thanks KIVA for the small business support.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following each step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”.
“Arvand”, being assignee of “MicroInvest”, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

loans.use: business development

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana K. is a fishmonger. She buys fresh fish from the fishermen, processes it through smoking at Elmina and sells it at Denu. Juliana has received primary.  She is a widow and has two children. Juliana has been selling fish since 1988. She is responsible for paying school fees and other bills. Her loan will be used to buy fish to process and then sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand the business and also to help the children further their education.

loans.use: To buy fish to process and sell.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora se dedica a la venta de comida en la zona donde vive, su esposo la abandonó, ella sola mantiene a sus tres hijos los cuales todavía están estudiando; lamentablemente en esta temporada subieron los precios de los abarrotes y es por eso que requiere comprar por cantidad los mismos para conseguir mejorar sus costos; vive en alquiler la casa queda ubicada en la zona Río Seco de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinará para la compra de abarrotes (fideo y arroz) y así poder incrementar sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Teodora.
texts.en:
Teodora sells food in the area where she lives. Her husband abandoned her. She supports her three children by herself. The children still go to school. Sadly, the prices of groceries have gone up this season. That is why she needs to buy wholesale to improve her costs. She lives in a rented house, which is in the Río Seco zone in the city of El Alto. The loan is to buy groceries (noodles and rice) to be able to increase her income. This is her first loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies Teodora for the loan she has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale noodles and rice to reduce costs in her business of selling food

loans.name: Chicas Sexis Group

texts.es:
El grupo Chicas sexis está formado por 3 mujeres trabajadoras, quienes denotan en sus rostros su esfuerzo y entrega al trabajo que realizan.

Doña Josefa F.; es la coordinadora del grupo, de 57 años de edad, a quien vemos en el centro de la fotografía, un rostro alegre y un carácter joven; Ella posee un negocio fijo de venta de ropa en la plaza Ana María, desde hace aproximadamente 30 años. Inicio trabajándole a una amiga quien tenía un modulo donde vendía sus productos. Impulsada por su optimismo decidió tomar un modulo e iniciar la venta de ropa.

Actualmente ha logrado surtir mucho su tramo, pretende seguir adelante con la ayuda de su esposo, no importando los contras que encuentre en  el camino. Su crédito pretende invertirlo en la compra de uniformes escolares ya que se acercan las fiestas patrias y estos tienen mucha demanda en esta época del año. Además invertir en compra de camisetas de varón y pantalones de vestir.

Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de su hogar (El techo, que se le ha dañado), y que su hijo termine su carrera universitaria.

Pastora V. tiene un tramo donde vende productos perecederos (comidas, lácteos y productos refrigerados), negocio que mantiene desde hace b16 años; Y María P. vende Ropa en el mercado Roberto Huembes desde hace 18 años.
texts.en:
The group “Chicas Sexis” (Sexy Ladies) is composed of three hardworking women who put a lot of effort and commitment into their work.

Doña Josefa F. is the group coordinator (seen in the photograph seated in the middle). She is a 57 year old woman who possesses a cheerful disposition and a youthful spirit. She has an established business, which has been operation for the past 30 years, selling clothes in the Plaza Ana María. She started working for a friend who had a similar business, but later decided to start her own clothing shop.

Today her business has grown tremendously and she intends to move forward with the help of her husband, regardless of any obstacles they encounter along the way. Her loan will be used to buy school uniforms since the patron saint holidays are approaching and demand is high during that time of year. She will also buy shirts and dress slacks for men.

Her biggest dreams are to make home improvement repairs (the roof of her house was damaged) and see her son finish his college studies.

Pastora V. has a vending post where she has been selling perishable goods (food, dairy, and refrigerated products) for the past 16 years. María P. has been selling clothes in the Roberto Huembes Market for 18 years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is twenty-eight years old. She is divorced and has given birth to two children. Both are currently in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming community in the region.

Martha is a baker. She works hard to provide for her family. She bakes bread to sell wholesale and retail. She supplies to other retailers and beverage sellers in her community. Martha buys bags of flour and other ingredients from nearby communities at affordable prices. She has been in business for five years now and is requesting a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour to produce baked goods for sale.

loans.name: Rosal

texts.en:
Rosal D. is from the village of Upper Langcangan. She is 44 years old. Rosal is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosal owns and operates a specialized retail store, where she sells home and beauty products, such as dish washing soap, detergent powder, lotion, and perfumes in the local community. Rosal has been in business for over three years and earns approximately 5,600 PHP a month.

In 2006, Rosal joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Rosal is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Rosal from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further improve/expand the business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her product offering

loans.name: Timan

texts.fr: Cette femme dispose d’une boutique de vente des produits d’alimentation générale dans le marché de Hédzranawoé à Lomé. Elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 2004 et cette activité lui permet d’apporter sa contribution financière dans la gestion du foyer ; dans cette boutique, elle vend des produits alimentaires comme les petits pois, les tomates en boîtes, les sardines. Elle vend aussi des couches jetables pour enfants. Sa boutique est bien située dans le marché, ce qui fait que cette dame réalise de bonnes affaires. Elle sait aussi bien accueillir sa clientèle. Avec tous ses atouts, elle a su fidéliser la plupart de ses clients. Actuellement elle veut constituer de nouveaux stocks ; pour cela elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 cartons de sardines, 20 cartons de tomates en boîtes, 12 cartons de petits pois, 20 cartons de lait Nestlè mais aussi des couches jetables pour enfants. Elle est mère d’un enfant.

loans.use: Achat des produits d'alimentation générale

loans.name: Virgen De Concepcion Group

texts.es: "Virgen de Concepción" es el nombre elegido por un grupo de catorce miembros, que han dedicado gran parte de su vida al comercio de todo tipo de mercadería, por ejemplo Francisca G. junto a su esposo, se dedica a la compra de conos de plástico (reciclaje de conos para hilos y cuerdas), luego de obtener estos en cantidad los revende a fabricas de hilos, Sus compañeras tienen otras actividades como ser: venta de telas, confección de chalecos y chamarras, venta de abarrotes, venta de condimentos y otros. Afirman que necesitan comprar mercadería, de este modo obtener mejores  recursos para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
"Virgen de Concepción" ("Immaculate Conception") is the name for this group of 14 members who have dedicated a large part of their lives to selling all kinds of merchandise. For example, Francisca G. makes a living, along with her husband, buying plastic cones used to package threads and strings, and then when they have enough, they resell it to the factories to recycle. Her fellow members have other activities such as, selling fabrics, making vests and jackets, selling groceries and selling condiments and other items. The members attest they need to purchase merchandise, and in this way they will obtain more resources for their family's well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of rice, soap, cooking oil, sugar and salt in bulk

loans.name: Selenge

texts.en:
Selenge D. graduated from school in 2006 and got just married recently. She is now 32 years old and lives with her husband and 1-year-old daughter in Bayanhongor province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her husband currently stays home and takes care of the baby. Selenge used to mine for gold by hand like many locals do at the gold-mining site. She gave up the dirty mining and decided to sell clothes at the local market. Since July 2008, she has been renting a small stall at the local black market and retailing women’s and men’s clothes. She purchases inventory clothes from China, where many of cheap products flood into the country and resells them at her stall. She hopes to expand her business and rent one more stall to sell more clothes. Selenge requests a loan to purchase more inventory for her retail business. About XacBank: XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.
To get regular updates from XacBank, please join our lending team.
To lend to more Mongolian borrowers, please click here.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es:
Timotea, D. 61 años, es una mujer muy amable y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su familia, y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro con tal D. sobresalir en la vida.
En la pequeña habitación donD. duerme, Timotea teje a mano las artesanías más coloridas del mercado, ella realiza tejidos a pedido, ya que los modelos que elabora son muy especiales y necesariamente se tienen que hacer a mano. A parte D. trabajar a pedido, también tiene un puesto D. venta en la ciudad D. Puno, donD. todos los sábados ofrece sus tejidos a las personas que asisten a la feria.
Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es tejer y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su cuarto cumpliendo con los pedidos. 
Para el futuro, Timotea espera poder comprar una máquina D. tejer, ya que también desea incursionar en este tipo D. prendas artesanales.

Este es el tercer préstamo D. Timotea con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus pagos, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta y sabe que le ayudará a progresar. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana parta elaborar nuevos tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
Timotea, age 61, is a very likable and cheerful woman who lives in her own house together with her family, and who is willing to work very hard in order to get ahead in life. In the little room she sleeps in, Timotea makes handmaD. weavings which are the most colorful in the local market. She prepares weavings to order, since her weavings are very special and must be created by hand. In addition to filling orders, she also has a sales stall in the city of Puno, where she offers her weavings each Saturday to the people who visit the market. She has done this work for 20 years, and what she likes best about it is the weaving, which she carries out with great patience. She thinks the most difficult part is staying all day in her room filling orders. In the future, Timotea hopes to be able to buy a sewing machine, since she would also like to branch out into other types of handmaD. garments. This is Timotea's third loan with MFP, and she expects to be very punctual with her payments, since she does not want to cause problems for her communal bank. She is very satisfied with her communal bank, and she knows it will help her to make progress. With the 1500 Peruvian soles she is requesting, she will purchase more wool to create new handmaD. weavings.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wool

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.es: Aurelia G. G. de 40 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Colón en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a sus dos hijas, las cuales se dedican a estudiar. Aurelia  posee una venta de tortillas, negocio el cual en El Salvador es muy rentable, debido a que estas forman parte de la dieta diaria de las personas. Es por esto que ella obtiene ganancias cada día, las cuales le permiten invertir en el mismo negocio, y así mismo solventar todos los gastos del hogar. Aurelia solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz de manera que cuente con más materia prima para la elaboración de las tortillas, así mismo comprar tambos de gas propano adicionales. Aurelia es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable que ha sabido darles todo lo necesario a sus hijas ella sola, ya que ha sido la única que ha trabajado para ellas, es por esto que desea poder mejorar las ventas de su negocio, para que nunca haga falta nada en su hogar.
texts.en:
Aurelia G. Garcia is 40 years old. She lives in the municipality of Colón, in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her two daughters, who are both studying. Aurelia sell tortillas, which is a very good business in El Salvador since tortillas are a part of people's diet. This is how she earns an income everyday, which she invests in the business. It also allows her to pay the household expenses. Aurelia is requesting a loan with which she can buy a larger quantity of corn so that she can have more of this ingredient for making tortillas and also so she can buy additional tanks of propane gas. Aurelia is a very hardworking woman who has had to provide for her daughters by herself. She wants to improve sales in her business so that her household will never lack for anything.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making tortillas

loans.name: Reyna Maria

texts.es: Reyna Maria tiene 12 meses de laborar para la Alcaldia de  coral Chontales como responsable de Emacol. Ella todavia no se ha casado, no tiene hijos vive con sus padres la cual los apoya con  gastos basicos del hogar, tambien cuando sus padres se encuentran enfermos ella cuida de ellos ya que son una familia bien unida. Esta  solicitando su primer credito a la intitución de AFODENIC,  el cual lo requiere para  construir una habitacion de concreto para asi tener privacidad,   es una mujer trabajadora , responsable con buenas relaciones en  el municipio.
texts.en:
Reyna Maria has worked for 12 months for la Alcaldia de Coral Chontales, responsible for Emacol. She hasn't married yet, and doesn't have children, and lives with her parents whom she supports with basic household costs. Also, when her parents get sick, she looks after them as they are a very united family. She is seeking her first loan from the institution AFODENIC, which is required to construct a concrete room so she can have privacy. She is a very hard-working woman, responsible, and has good relationships with others in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construct a room

loans.name: Mayacine

texts.fr: Monsieur Mayacine Guèye demeurant à Thiès Darou Salam est chauffeur de camion  depuis plus de 20  ans grâce à l’influence de son oncle qui lui a formé dans ce métier. Il travaille actuellement  dans une société de travaux routiers à Tambacounda au Sud Est du Sénégal. Agé de 41 ans Monsieur Guèye vit avec ses 2 femmes  et ses 6 enfants  dans sa maison en cours de finitions. Cependant étant  membre de U-IMCEC depuis Mai 2008, il  souhaite un  financement  pour  terminer les travaux au niveau de sa maison. Ainsi, il demande un prêt de 300 000 FCFA pour  carreler sa véranda et réfectionner la maison.
texts.en:
Mr. Mayacine Guèye lives in Thiès Darou Salam and has been a truck driver for over 20 years. It was his uncle who trained him for this line of work. He currently works for a road construction company in Tambacounda in the South of Senegal. Aged 41 years, Mr. Guèye lives with his two wives and his six children in his house which is in the process of being built. While being a member of U-IMCEC since May of 2008, he hopes to secure a loan to finish the work on his house. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 300,000 FCFA in order to tile his veranda and to make repairs to his house.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to make repairs to his house

loans.name: Osiris Mileyda

texts.es:
La señora L. A. realiza sus ventas de bebidas en un quiosco situado en las orias de un colegio de secundaria ella solicita el crédito a CEPRODEL para aumentar su inventario de productos y de esta manera generar mas ingresos al hogar.
Ella es madre de 5 hijos los cuales viven con ella nos dice que los créditos con CEPRODEL la han beneficiado mucho para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. L. A. sells her refreshments in a kiosk located on the outskirts of a high school. She needs the loan from CEPRODEL (Kiva’s field partner) to increase her inventory of products and in this way get more income for her home.

She is a mother to 5 children, all live with her and she tells us that the loans with CEPRODEL have helped her improve her way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandize for her refreshment business and candy for her students.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie G. is a 48-year-old married woman who lives in Nangka, Bayawan City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by running a rice retailing business.

Her husband, Ricardo, is 51 years old and works driving a habal habal (a single motorcycle that is the only mode of transportation in most  mountainous areas). They have two children who are 20 and 21 years old.  One works as a delivery boy and the other helps her parents in their business.

Rosemarie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in the rice retailing business. Now she earns an average monthly income of $326 from her business activities.

Rosemarie is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP was used to fund the operations of her rice retailing business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is on her 15th cycle loan, in the amount of 23,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her rice retailing business. Rosemarie is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Martha Rosa

texts.es: La joven Martha vive en el barrio Jericó, es una mujer emprendedora con deseo de superación, desde hace varios años con iniciativa de poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos, logro tener su propio negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos. El cual inicio con dinero propio de ahorros, luego opto por financiamiento para tener más mercancías. Su esposo trabaja como medico veterinario, tiene dos hermosos hijos, por el cual día a día desea incrementar las ventas para poder dar lo necesarios,  sus planes es poder comprar una dos vitrina para poder exhibir sus productos, aumentar las venta de ropa y zapatos es por eso con este préstamo hará la inversión en ropa y zapatos para cumplir con la demanda de los clientes, ya que tiene poca mercancía y desea aprovechar este verano,  así como la captación de clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
Martha is an enterprising young woman who lives in the neighborhood of Jericó and has the desire to excel. Several years ago, she took the initiative to help her husband with the expenses. Martha established her own business selling clothing, shoes, and cosmetics. Her husband works as a veterinarian. They have two beautiful children. Day after day, she hopes to increase her sales so that she can give her children what they need.

Martha plans to buy two display cases for exhibiting her products. To increase her clothing and shoe sales, she will invest this loan in more merchandise so that she can meet the demand of her customers because she is low on inventory at the moment. She would like to take advantage of the summer season to attract new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing & shoes to increase her summer sales

loans.name: Aderemi

texts.en: Aderemi is 40 years and married with five children. He is a hard working man and he is determined to lift his business and family above poverty. He lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. He is a fashion designer by profession and he sells sarongs. With these combined businesses, he hopes to meet the basic needs of his immediate family. He has been in this business for 20 years. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more tailoring material and clothes to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and clothes

loans.name: Vugukuri Group

texts.fr:
Monique H. est une commerçante âgée de 49 ans qui habite la Commune urbaine de Kanyosha en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle a fait ses études jusqu’en 7e année des écoles secondaires.  Elle  achète des bananes pour en fabriquer du vin qu’elle vend  dans les banlieues de Kanyosha. C’est un métier qu’elle a toujours pratiqué bien même avant qu’elle ne reçoive le crédit de Turame.

Elle est mère de 7 enfants ; 4 filles et 3 garçons et 5 d’entre eux sont mariés tandis que les 2 autres étudient à l’école secondaire. Elle lutte pour que ses enfants puissent étudier et terminer avec succès mais aussi avoir chacun sa propre maison en ville afin qu’ils vivent aisément. 

Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour augmenter la quantité des bananes à acheter pour pouvoir accroitre la quantité de vin qu’elle revend aux clients. Elle a l’espoir d’avoir un grand bénéfice avec cette augmentation de son capital. Elle pourra ainsi résoudre certaines de ses difficultés  relatives aux dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarisation de ses enfants.  

 Elle est une des membres du groupe « VUGUKURI  » et sont au 7e cycle.
texts.en:
Monique H., 30, is a businesswoman who lives in the township of Kanyosha in City Hall in Bujumbura. She made it through seventh grade. She buys bananas to make wine with and then sells the wine in the suburbs of Kanyosha. This is the business she has always done well at, even before she got a loan through Turame. Monique is the mother of seven children, four girls and three boys, and five of them are married, whereas two others attend secondary school. She struggles so that her children will be able to attend school and graduate with success, but also so that each will be able to have his own house in town and live comfortably. She is requesting the Kiva loan to buy more bananas and produce more wine to sell to her customers. She hopes that this increase in working capital will lead to a lot more profit. That way, she will be able to resolve certain of her difficulties with daily expenses and paying school fees for her children. She is one of the members of the « VUGUKURI » group; they are on their seventh loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy more bananas so as to produce more of the wine she sells to her customers

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita P. is from the village of Nabbotuan, Solana, Cagayan. She is 34 years old. Mercedita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mercedita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Mercedita has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Mercedita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedita successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from ASKI. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Mercedita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and then sell

loans.name: Julia Lidia

texts.es: Julia Lidia tiene 49 años. Se dedica desde hace más de 7 años a la venta de mercadería en general,  su negocio goza de muy buena acogida gracias al buen trato que brinda a sus clientes. Por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de renovar su negocio, Julia desea captar más clientes para poder percibir más ingresos y salir adelante, pues siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse el dinero de una manera humilde y responsable. Ella sueña con poseer una mini tienda que ofrezca una gran variedad de productos. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como ropa, calzado, bolsos, toallas, cosméticos y cremas.
texts.en:
Julia is 49 years old and has been selling general merchandise for more than seven years. Her business is very successful, thanks to the good service she provides to her customers. She is constantly looking for ways to improve her business and wants to attract more customers in order increase her income and come out ahead. She has always liked working and earning an honest living. In the future she would like to open a small store where she can offer a large variety of products. She will use the money from this loan to buy inventory, such as clothing, shoes, bags, towels, cosmetics, and creams.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Mt Rongai Group

texts.en:
Meet M. R. M. and the Mt. Rongai Group!  M. is 55 years old, married, and has a 20-year-old daughter who goes to school.  AdditionA., he supports the 7-year-old son of his brother-in-law, and that child also goes to school.  

For the past 3 years, M. has run a business selling dishware.  He works from around 8 am until 6 pm each day, and earns about US$ 150 per month.  M. used his two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase his inventory, and he has repaid both loans successfully.  With this loan, M. plans to purchase a new stove, cups, plates, a basin and some washing buckets.  EventuA. he hopes to expand his business from retail sales to include a wholesale component.  M. is saving his profits and hopes to finish a new home for his family, which is already partiA. constructed.  

M. is the chairman of the Mt. Rongai Group.  The group's members run a variety of businesses, including sales of clothes, fruit, charcoal, soap and fish.  The group's 16 members will hold each other accountable for repaying this loan.  

In the photo, M. is wearing an orange and white stripped shirt, 1st on the left, second row.

loans.use: Buying dishware inventory

loans.name: Matrile

texts.en: Matrile J. is currently in the business of selling various popular drinks in her bar such as beer (Heineken, Red Horse, etc.) and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Matrile is 41 years old and is married to a husband who is a director. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a supermarket. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Jesus Aurelina

texts.es:
Jesús de 48 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (lugar habitado por comerciantes informales), ella tiene un taller de costura desde que se quedo soltera con cinco hijos. 

Comenzó a coser para poder mantener a sus hijos,  poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo comprar una maquina de coser, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ella tiene 8 años con su taller, trabaja en su casa ya que no tiene un local, trabaja de lunes a domingos. 

Para poder seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas y una maquina de coser, en el futuro quiere comprar una maquina industrial para repartir en almacenes.
texts.en:
Jesus is 48 years old and lives in el Guasmo de Guayaquil (an area inhabited by informal vendors). She has had her own sewing workshop ever since she got a divorce and had to raise her five children.

She started working in order to support her children. Little by little, after some effort, she was able to purchase a sewing machine. She has now been in business for the last 8 years. She works from home as she has no office space. She works Monday through Sunday.

In order to continue with her business, she wants to purchase fabric and a sewing machine with the loan money. In the future, she would like to purchase an industrial sewing machine so that she can supply garments to warehouses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric and a sewing machine

loans.name: Silvia Maria

texts.es: Silvia María tiene la actividad económica de pulpería. Hace más de 19 años que se dedica a este negocio pues ella no tenía un medio de ingreso para sustentar a su familia. Ella siempre ha sido una mujer muy responsable, siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios, pues siempre está esforzándose para mejorar su calidad de vida.   Este no es el primer financiamiento que solicita por lo que es así que su negocio ha podido mejorar así podrá comprar golosinas, refrescos naturales, jugos, detergentes y granos básicos. Ella desea ampliar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Silvia María has a general store. Since she didn’t have a source of income to sustain her family, she began her business some 19 years ago. She has always been a very responsible woman and has been concerned in giving her family the income needed since she is always working hard to improve their quality of life. This is not her first loan and her business has been able to improve and plans to buy candy, natural drinks, juices, detergents and basic grains. She wants to expand her business to improve her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital.

loans.name: El Espino Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario El Espino está conformado por Vilma Emerita P. M. de 53 años de edad, Nidia del Carmen C. H. de 28 y Silvia María Pérez Díaz de 24, ellas quieren aumentar su negocio y para lograrlo optaron por el crédito.

Vilma, la coordinadora y la mayor del grupo inició una venta de comida en su casa de habitación hace tres años, los cuales los dos últimos ha podido mejorar el aspecto e invertir en más capital de trabajo gracias a los créditos que se le han brindado. Nidia, se dedica a la compra/venta de maní y Silvia a la venta de prendas de manera ambulante.
texts.en:
The El Espino community bank has Vilma Emerita P. M. (age 53), Nidia del Carmen C. Hernandez (28), and Silvia Maria P. Diaz (24) as members. The want to expand their business and have requested a loan to do it. Vilma, who is the group coordinator and the eldest, started selling food out of her home three years ago. During the past two years she has been able to improve it and invest more working capital thanks to the loans she have received. Nidia works buying and selling peanuts and Silvia sells clothing door to door.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase various goods

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en una zona urbano – marginal del distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola con un movimiento comercial considerable. Pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte) el brinda este servicio en el distrito donde vive y gracias a los ingresos que le genera sustenta sus gastos personales y ayuda a su familia con su economía diaria. Esta actividad tiene mucha demanda por la zona ya que es relativamente barata y ràpida.

El continuo uso brindado durante el tiempo que viene trabajando con su vehículo ha hecho que este empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de mantenimiento constante para poder garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Es por ello que el se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Carlos es una persona honesta y bastante trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando arduamente para poder cuidar de sus padres y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Carlos is 34 years old, is single and lives with his parents on the outskirts of Chepen, an agricultural area with considerable commercial traffic. It's in the province of the same name and in the Libertad region, over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. He offers transportation services to passengers and cargo with his mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with a compartment for the purpose of transportation). He offers this service in the district where he lives and, thanks to the income it generates, he covers his personal costs and helps support his family. This business is in high demand in the area and is relatively economical and quick. Contant use during the time he has been working with his vehicle has meant that the vehicle has begun having several problems and needs constant maintenance to keep it working. This is why he is requesting from Edpyme Alternative a loan of 1500 nuevos soles. Carlos is an honest person and very hardworking. His dearest wish is to continue working hard to be able to take care of his parents and give them a better quality of life. He worked previously with Nuestra Institucion and showed punctuality and responsibility for achieving his quotas.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and maintenance costs for a mototaxi

loans.name: Benjamin Kiprotich

texts.en:
Benjamin Kiprotich M. is a 32-year-old man who is married to Ursila Jepchirchir. They have two children aged four years and six months old respectively. They live in Kapseret, ten kilometers from Eldoret town.

Benjamin operates a motorbike transport service from which he earns his income. He has been in this business for the past ten years, generating an income of Kshs 12,000 per month.

Benjamin was introduced to KADET by one of its credit officers and he is applying for his first loan of Kshs 50,000 with KADET. With this loan he plans to purchase another motorbike.

Benjamin hopes, with the income he is going to make, to invest more in the transportation sector and, in future, to buy a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase another motorbike

loans.name: Gennadyi

texts.en:
Gennadyi is a businessman from Berdyansk. He sells outerwear and sportswear in one of the local marketplaces in his home town. Gennadyi launched his enterprise ten years ago. Presently, his working capital is 50,000 UAH. His monthly income amounts to 10,000 UAH.

Gennadyi is seeking a loan of 11,000 UAH to increase his assortment of merchandise and his turnover capital as a result. Gennadyi believes that a wide assortment of clothing items will help him meet his customers’ needs and provide superior service. Satisfied customers will be more likely to return to buy from his kiosk and will also speak positively about his business to others, leading to further growth in his sales.

loans.use: To increase his assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Silvia Laura

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MACHUPICCHU”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Silvia Laura; ella tiene 58 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. ropa para damas, varones y niños, ella tiene una tienda en el centro comercial Cusco que queda ubicado en el, centro D. la ciudad D. Cusco, ella atienD. desD. las 10:00 a.m hasta 8:00 p.m, la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio D. venta D. ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería  como blusas, pantalones y chompas al por mayor para la tienda.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the community bank "Machupicchu".  The bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the Cusco province and Cusco department.

The member is Mrs. Silvia Laura, she is 58 years old, married and has 4 children.  She splits her time between her daily activities and a business selling clothing for men, women and children.  She has a store in the commercial center of Cusco which is located in the center of the city of Cusco.  She works at her store from 10:00 am until 8:00 pm.  She wants to improve and expand her sales business.  She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as blouses, pants, and sweaters at wholesale for sale in her store.

She is thankful to all those that are participating in making her dream come true and promises to make her loan payments in accordance with the established rules.

loans.use: The member is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise such as blouses, pants and sweaters at wholesale for her store.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Señor Miguel Ángel P. cuenta con 30 años de edad, el nos contó que desde muy joven trabajó en la elaboración de ladrillos junto con su padre, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar y tener un título universitario. 
Con el correr de los tiempos se hizo dueño de una olería (fábrica de ladrillos a base de arcilla que es quemado en un horno), dicho dinero será destinado para la compra de la olería, el lo consiguió trabajando día a día en la olería de su padre, compro esa olería para poder de esa forma trabajar  y así construir su propia casa donde más tarde se pueda independizar.
   El crédito solicitado es para la reparación del trapiche de la olería (mescladora de arcilla), ya que con el tiempo ya le hacía falta un poco de refacción.
  El señor  Miguel Ángel P. agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Miguel Ángel P. is thirty years of age. He tells us that from a very early age he worked making bricks alongside his father and so did not have the chance to go to school nor obtain a university degree. 

With the passage of time he became the owner of an olería (a factory producing bricks out of clay that is baked in a kiln). Said money will be used for the purchase of the olería. He obtained it by working day by day in his father's olería and bought that factory so as to have a means of doing this work. He hopes to build his own house where he may one day become independent. 

The requested loan is for repairs to the factory's clay mixer since over time it was needing a bit of refurbishment. 

Miguel Ángel P. gives thanks to the Fundación Paraguaya for the loan that was granted.

loans.use: For repairs to a clay mixer

loans.name: Dove Group

texts.en:
Mariam S. is in her late twenties and has one child.  For the past two years, she has run a business purchasing vitenge (cloth), kangas (sarongs), and other second-hand clothing, selling it door-to-door.  She purchases her goods in the Kariakoo marketplace of Dar es Salaam and sells them in Arusha, in the north of Tanzania.  

She works from 8 am to 9 pm, and makes a monthly profit of more than $100.  Her dream is to one day open a store to sell her clothing so that she doesn't have to sell door-to-door.  

This will be Mariam's first loan with Kiva field partner Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will share the loan with her group, Dove, which has 15 members in total.  The group members will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan.  Mariam can be seen in the photo in the center of the first row, seated, wearing orange and black.

loans.use: To purchase vitenge, kanga, and bed sheet to sell

loans.name: Lorena Patricia

texts.es: Lorena de 29 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su hijo Esta luchadora mujer se despierta muy temprano todos los días para empezar con las labores del hogar. Luego se dirige a recorrer las calles de su zona en busca de nuevos clientes para ofrecerles su mercadería de ropa, dice que obtiene regulares ganancias pues como ofrece las prendas al crédito, esto le proporciona la ventaja de cobrar con mayor precio del real. Pero comenta que le desagrada caminar durante largas horas por las calles en busca de nuevos clientes, pero asegura las ventas solo con clientes conocidos o recomendados. Por lo que no es la primera vez que solicita crédito  para la compra de faldas, pantalones, camisas, trajes y otro tipo de prendas.
texts.en: Lorena is 29-years-old and lives in her own house with her son.  She is a woman who fights to get ahead.  She gets up very early everyday to start with her housework.  Then she walks the streets in her area looking for new customers to offer them her clothing merchandise.  She says that she makes regular profits, and as she offers the items on credit this gives her the advantage of charging a higher price than the real price.  But, she commented that she doesn’t like to walk such long hours in the street looking for new customers and she prefers sales only with customers she knows or who are recommended to her.  This is not the first time she is requesting a loan.  It will be to buy skirts, pants, shirts, suits, and other clothing items.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase grey cloth, sponge, and two truckloads of cloth strips so he can make more mattresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: This member requests a loan to be able to buy livestock which she will then sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ana Ruth

texts.es:
Ana, de 30 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive con su  esposo y tres hijos, administra un molino de granos básicos, ella se dedica a este molino desde hace 7 años sirviéndoles a los vecinos y personas cercanas al lugar.
Este negocio le ayuda a tener ingresos diarios para su hogar, los clientes le llevan el maíz, café, cacao, o cualquier producto que quieran pulverizar. Ella está solicitando un préstamo para remodelar las instalaciones del molino,  ya que por no tener las condiciones adecuadas y seguras, le robaron un molino ocasionándole pérdidas. Ana lo pretende es construir o mejorar las paredes del local volviéndolas más seguras para no tener un nuevo percance.
Este préstamo le ayudara a mantener en condiciones adecuadas el molino y seguir brindando el servicio a los clientes de una excelente manera, ya que en sus planes existe la inversión de nuevos molinos para agilizar el buen servicio.
texts.en:
Ana is 30 years old and lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department, with her husband and three children.  She runs a basic grain mill and has been providing milling services for 7 years.  She serves her neighbors and other people who live nearby.

This business helps Ana to make daily income for her household.  Her customers bring her their corn, cacao beans, or any other product they want grinding.  Ana is requesting a loan so that she can remodel the building in which she keeps her mill since, through not having had suitable and safe conditions, one of her mills was stolen, causing her losses.

Ana plans to build new walls or improve the existing walls of her premises, making them safer so that she doesn't suffer a new mishap.  This loan will help her to keep her mill in suitable conditions and to continue providing her excellent services to her customers since she also plans to invest in new mills to speed up her good service.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to improve the building in which her mill is located

loans.name: Bayardo

texts.es: El señor Bayardo E. trabaja en MATECSA tiene 6 años de laborar es conductor, casado tiene 6 personas a su cargo y ha trabajado 3 créditos de mejoras de vivienda, el ultimo lo necesita para compra de materiales de construcción tales como hierro, bloque , cemento, para hacer su servicio higiénico.
texts.en: Mr. Bayardo E. works at MATECSA. He has been a driver for 6 years. He is married and supports 6 people. He has taken out 3 loans for home improvement. He needs the latest one to buy construction materials such as iron, blocks, and cement to make a bathroom.

loans.use: Home improvement, purchase of cement and iron.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
La Sra. Teresa de Jesús, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Esmeralda”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 41 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella.
Teresa de Jesús, es una mujer trabajadora, que ante la necesidad de tener un ingreso económico en su hogar y motivada por su esposo, emprendieron su negocio de venta de materiales agregados, que son materiales especialmente para construir casas y edificios, iniciándose para esto con un capital de 1000.00 Nuevos Soles, de las cuales poco a poco fue obteniendo muy buenos resultados desde un inicio por la calidad de sus materiales y la buena atención a sus clientes. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio  de la venta de agregados, hoy en día alquilo un local mas grande y seguro, donde poner sus materiales, así de esta manera afrecer un buen servicio y atención a sus clientes. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará  materiales agregados como:                       Arena y ripio fino y grueso, bloquetas, arena de calle y tierra negra, piedras chancadas. También realiza servicio de desmontes. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en el pago mensual a su personal. 
Teresita, se siente muy contenta con el negocio y trabajo que realiza día a día. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante y ser grandes empresarias.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the communal bank "Esmeralda," located in the department of San Martín, Peru. She is 41 years old, married and has one son who she cares for.  Teresa is a hard worker. In facing the need to have an income, with encouragement from her husband they started a business selling construction materials specifically for building houses and other buildings. They began with a capital of 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles (361.00 USD). Since that time, they have had good results thanks to the quality of their materials and their excellent customer service. 

Currently, Teresa continues to run her business selling construction materials. She now rents a larger and more secure space where she stores her materials. In this way she is able to offer quality service and tend to her clients. With this loan of $1,100 she plans to buy construction supplies She also provides land clearing services. Part of the loan will also be put towards paying her staff each month.  Teresa is very happy with her business and the work that she does. She is grateful to her communal bank Manuela Ramos, for supporting her and people like her who want to work and succeed as well as become great entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies for houses and other buildings

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
A typical mother’s life often revolves around the lives of her children. Zenaida Requentosa, 47, is one kind of a typical mother. She was not able to go to high school, but because she is a community partner in CCT*, she receives entrepreneurial training and biblical encouragement to help her start and run her own business. Zeny, as she is called by friends, is the wife of Rodrigo, a mason, and the loving mother of three children who are all in high school.  They live in Baseco, Manila.

Zeny runs a business in which balut (fertilized duck egg with an undeveloped embryo) is made and sold to the community. Balut is a common food in the country and is often sought after at night. Zeny capitalizes on this big market and produces quality balut. She also adds fish and pork crackers, which are the best accompaniment for balut. Zeny has been in this business for seven years  and earns around Php12,000 every month.

To help her grow her business, Zenaida seeks a Php17, 000 loan. She intends to use this to improve her balut-making business—buying quality ingredients, paying hired men, and other business expenses. She is sure that the loan will increase the profitability of her business and will help finance the schooling of her three children.

Zenaida worries about the financial stability of her family.  There are times when the balut sales are low, and some customers who borrow do not pay. Nevertheless, she does not give up hoping and believing that her business will grow, and that it will be God’s way of blessing her family with a life of peace and good health.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase more raw balut eggs for selling

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar es un hombre muy trabajador y ha demostrado ser un excelente cliente. Tiene 50 años por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de refrescos, y su esposa trabaja como cocinera. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica a este negocio, Julio inicio este negocio por cuenta propia pues siempre puso mucho empeño y sacrificio ya que este trabajo no es fácil y los diferentes procesos que realiza todos los días, pero este medio de trabajo es el que lo ayuda a salir adelante. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y comprar bolsas, hielo, azúcar, frutas, pajillas entre otros productos. El desea mejorar sus ingresos y además agrandar su inventario.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is a hardworking gentleman who has proven that he is an excellent client. He is 50 years old and has been selling soft drinks for more than two years. His wife works as a cook. Julio started this business on his own and always invests much effort and sacrifice into his work. Running his business is not easy and requires different tasks that he must perform each day. However, this method of working enables him to move forward.

This loan will be used as operating capital for purchasing sacks, ice, sugar, fruits, straws, and other items. He wants to improve his income and expand his inventory.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy sacks, ice, sugar, fruits, straws, and other items

loans.name: Cpkii Plus Group

texts.en:
John is the leader of the Community Bank “CPKII Plus,” which is composed of 16 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

John is 40 years old, married and the father of four children whose ages vary between 3 and 12. Three of them go to school.

He has been part of the microenterprise world since 1991. He started his business by selling duplicating paper. Today, John sells iron bars at the market in the mid west of Kinshasa. With hard work and good management, John has stabilized his business. He borrowed eight loans from the MFI HOPE DRC for business expansion and fully repaid them. 

With the next loan, John will be able to meet customer demand and generate additional profits. His business makes US $90 of profit per week. John’s ambition is to someday open a hardware shop in his area.

loans.use: to increase inventory to meet customer demand

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer tiene 30 años, es casado y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad. Vive junto a su familia en casa propia en el caserío Zaranda. Éste está ubicado en el distrito de Pitipo que se encuentra en la Provincia de Ferreñafe, a menos de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Desde hace más de 10 años, se dedica a la crianza de ganado menor. Cuando sus animales ya han alcanzado un tamaño y peso ideal, los vende a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Realiza esta actividad en un pequeño terreno cerca de su casa. Solicita un crédito para ampliar su ganado con la compra de más animales menores para luego engordarlos y venderlos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). Desea invertir en su negocio para incrementar sus ingresos y usarlos para solventar sus gastos familiares y ofrecerle a su familia una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en: Wilmer is 30 years old, married, and has two children, ages 4 and 1.  He lives with his family in the Zaranda settlement, located in the Pitipo district in the Ferreñafe province, less than an hour from Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region.  He’s been raising small livestock on a small piece of land near his home for more than 10 years.  When his animals reach the ideal size and weight, he sells them to merchants who visit the zone.  He is asking for this loan in order to expand his business by buying more animals to fatten up and sell.  He is asking for a loan of 1,500 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.  He wants to invest into his business to increase his income and use it to pay for his family expenses and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: Tep S., 29, resides in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. S. is a housewife while her husband produces wooden boats, earning an income of $5 US per day. Each month, the family has to spend $60 on food and $35 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a farmer in Nkubu in Central Kenya. He is 40 years old and married with one five-year-old child who attends school. He has been in mixed farming for 5 years, employing one farmhand and producing bananas, maize, beans, and eggs which he sells locally.

John has made a request for 90,000 KES to buy irrigation equipment, specifically a water tank and PVC pipes, for banana irrigation.This is his third loan with Juhudi Kilimo. He is optimistic the irrigation system and expansion of his banana acreage will improve his output and adequately cater for his family needs. He is focusing on purchasing more land. John says the poor transportation system in the area is his greatest challenge to the business.

loans.use: To pay for a water tank and PVC pipes for  banana irrigation

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en:
Ganbold is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three sons in a house in Selenge province, Mongolia. His older son is a businessman who supplies used tires to the Russian market. 

Ganbold manages an animal hides trading business in his town. He started his business in 1994 and has gained much experience. He collects animal hides such as sheep and goat skin from herders and sells them to wholesale traders. 

During the recent economic recession, Ganbold's business went into a stagnant period and he had difficulty overcoming the obstacles. However, his excellent managerial skill helped him to improve and develop his business further. 

He is a responsible man who attributes his business success to his good accounting skill. He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more raw hides in order to increase his business sales.

loans.use: To purchase more raw hides.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Michelle has a retail shop that sells canned goods, junk food & snacks. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of  PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, junk food & biscuits.

Michelle is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Michelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, junk food & biscuits

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras La Alegria del Chaco, actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo.
La Sra. Maria se dedica a la  venta de articulos de consumo(despensa o almacén)donde ofrece una variedad de productos a sus clientes. Todas las actividades las realiza con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio.
En el grupo La Alegria las mujeres son muy trabajadoras y por sobre todo emprendedoras. Con mucho esfuerzo realizan sus tareas para poder dar una vida digna a sus hijos e hijas.
Por medio del credito desean ampliar su pequeña despensa para poder asi tener una mayor variedad de productos ya que hacia la localidad del Chaco no existen muchas despensas y poseer mas variedad seria sinonimo de mas ganancias.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras La Alegría del Chaco” (Joy of Chaco Enterprising Women) committee is currently in its fourth cycle.  

María sells consumer goods (grocery store) stocking a variety of products for her customers.  She carries out all her activities with much effort and sacrifice.

In the “La Alegría” group the women are very hard working and, above all, enterprising.   With much effort they carry out their tasks in order to provide a proper life for their sons and daughters.

Through loans they want to expand their small store to have a larger variety of products because in Chaco there aren’t very many stores and having more variety is synonymous with more profits.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Yeun

texts.en:
Yeun (in the photo) is 52 years old and his wife, Vannsrey, is 46. They live along National Road two, approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1983 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One of their children has full-time employment, another one is a teacher and the third one attends school.   

Yeun is a policeman. His wife raises chickens and ducks at home. He is asking for a loan of $1,000 to assist his wife in buying additional chickens and ducks to raise and to build chicken coop.

loans.use: to assist his wife in buying additional chickens and ducks to raise and to build chicken coop.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de URUBAMBA, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 75 años de edad y es casado; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de alquiler de habitación y también es profesor cesante, el negocio de alquiler de habitaciones, el alquila a diferentes turistas nacionales e internacionales, por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de alquiler de habitaciones. El  socio solicita el préstamo para implementar las habitaciones y comprar sabanas y colchas.
                                                                                                                                                                     
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This man belongs to the communal bank "Tercer Milenio."  This bank is located in the Urubamba district, which is part of Urubamba province and the department of Cusco.

He is 75 years old and is married.  He alternates his daily activities with his business renting rooms.  He also used to work as a teacher.  In his business renting rooms he rents to many different national and international tourists.  Through this business he provided for his children.  He wants to expand his business renting rooms.  He requests a loan to set up his rooms and to buy bed sheets and bedspreads. 

He is pleased to be getting this loan and is committed to making all of the payments.

loans.use: to set up rooms to rent and to buy bed sheets and bedspreads

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.ru: Рахмон проживает в районе Яван. Ему 48 лет. Женат. Имеет 6 детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Рахмон имеет среднее образование. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Кроме того он занимается торговлей. Рядом с домом у него имеется продуктовый магазин. Он берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого и мелко - рогатого скота.
texts.en: Rakhmon lives in Yavan. He is 48 years old, married, and has six children. His wife is a homemaker. Rakhmonov has a secondary education. He earns a living by breeding cattle. He has been doing this for over ten years.  In addition, he works in trade. Near his house he has a grocery store. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle and small livestock (like sheep or goats).

loans.use: to buy cattle and other livestock

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 9 children.  Fe has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & noodles.  Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & noodles

loans.name: Americo Agustin

texts.es: El Sr. Américo es casado, tiene un hijo de un año de edad; Américo se dedica al rubro de servicios de construcción, lleva trabajando es este sector por más de 05 años; el crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en mejoramiento de vivienda (para comprar eternit para el techo y hacer un piso falso). El desafío que enfrenta el Sr. Américo por estos tiempos de frio son las enfermedades virales para el niño, su sueño es tener su propia ferretería en su casa y sabe que lo lograra con esfuerzo y trabajo. El Sr. Americio está muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Americo is married and has a one-year-old son. Americo works in construction and has worked in this industry more than 5 years. He will invest the loan granted to him into improving his home (to buy Eternit fiber cement for the roof and to install a floor). 

The challenge facing Americo in the cold weather is viral disease with his son. His dream is to have his own hardware store in his home, and he knows he will achieve it with effort and work. Americo is very thankful for the loan granted to him.

loans.use: to purchase roofing and flooring materials

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a responsible mother who operates a business raising pigs to earn extra income and satisfy her family’s needs. Her spouse works as a farmer. Guillerma and her husband have been raising their family in their village for almost 20 years and they only earn 30,000 PHP profit each harvest season. 

Guillerma is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan to buy pig feed, vitamins, and materials to improve her pig pen. She believes that her hard work will improve her business and make it viable, and she continues to strive despite the hardships and difficulties of life. In the future, Guillerma hopes to improve her business to increase her income and finance the education of her children who are now in college.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Maria, es separa, vive con sus hijas ya todas mayores en la cuidad D. San Lorenzo. Ella se dedica a la venta D. quesos y harina D. maíz. Cuenta que se inicio en este rubro con una tía hace un tiempo. Gracias a todo su sacrificio y con mucho esfuerzo logró independizarse y logró montar su propio negocio.
Comenta que diariamente empieza su jornada D. trabajo muy temprano. Dice también que tiene muchos clientes que siempre compran D. ella los productos que trae, por ser D. buena calidad y muy ricos. Uno D. los sueños D. Maria es poder ampliar su negocio y D. esa forma tener mayores ingresos y así también poder ayudar a otras personas, dándoles puestos D. trabajo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. más quesos y harina D. maíz, ya que tiene mucha demanda y le gustaría poder cumplir con todos sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Maria is separated, and lives in the city of San Lorenzo with her daughters, who are now all adults. She sells cheeses and corn flour. 

She says that started in this line of work with an aunt some time ago. Thanks to all her sacrifice and with a lot of effort, she succeeded in becoming independent, and managed to start up her own business. She says that she starts her work day very early every day. She also says that she has a lot of customers, who always buy the products she carries, because they are of good quality, and very delicious. 

One of María's dreams is to be able to expand her business, and in that way have more income. She also wants to be able to help other people by giving them jobs. She is applying for the loan in order to buy cheeses and corn flour, since there is a lot of demand, and she would like to be able to fill all her orders.

loans.use: To buy cheeses, and corn flour for later sale.

loans.name: Regzen

texts.en: Regzen is 32 years old and lives with his wife and children in a house in the Hovd province of Mongolia. His wife helps him to manage the family business as a shopkeeper. He started his business in 2005 by selling foods and other products, and subsequently gained five years of work and business experience. Then in 2010, he opened a grocery store. He is planning to expand his business in the future. He is a family oriented and diligent man who says: "I want to expand my business and bring in products from Ulaanbaatar city." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy more grocery products and to increase his turnover capital.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is single and age 23. For the last two years, he has been cutting and selling timber to earn a living. Paul has employed one person to help him in the business. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. 

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), Paul wants to buy a power saw for his business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.

loans.use: To buy a power saw.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Adelfa has a shop that sells jewelry like bracelets, necklaces and earrings. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of jewelry to sell.

Adelfa has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Adelfa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a divorced woman with five children, two boys and three girls, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a coconut selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. Her product is found in the rural areas with poor road networks, hence making her business difficult to operate. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers’ needs in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts as a supply during festive season. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.
