loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts as a supply during festive season.

loans.name: Eda Eveling

texts.es:
Eda   vive y trabaja en Ica, Perú. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.

Eda, es una mujer casada de 29 años de edad, ella tiene dos hijos menores de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa, ya que este trabajo le sale rentable y porque le genera ingresos. 
Eda  es una mujer  luchadora,  perseverante y muy responsable con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a su familia. 
Eda  empezó su negocio en el año 2008 , gana semanalmente S/.440 nuevos soles. Diariamente trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y 7 días a la semana. Con el préstamo de S/. 3000  soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, Eda  invertirá su crédito para la compra de mercadería (camisas, pantalones, blusas, etc).  Su sueño de Eda es tener su puesto propio y expandirlo a nivel nacional, para que pueda generar mayores ingresos y terminar de construir su casa para  poder llevar una mejor calidad de vida, su asesor cree es que un excelente cliente y que pagara puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Eda lives and works in Ica, Peru. Ica is located in the Sechura Desert about four hours south of Lima, the country's capital, and is hailed by Peruvians as "The Land of the Sun." It is known in Peru for its frequent earthquakes (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007), its production of grapes, asparagus, and olives, and perhaps most notably, as the source of Peruvian's traditional national drink, Pisco. In this hot, arid climate we find the client's home and business.

Eda is 29 years old and married.  She has two minor children.  She sells clothing, which generates income and has proven to be profitable.  
Eda is a go-getting, persistent and responsible woman with a lot of desire to get her family ahead.
Eda started her business in 2008.  She makes 440 new soles a week.  She works about 10 hours per day, 7 days per week.  With the loan of 3000 new soles that she will receive thanks to Kiva she will buy merchandise (shirts, slacks, blouses, etc.).  Her dream is to have her own stand and to expand to a national level so that she can increase her income and finish building her house, this way achieving a better way of life.  Her adviser believes that she is an excellent customer and that she will pay her installments promptly.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Disnarda

texts.es: Disnarda, de 46 años, es una mujer alegre, amable y emprendedora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene tres hijos de 20, 17 y 12 años, el mayor es independiente y tiene su familia a parte, mientras que los dos menores aún depende de ella y su pareja para poder tener una buena educación. Vive en una casa propia en donde comparte sus días a lado de su conviviente con quien trabajan mucho para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo de Disnarda consiste en la venta de pan de todo tipo, bebidas y helados con sabor de frutas regionales, que siempre salen mucho por el intenso calor que se vive en la zona. Todos estos productos los vende en su casa, ahí llegan sus clientes. Por otro lado, trabaja para algunas personas en la cosecha de cítricos y le genera un ingreso adicional en la economía de su hogar. lleva tres años haciendo estas actividades y empezó vendiendo de a poco y ahora su negocio se ha establecido. Le encanta trabajar así ya que maneja su propio tiempo y genera ingresos para su familia. Tiene muchos planes a futuro, pero por el momento solo desea consolidar su trabajo y mas adelante ampliar su negocio. Este será el primer préstamo con MFP, esta muy ilusionada de saber que le brindarán un respaldo financiero para poder empezar a invertir en mayor cantidad para su negocio. Está muy comprometida en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y poder integrarse rápidamente a su banco comunal ya que son un grupo muy sólido y sobre todo muy responsable. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará producto para incrementar su negocio, comprará pan, gaseosas, además de ingredientes e insumos para seguir haciendo sus deliciosos helados de pura fruta.
texts.en: Disnarda is 46 years old. She is a cheerful, friendly and enterprising woman. She lives with her spouse, with whom she has three children aged 20, 17 and 12 years old. The oldest is independent and with his own family, while the two youngest still depend on her and her spouse to have a good education. She lives in her own house where she shares her days with her spouse who also works a lot to offer a better quality of life to their family. Disnarda's job is selling all types of bread, beverages and ice cream flavored with regional fruit, of which there are many because of the intense heat in the area. She sells all of the products in her house, where her customers go. On the other hand she works for some people harvesting citrus, which generates additional income for the home. She has been doing these activities for three years and she started by selling a little, and now her business has stabilized. She loves working like this, since she managed her own schedule and generates income for her family. She has a lot of plans for the future, but at this time she just wants to consolidate her work and in the future expand her business. This will be her first loan with MFP. She is very excited to know that they will offer her financial backing in order to start to invest more in her business. She is very committed to making her payments on time and be able to integrate quickly into the communal bank, since it is a very solid and above all responsible group. With the amount she has asked for, 1,5000 soles, she will buy products to grow her business. She will buy bread, soft drinks, as well as ingredients and materials to keep making the delicious fruit ice cream.

loans.use: to buy bread, soft drinks and fruit to make ice cream.

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en: Izolda operates a greenhouse. She is requesting a loan to help her purchase a new heating system which would make the greenhouse  more effective. Izolda could then grow and sell more fruits and vegetables and increase her business income. With this additional income, Izolda will ensure a stable future for her family. Izolda lives with her husband, son and mother-in-law.

loans.use: to pay for a heating system for the greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds and a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres de ciudad del este se han unido con el objetivo de poder brindar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, que día a día se esfuerzan al máximo por darle a sus familias lo mínimo para tener una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Viviana es una de las miembros, ella nos cuenta que es modista hace ya un buen tiempo. Gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido ayudarle a su familia y darles lo que necesitan. En cuanto a su clientela nos dicen que gracias al buen trabajo que hace siempre tiene muchos clientes y por consiguiente mucho trabajo. Una de sus metas es poder ampliar su taller y de esa forma seguir ayudando en la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, agujas, botones y demás insumos, los cuales les servirá para poder abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fifteen women from the east part of the city have come together with the objective to be able to offer a better future to their children.  They are very hard-working women and fighters that day by day strive to the maximum to give their families the basics to have a worthy life without hardships.  

Viviana is one of the members.  She tells us that she has been s a dressmaker for some time.  Thanks to this work she has been able to help her family and to give them what they need.  As to her clientele, they tell us that, thanks to the good work that she does, she has always many clients and consequently a lot of work.  One of her goals is to be able to expand her workshop and in that way to continue helping around the house.  She requests the loan to purchase fabrics, thread, needles, buttons and other supplies, which will serve to supply her so that she can comply with the demands of her clients.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, threas, needles, buttons and other supplies.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 40-year-old single man, who has spent his life planting and taking care of his flowers, tomatoes, grapes and olives. Ahmad loves his business. He's attached to his land and that's why he tries his best to keep on improving his business in order to produce good quality products to sell in the market. Ahmad is planning to build a greenhouse in order to keep his plants safe from any bad weather that might come. For this reason, he applied for his first loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. Ahmad believes that he must treat his plants with care and love to produce the best quality products in the future. He hopes to increase production by producing different products and attracting new customers.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Senghouy's Group

texts.en:
A 27-year-old married mother residing in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Phnom Proek district, Senghouy has five children. She has been in business as a cook for wedding ceremonies in the area for five years.

This is the first loan for Seanghouy with VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. Seanghouy, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy materials for supporting her business such cooking equipments and some ingredients. She hopes earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy materials for supporting her business

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy and her husband are engaged in fishing business like most people in Iloilo, Philippines; she and her family lives in the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. They raised their children for five years by doing this livelihood. The ages of their children are; 19, 17, 5 and 4 (twins) years old that still need their support. Juvy is asking for a loan of PHP15, 000 for additional amount to buy fishing nets. She will also buy fish to sell. Perhaps, she also sells fish in the market. Her goal in life is to uplift their livelihood to have enough money to send her children to school and finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and fish

loans.name: Cruz

texts.en:
Cruz and her sister opened this store about 4 years ago. There they sell all types of products to the community ranging from jewelry to office supplies. Cruz and her sister started off by putting together savings and selling just paper, pens and other school supplies. As they grew they began to invest in many different products to sell.

Although the business was going well Cruz’s sister married about a year ago and made the decisions to move to a new city. Obviously this has affected Cruz. She must now make monthly payments to her sister in order to repay for the capital she put up. Instead of having two people invest the business now it is only Cruz and even she is limited by the payments.

Cruz is now seeking this loan in order to invest in new products that will be particularly popular during the Christmas season. She is confident in her ability to sell and assures lenders that there is sufficient demand to justify an investment.

loans.use: Invest in products to sell at her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To transform his barbershop to become a unisex hair salon

loans.name: Sohaila

texts.en: Sohaila lives in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and she doesn’t have children. She and her husband live alone. She is a tailor. She has good working experience and she wants to take a loan to buy new machines because all the equipment that she has is old. She wants to get new machines to help her husband and make a good life for their future. She would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: Buy sewing machines

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Mr. S. is married and has two children. In his shop he makes garage doors, doors, playground structures, security bars, and so on. He would use the loan to buy iron, soldering materials, and other raw materials to meet client demands. Through this loan, he hopes to increase client orders and improve his family's standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio P, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. S. es casado y padre de dos niños, además es propietario de un taller de soldadura en el cual confecciona portones, puertas, juguetes infantiles para instalar en parques, verjas de seguridad, etc. Está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de hierro, soldadura y otros materiales que le ayuden a cubrir con los pedidos de sus clientes. Espera tener un incremento considerable en sus ingresos después del crédito y espera también que le permita mejorar las condiciones económicas de sus familiares.

loans.use: To buy iron and other raw materials

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy C., mother of 3 children, has requested a loan of US$ 175 to help her expand her business. She is a motivated, hardworking entrepreneur who has been building her business for the past 8 years.

Joy recognizes the value of expanding and hopes to improve her business turnover with a loan of $175 which will allow her to buy more fabrics and fashionable material. Joy has been with LAPO for 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics & fashionable material for her business

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Mr. Borniface M. is 46 years old, is married with two children, and deals in foodstuffs and drinks. He lives in Benin, in Edo State. He is requesting a loan amount of $550 to buy more foodstuffs, provisions & drinks to sell at his market. He has been in LAPO for a year and in business since 1996.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs, provisions & drinks

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
At Moree Junction near Cape Coast is a well-known carpentry shop called “Talented Creative Furniture”. The owner of this business is Mr. Philip Q. who makes all kinds of furniture for both private and public organizations, schools, and his individual clients. Philip has eleven apprentices studying under him. He is 36 years of age and married with three children aged 11, 9, and 5 years respectively. His wife is a trader who sells provisions such as milk, milo, soap etc.

He is also a member of a lending group called “Emmanuel Traders Group.” The members of this group have known each other for many years, and they provide support for each other as they are all located at the same place – Yamoransa – on the Accra Highway.

One challenge that Philip faces is that organizations and individuals always ask him to make furniture for them, but because of the high cost of wood, foams, leathers, and the materials used, he sometimes loses his customers to his competitors because they have been able to secure loans from some financial organizations. As a result, Philip needs a loan of US $1,100 dollars to purchase wood, foams, leathers, nails, and the material used to manufacture the furniture in order to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.use: Philip needs a loan of US $1,100 dollars to purchase wood, foams, leathers, nails and the material used to manufacture the furniture in order to meet the demands of his customers.

loans.name: Hanati

texts.en: Hanati is a 52-year-old woman who sells fresh fruit such as jackfruit. She usually earns about US$ 5 per day.  Her husband, A., has no fixed income. Hanati is requesting a loan of US$ 125 to expand her business, as well as her husband's business. She hopes that this will earn them more income for their children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her little fresh fruit business

loans.name: Ana Clemencia

texts.es:
For the past 20 years, Ana Clemencia has been selling food at the market in the bus terminal of León. The main dish she makes is nacatamales, (Nicaraguan tamales, usually combining ingredients such as raisins, capers, and green olives and wrapped in banana leaves), which she distributes at different points in the market for delivery to her customers. At the same time, other customers arrive at her stand and buy food to go.

She is a single mother and the only support for her family. Over time, she decided to ask for loans from CEPRODEL, which have not been denied her but have been granted so she can buy ingredients with which to make food and her delicious nacatamales. Her greatest need is that she urgently needs to buy ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Ana Clemencia se dedica desde hace 20 años a la actividad de venta de comida en el mercado la Terminal de León. Su actividad consiste en elaborar los alimentos siendo su principal platillo los nacatamales y luego distribuirlos en diferentes puntos del mercado hasta entregarlo a sus clientes. De igual manera, otros clientes llegan hacia su puesto y compran los alimentos para llevarlos.

Es madre soltera y es el único sustento de su hogar. En el transcurso del tiempo decide solicitar créditos en CEPRODEL, los que no le han sido negados sino que le han sido otorgados para la compra de su materia prima para la elaboración de sus alimentos y sus deliciosos nacatamales. Su mayor necesidad radica en que urgentemente necesita adquirir la materia prima.

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Lweza A (2007) B Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Maria N.. She is a tailor and is requesting a loan to buy more cloth. Maria is 28 years old and is single. With the extra profits from her loan, Agnes hopes to be able to reinvest in her business.

Maria is joined in her small group by Janat N., Norah N., Agnes N., and Monica N.. Janat N. sells charcoal and wants to expand to bulk selling. Norah N. is a poultry farmer and wants a loan to order more chicks. Agnes N. fries and sells snacks and wants to buy more flour, cooking oil and fryers. Monica N. sells fresh food and is requesting a loan to increase capital.

loans.use: To buy cloth for a tailoring business

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel is 56 years old. He lives with his living partner, Tomasa, who's 54 years old. They have been together for 26 years and they don't have any children. Miguel is a farmer. He plants lettuce, cucumbers, pumpkins, tomatoes, carrots, beets, etc. He tells us that he comes from a farming family and that he does very well financially because he takes good care of his land.

Thanks to their savings, they were able to purchase a house and live a comfortable life. His wife is his biggest supporter. She helps him in anything she can and takes good care of him and the house.

Miguel starts his day at dawn to go to the main city which is about 2 hours away from the city of Ita to sell his vegetables. He returns in the afternoons to work the land.

With this loan, he would like to expand his irrigation system which is fundamental when it comes to farming.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Miguel tiene 56 años, vive en pareja con Tomasa de 54 años. Hace 26 años que están juntos pero no tienen hijos. Miguel se dedica a la horticultura, cultiva todo tipo de hortalizas como lechuga, acelga, pepino, tomates, zapallos, zanahorias, remolachas, etc. Comenta que proviene de una familia de agricultores y afirma que le va muy bien gracias al empeño y dedicación que le otorga al cuidado de la tierra. Gracias a sus ahorros ellos lograron hacerse de casa propia, adquirir otros inmuebles y contar con las comodidades necesarias para una buena vida. Su esposa es su gran apoyo, ella lo ayuda en todo además de cuidar bien de él y su casa.

Miguel empieza su jornada a tempranas horas de la madrugada para trasladarse hasta la ciudad capital que queda a dos horas de la ciudad de Itá, con el fin de comercializar sus productos. Al medio día ya está de vuelta y comienza a trabajar la chacra.

Con el crédito que solicitan en esta oportunidad piensan ampliar el sistema de riego artificial de sus hortalizas, lo cual es fundamental para la agricultura.

loans.use: To expand the irrigation system

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Mr. Humberto L. is a young man who hopes to work and get ahead. He opened his own business with money that he’d saved. Humberto sells cell phones, cell phone accessories, and SIM chips from a number of providers.

Thanks to good sales Humberto opened two more kiosks, employing two people to work at them. He mans the principal kiosk himself, which is located in front of a busy supermarket in his city and has high sales figures thanks to the foot traffic in the area.

Humberto lives with his sister. Their parents emigrated two years ago when the family's economic situation demanded that they search for better work opportunities. Humberto would like more than anything to have his parents return to the country, because he finds it very difficult to have the family separated. He hopes that his businesses can generate sufficient income to support the family so that his parents can return home.

Humberto is asking for a loan to purchase large quantities of merchandise, in order to obtain a discount. This should increase his earnings by enabling him to offer better prices than the competition.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Humberto L. es una persona joven con ganas de progresar y trabajar, el abrió su propio negocio con unos ahorros que tenía guardados, en el mismo se dedica a la venta de teléfonos celulares, chips con líneas de teléfonos de las distintas empresas distribuidoras de nuestro país al igual que accesorios varios para celulares.

Gracias a las buenas ventas y ganancias generadas él pudo abrir dos puestos mas de ventas dando empleo a dos personas que se encargan de la atención de dichos puestos. Su puesto principal, y en el que él atiende personalmente, se encuentra frente a un supermercado muy concurrido de la ciudad, lo que le genera buenas ventas gracias a la alta concurrencia de personas en el lugar.

Humberto vive con su hermana, sus padres emigraron hace un par de años a otro país en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales, ya que la situación económica lo demandaba. El deseo mas grande de su corazón es que sus padres puedan volver al país ya que la separación familiar es una situación muy difícil, él espera que sus negocios generen suficientes ingresos para lograr fortalecerse económicamente lo suficiente para que sus padres puedan volver.

El solicita hoy día un crédito con el que podrá adquirir una buena cantidad de mercaderías ya que al comprar en grandes cantidades sus proveedores lo ofrecen mejores descuentos, lo que ayuda a que sus ganancias sean buenas y sus precios de ventas puedan ser mejores que el de la competencia.

loans.use: Purchase of cellular phone accessories.

loans.name: Nelida Adriana

texts.es:
Mrs. Nélida separated, she is 40 years old, and she is native of Cascas. Mrs Nélida she has a high school education, has 3 dependent children who live at home. She also begin college majoring in Education but due to family problem she never finished. Mrs. Nélida lives in the District of Manuel Arévalo - Trujillo – Peru. It has been three years since Mrs. Nélida prepares cakes, which she distributes and sales at different grocery stores. She also prepares cakes for birthdays or other celebrations. The business got started with Manuela Ramos half a year ago granting Mrs. Liliana a first loan of S/.300., which was invested on building her workshoo. She belongs to the Communal Bank "Santa Elena II." With the loan of S/. 500. oo that she will reimburse in 4 months, she will buy ingredients to bake the cakes. Nelida dreams of growing her business and one day have a bakery and thus to be able to improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Antonella Sacconi, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Nélida esta separada, tiene 40 años, es natural de Cascas tiene 03 hijos dependientes aún de ella, tiene estudios superiores incompletos, ella estudió Educación pero por problemas familiares no lo terminó.Vive en el Distrito de Manuel Arévalo - Trujillo – Perú. Nelida se dedica desde hace 03 años a la elaboración de queques, los cuales los reparte a diferentes bodegas de la zona, también prepara los mismos para cumpleaños o algún otro compromiso. Se inició con Manuela Ramos hace medio año concediéndole un primer préstamo de S/.300.oo, lo invirtió en la implementación de su pequeño taller.Pertenece al Banco Comunal “ Santa Elena II”, Con el préstamo de S/. 500.oo que cancelará en 4 meses comprará algunos insumos para la elaboración de sus queques. Nelida sueña con crecer en su negocio de tal manera que llegue a tener una gran panadería y así poder mejorar sus ingresos.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare products

loans.name: Tuhfa

texts.en:
Tuhfa T. is 43 years old. She is married, and she is the loving mother of three children. She and her husband run the family business, sewing and producing tarpaulin boots. Both work at home, accepting orders and performing the necessary tasks to satisfy their customers' requests. Having worked in this industry for twenty years, they have gained a great deal of experience and have developed a large client base. The family business is quite successful and generates stable income, thereby improving the family's living conditions.

One of Tuhfa’s dreams is to provide her children with a great education to enable them to better their quality of life, so she works extremely hard in order to hopefully send them to the University in the future. In particular, her elder son is finishing school next year, and she wants to send him to the University in the capital of Dushanbe. Therefore, Tuhfa is requesting $500 over a term of 12 months. With the loan proceeds, she will purchase equipment and additional input materials to sew tarpaulin boots. This is the first loan requested by Tuhfa, but she promises to repay it in a timely manner. Please get behind this dedicated mother to help her make her dreams become a reality.

loans.use: To expand and improve the family business by purchasing equipment and additional raw materials in order to sew tarpaulin boots

loans.name: Muhammadkul

texts.en:
K. Muhammadkul is 34 years old. He’s married and the father of 5 children. His wife is a housekeeper. Thus Muhammadkul’s business is the main source of income. 

Muhammadkul is working hard on the farm in order to make his children happy and to give them a good education. His business includes growing and selling of agricultural products such as: tomatoes, onions, potatoes, cucumbers, carrots, pumpkins, and cabbage. He has worked in agriculture for six years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. In the sowing season, Muhammadkul plans to sow onion, potato, pumpkin and cabbage. That is why he wants to buy the mineral fertilizer and seeds for what he needs the loan of 1000 Somoni ($300) with the term of 6 months. After gathering his yield, Muhammadkul wants to sell it to locals, with the lowest prices than in the market. He is counting on your help and expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: This loan would be the second taken by Mrs. Duong K. to improve her living conditions. She and her husband, Mr. So Meun, are farmers in Chy Prong Village in Kampong Chhnang. On their farm, they cultivate twice a year. During the rainy season they cultivate rice, while they grow vegetables in dry season. They have six children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a construction worker; a third helps the parents on the field while the remaining three are attending school. Although the family members work hard, they still cannot afford to build a new house. Thus, Mrs. Duong K. decided to ask for a loan to add to her saving to build a new house. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To save for a new house for her family

loans.name: Thieu

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Thiệu tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1997. Vòng vốn đầu tiên chị vay 500.000đ và sử dụng vào chăn nuôi. Vòng vốn sau chị xin vay vốn để đầu tư vào mua máy say sát gạo phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con địa phương. Hiện tại công việc chăn nuôi, kinh doanh của gia đình chị cho thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 18.000.000 để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và buôn bán gạo.
texts.en:
Ms. N. Thi Thieu joined the Fund in 1997. For her first loan she borrowed 30.00 and invested in raising pigs. Her subsequent loans were used to invest in buying a rice grinding machine to meet the demand of the local community. Her income from raising pigs and her business average 174.00 USD per month. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 1100.00 USD to invest in raising pigs and buying rice.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising, Business

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov N., 74, is a farmer who lives with his four children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. He grows and sells rice and cucumbers from his home. He makes around $1 per day and is aided by one of his children who works in the garment factory. The rest of the children stay at home and help him with the farming. Besides farming he also raises fish for extra profit. Pov N. would like to take out a loan of $1000 to purchase fertilizers and a water pump to increase the efficiency of his farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and a water pump.

loans.name: Lourdes Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señorita Lourdes tiene 19 años de edad, pertenece al Banco Comunal Luis Alberto Sánchez II y  vive en la calle Sepúlveda 440 A, distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Estudia el segundo ciclo de Administración de Empresas.
Su negocio consiste en el alquiler de vehículos  de transporte, un auto para taxi y una moto para moto taxi.
Con el primer crédito de S/. 300 cancelado en 4 cuotas invirtió en repuestos.
Con este crédito de S/. 400, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará una carpa y pintura para la moto.
Lourdes sueña con terminar su carrera y hacer surgir su negoció y el de su madre.
texts.en:
Miss Lourdes is 19 years old and lives on 440 A Sepúlveda Street, in the Moche district of the Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Perú. She is a member of the Alberto Sánchez II microfinance institute.

She is in her second year of Business Administration.

Her business consists of renting transportation vehicles—one taxi cab and one motorcycle taxi.

She invested her first 300.00 PEN loan, which was repaid in 4 monthly installments, in purchasing spare parts.

With this 400.00 PEN loan, which will also be repaid in 4 monthly installments, she will purchase a cover and paint for her motorcycle.

Lourdes dreams of finishing her degree so that both her and her mother’s businesses can succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle cover and paint

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Desde hace 10 años instaló una tienda en su propia casa, aprovechando la ubicación  comercial que tiene esta, ya que por ahí siempre pasan los transportistas de taxi, así como sus vecinos, por ser un punto central de su zona, es así que ella atiende todos los días desde la mañana hasta la tarde y las ventas que se ha propuesto las ha superado, por lo que está  muy animada de continuar con su negocio, con el que obtiene los ingresos que le permiten solventar los gastos de su familia, y esa es la mejor satisfacción que ella puede tener. Es la segunda vez que Domitila solicita un préstamo con MFP, y es una de las clientas más puntuales de su banco comunal. Con esta cantidad podrá adquirir mayor cantidad mercadería que le permitirá tener más ganancias, comprará cerveza, sacos de arroz, azúcar y también menestras.
texts.en:
Domitila is 31 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children. Ten years ago she opened a store in her home, taking advantage of her location as there are always taxis passing, as well as neighbours, as she is centrally located. Thus she tends to her clientele daily from morning 'til night and sales have surpassed her expectations. She is very excited to continue building her business with which she makes enough money to cover her household costs, which is the greatest satisfaction she can know. This is the second time Domitila has requested a loan from MFP, and she is one of the most punctual clients in her community bank. With this loan she will be able to acquire more merchandise, allowing her to make greater profits. Specifically, she will buy beer, bags of rice and sugar as well as other typical foods. .

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan P. is 37 years old lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She currently lives with four members in the family and is the mother of three children who are still in school. She runs her own farmland and grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. Her husband Loun Chon is 37 years old and drives a taxi. All of his income provides for his family's needs. P. plans to buy a motorcycle to make his family's transportation needs easier. She is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort K. is 37 years old and married. She has four children, all of whom are currently in school. She lives with her family in Abofour, a busy market town in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. 

Comfort has been operating her trading business for over 12 years; she primarily sells yams, but also sells beans, groundnut or other foods. She buys her goods from small towns nearby, sometimes traveling as far as Goaso in the Brong Ahafo region when yams are scarce. She then sells her goods at the local market, mostly to travelers. She has been successful enough to rent out a store in the market center from which she sells her products.

Comfort hopes to increase the quantity of food stuffs that she buys on each trip, so as to cut down on her frequent travels and still be able to supply to a sizable market. This would enable her to save more and support her husband in providing for their family, and especially for the children's education.

loans.use: To buy yam in bulk to re-sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 22-year-old man who lives in Tyre in southern Lebanon. Ali owns a barber shop. He also sells beauty products. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase beauty products for his salon. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. Ali is special because he does nice haircuts and is aware of fashion. His clients are his friends and neighbors. He decided on his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products for his salon

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is an entrepreneur from Kherson. She runs a business selling women’s outer wear in Dneprovskyi market. Antonina plans her business policies and strategy very thoroughly. She handles all the challenging situations with sheer optimism and enthusiasm. Antonina has been in this trade for the past five years. Presently, she has invested about 75,000 Grivnas in her business. Her monthly income is about 9,000 Grivnas.
 
Antonina has always strived to be helpful and friendly to all those around her. Today, Antonina is requesting a loan of 9,000 Grivnas to increase the assorted merchandise in her kiosk. We believe Antonina’s perseverance and careful planning will help her repay the current loan and make her more confident and knowledgeable about her business, going ahead.

loans.use: Increase the assortment of her inventory

loans.name: Izzat

texts.ru: Иззат  1963 года рождения. Замужем имеет 3 детей. Торгует на рынке фруктами. Сейчас у нее сезон. Она сотрудничает с Микроинвест с 2007 года. В торговли более 10 лет. Она получает кредит для расширения бизнеса. Муж сидит дома. Сын не работает, недавно  она женила сына. Деньги взяла с оборота, поэтому ей выгодно получать кредит, с продажи будет погашать.  Имеет хорошее место  на рынке. Благодарна  Микроинвест и кредит от КИВА потому что в трудную минуту ее поддерживают.
texts.en:
Izzat was born in 1963. She is married and has 3 children. Izzat sells fruits at the market. Right now is her busy season. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2007. Izzat has been in sales for over 10 years. She is taking out a loan in order to expand her business. Her husband sits at home. Her son doesn’t work, recently she married her son off. She took the money for the marriage from her working capital and this is why it is profitable for her to take out a loan, she will pay it back using her revenues. Izzat has a good location at the market. She is grateful to MicroInvest and the KIVA loan, because she has support at a difficult time.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business development

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel  es socia del Bancomunal  La Fortaleza.
Yabel es conviviente tiene 37 años, cuatro hijos de 12, 11, 9 y 3 años que están estudiando en al escuela estatal.  
Ysabel  empezó en el negocio comprando pan a una señora por su casa y los  vendía en una canasta, después se compro un triciclo y  vendió por dos años, hasta que decidió hacer ella misma el pan. Alquilo un horno para  pan, contrato a un maestro panadero y un ayudante de panadería, Ysabel se dedica a la venta de panes, diario vende  mas de 3000 panes por las mañanas.   
Ysabel  necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para la compra para la compra de dos sacos de  azúcar y dos sacos harinas estos los compra diario.   
Desde que esta en Finca gracias a los préstamos puede invertir en su negocio, trabaja tranquila, sin tener que prestarse de sus vecinos que le cobran altos intereses. 
El sueño de Isabel es tener un local propio para  hacer y vender pan.
texts.en:
Ysabel is a member of La Fortaleza (The Fortress) Community Bank. She is 37-year-old mother of four children, ages 12, 11, 9, and 3, who are studying at a state school, and she lives with her partner. Ysabel started her business buying bread from a woman's home and then selling it out of a basket. Later she bought a moto-tricycle and sold bread from that for two years until she decided to make the bread herself. She rented a bread oven and hired a head baker and an assistant. Ysabel is dedicated to selling the breads, and she sells more than 3,000 each morning. She is requesting a loan of 800 soles, which she plans to use to purchase two sacks of sugar and two sacks of flour, which she buys daily. Since she has been with Kiva partner Finca, she has been able to invest in her business and work tranquilly without having to borrow money from her neighbors, who charge high interest. Ysabel's dream is to have her own store where she can make and sell bread.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of sugar and flour

loans.name: René Alonso

texts.es: René Alonso L. vive en un pequeño canton de la Costa del Sol ubicado en departamento de La Paz, René está acompañado y tiene dos pequeños niños Gerson de 6 años y Thomas de 3 años, René le da vigilancia al lugar donde vive, ya que él fue contratado para darle mantenimiento de cuidos y vigilancia al rancho, por este trabajo René recibí 140$ mensuales pero él y su esposa viendo la necesidad económica de incrementar sus ingresos tuvieron la idea de montar una pequeña tienda en el mismo rancho donde residen, ya llevan 7 años con su negocio. Este crédito René lo solicita para surtir la tienda.
texts.en:
Rene Alonso Lainez lives in a small section of Costa del Sol, located in the department of La Paz. Rene is married and has two small sons: Gerson is 6 years old and Thomas is 3 years old. Rene is a guard in the place where he lives, he was hired to maintain the property and guard the ranch. He makes 140$ per month for this work. Together with his wife, seeing the need to increase their income, they decided to open a small store in the same quarters where they live. They have had this business for 7 years. Rene is requesting this loan to be able to stock the store.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock the general store.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
N. Nguyễn Thị is fifty-five years old and lives in the town of Ninh Giang.  She is married and has two grown children.  To make a living, N. owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale.  She has been engaged in this business for over twenty years and earns approximately $200 a month from these activities.

In 2002, N. joined the Kiva field partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services that would help improve her living situation by giving her the ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid previous loans from TYM Fund.  These loans were used to invest in expanding her business.  N. is now requesting a new loan that will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  This will be her seventh loan from TYM Fund.  N. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to continue making improvements in her business.

loans.use: to purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita L. de 41 años, reside en La Libertad junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella posee una pequeña tienda en su propio lugar de habitación. Margarita solicita un préstamo, ya que ella quiere incrementar todos los productos de su tienda, debido a que ella desea percibir más ganancias para contribuir a su hogar. Entre los productos que desea comprar están: embutidos, golosinas, jugos, y otros más, ya que estos son los que más demanda perciben de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Margarita L. is 41 and lives in La Libertad with her husband and 2 children. She has a small store in her home. Margarita is requesting a loan because she wants to increase her merchandise. She thinks she can earn more income to contribute to her home. Among the products she would like to buy are: sausages, candy, and juices. These are the products that are most in demand by her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more products for her business

loans.name: Bisanje 1 Namukisa Yudaya Group

texts.en: N. Yudaya is thirty years old married with five children, all in schooling. She is also looking after two dependents who go to school. She deals with livestock and poultry, so far five years in the business. She is using the loan to purchase cows and chickens for livestock and poultry to sell. She is a hardworking business lady who is encouraging fellow women mostly not to sit down and wait upon their husbands to provide unto them with everything but to wake up and work or be creative. N. Yudaya’s future hope is to purchase a car to use as a taxi to generate a daily income.

loans.use: To purchase cows and chickens to sell.

loans.name: Jeannettte Del Rosario

texts.es: Jeannette del Rosario E. Díaz tiene 40 años. Es una mujer casada. Tiene 3 hijos a su cargo y todos estudian con el esfuerzo de Jeannette. El negocio inicio hace 17 años, en su vivienda comenzó a vender refrescos naturales, por lo que logro tener demanda por sus clientes, posteriormente se ubico en las afueras del mercado. Es aquí donde está situada actualmente, por lo que con este negocio ha logrado mantener a su familia. Es destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de frutas para la elaboración de sus refrescos naturales, pan con mantequilla. Su deseo es obtener otra fuente de ingresos, para su familia.
texts.en:
Jeannette del Rosario E. Díaz is 40, married, and she is raising three children. The children go to school because of Jeannette’s efforts. She started her business 17 years ago. She started selling natural beverages from her home. She managed to have customer demand, so she later located herself outside of the market. That is where she is currently located. Through this business she has been able to support her family. She will use the loan to buy bread, butter, and fruit to make her natural beverages. Her wish is to obtain another source of income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Scovia's Group

texts.en:
N. Scovia is a business lady with a strong drive to succeed through business and hard work. For ten years now, she has run a a bar and a hotel in Kireku. Just like most businesses, Scovia started small but over the years, her businesses have grown and now she hopes to further expand. At the moment, she is able to make weekly profits of 50,000 and wants to double this in the near future. 

She has a family of three and takes care of three orphans. She prepares local food at the restaurant, then operates the bar in the evenings.This is Scovia’s first requested loan and she hopes to buy more food stuffs and drinks for her businesses.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs for the restaurant and drinks for the bar.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha O. is from the village of Makawa. She is 52 years old. Editha is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Editha owns and operates a poultry business, raising chickens for sale. Editha has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Editha joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Editha has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Editha is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De Huambalpa Group

texts.es:
La Comunidad de Huambalpa pertenece al distrito de Huambalpa, provincia de Vilcashuaman, departamento de Ayacucho, la comunidad se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Vilcas, su actividad primordial es la agricultura y la ganadería, Su producción mas productiva son los cereales y los tubérculos, como la papa.

Celedonia es casada y tiene 02 hijos, ella se dedica a vender abarrotes en su comunidad, los cuales trae desde la ciudad con la ayuda de su esposo y sus hijos. Gracias a su empeño y los préstamos obtenidos, su negocio a podido crecer. Celedonia solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería y así surtir su negocio. Ella, se encuentra ahorrando para poder financiar los estudios de sus hijos.

Tarcila es casada y tiene 05 hijos. Tarcila se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y a dar pensión a los docentes y personas que visitantes de su comunidad, negocio que le va muy bien y en el cual le ayuda su esposo y sus hijos cuando están de vacaciones. Ella necesita un préstamo para poder comprar mercadería para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Huambalpa community belongs to the Huambalpa district, Vilcashuaman province, Ayacucho department. The community is located ten minutes from the city of Vilcas. Farming and livestock are the main activities. Their most productive products are grains and tubers like potatoes. Celedonia is married and has two children. She sells groceries in her community. She brings them from the city with help from her husband and children. Thanks to her effort and the loans she has received, her business has been able to grow. Celedonia is asking for a loan to buy merchandise to stock her business. She is saving to pay for her children’s education. Tarcila is married and has five children. Tarcila sells groceries and provides meals for the teachers and people who visit her community. The business is going very well. Her husband and their children help her when they are on vacation. She needs a loan to be able to buy merchandise for her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Marilen

texts.es: Marilen, es una socia responsable y muy dinámica, tiene 42 años de edad y es madre de cuatro hijos menores de edad, es madre soltera, se dedica a la venta de bebidas  en el caserío de Roaboya que se encuentra a doce horas de navegación del puerto de la ciudad de Pucallpa. Ella trabaja con uno de sus hijos en esta comunidad. Es socia hace dos años del Banco Comunal “La Fortaleza”, su primer préstamo fue de 500 soles que invirtió en productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos.  COn este préstamo de 1300 soles, comprará bebidas como son gaseosas, néctar, refrescos. La meta de Marilen es tener una tienda bien implementada pero en la ciudad de Pucallpa.
texts.en:
Marilen is a very responsible and dynamic member. She is 42 years old and is the mother of four minor children. She is a single mother and works selling beverages in the settlement of Roaboya, which is twelve hours by boat from the port of the city of Pucallpa. She works with one of her children in this community. She has been a member of the “La Fortaleza” (The Power) communal banking group for two years. Her first loan was for 500 soles which she invested in food staples like rice, sugar, milk, and noodles. With this loan for 1300 soles, she will buy beverages such as sodas, nectars, and drinks. Marilen’s goal is to have a well set-up store, but in the city of Pucallpa.

Translated from Spanish by Joseph Tobin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will invest in the purchase of beverages like sodas, nectars, and drinks.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda J. lives in the village of Sto. Lagay, Brgy. Su-ay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She is 57 years old and is married to Joel J., who works as a tailor. Rosalinda supplements her husband's income by raising pigs and vegetable farming.  She works hard to improve the living condition of her family, providing for all their basic needs, education and future security. 

In January 2005, Rosalinda knew that the little she and her husband earned would not meet the needs of their child, so she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she could borrow enough capital to start her general store. When she received her loan, she bought the most sellable products to sell in her store, and she reinvested the income into the business as revolving working capital. As her business continued to improve, she was also able to help advance her husband's business with some of her loans from NWTF-PD. Their combined monthly net income averages around PHP 13,000 and they invest most of it back into their respective businesses, after taking some out to cover their household expenses.

In her previous loan she borrowed Php 13,000 as additional capital for her general store. She paid back the loan in weekly installments and was able to fully pay it back within the loan term. Now she is borrowing PHP 10,000 for her eighth cycle loan, which she intends to use as additional capital for her general store and also to buy a pig to raise and sell after a few months. The income from this loan will be used for their household expenses, school expenses, and as capital for fish vending.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc., has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her general store and to buy a pig to raise and sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita R. is from Pagadian City. She is 56 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Teresita owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal “Juchuy Niño” ubicado en el del distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; tiene 39 años de edad, de estado civil casada y tiene 7 hijos, vive en la comunidad de Capana, estudió educación primaria incompleta.

La señora esta trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace medio año, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de venta de pescado.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, capital que será utilizado para la compra de redes y combustible para su bote y así poder realizar su trabajo que es la pesca artesanal, su producto lo comercializa en la feria zonal.

Su mayor deseo es poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa is a member of the Communal Bank “Juchuy Niño” located in the District of Capachica, Puno Province, Department of Puno. She is 39 years old, married, and has 7 children. Teresa lives in the community of Capana and was not able to finish elementary school.

She has been working with Manuela Ramos for 1½ years. Her first loan of 500 soles allowed her to increase her business capital for selling fish.

Teresa is requesting a new loan in the amount of 800 soles in order to buy nets and fuel for her boat so that she can continue fishing. She sells her catch at the regional fair. Her greatest desire is to provide a good education for her children. She enjoys the Communal Bank meetings and her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets & fuel for her boat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more materials for making baskets

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 23 años, vive junto a su pareja y madre de su hijo de 2 añitos. La casa donde viven es propia.
Desde hace 5 años tiene una chacra donde también está su vivienda, allí siembra productos de pan llevar como el plátano, frutos cítricos, yuca, arroz, entre otros. Adicionalmente, cría aves de corral y cerdos. 
Lo que le gusta a Jesús de sus actividades es hacer bien su trabajo, sobre todo mantener en buen estado su chacra. Una vez que cosecha sus productos los vende, cada semana, en el mercado de su localidad, por los que obtiene buenas ganancias porque todos sus productos son de buena calidad y frescos.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de ser parte de un banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros son unidos, se alejan de los problemas y son muy trabajadores. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá totalmente en la mayor producción de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Jesús is 23. He lives with his life partner and mother of his two year old son. The house where they live is his own. For five years he has had a farm in the same location as his house. He plants staple food crops like bananas, citrus fruits, yucca, and rice among others. He also raises poultry and pork. What Jesús likes about his activities is doing his work well. Above all, he likes keeping his farm in a good state. Once he harvests his products he sells them every week in the local market. He gets good earnings because all of his products are good quality and fresh. This is his second loan with MFP. What he likes about being part of a communal bank is that all of his colleagues are united. They keep problems away, and they are very hard-working. The money he is asking for is to invest totally in greater production on his farm.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase agricultural production

loans.name: Abdel Hakim

texts.en:
Abdel Hakim is a Palestinian man who is married with five children: three boys aged 19, 14 and 10, and two girls aged 8 and 6 years old. He lives with his family in a nearby village of Jenin.

Abdel Hakim is a taxi driver, operating between Jenin city and Jericho for people who want to travel to Jordan, since Jericho city is where the border crossings are located. His work is the primary source of income for his family but in addition to that he owns agricultural land where he plants olive and almond trees; his wife takes care of the land and its cultivation.

Abel Hakim has requested 1,500 USD from FATEN to pay his son’s university fees. He hopes that his son will have a university degree and get a better education than he did, himself.

loans.use: To pay his son's university tuition fees

loans.name: Junard

texts.en:
Junard P. is from the village of Dalapang Ozamiz City. He is 27 years old. Junard is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Junard owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation services to local community members. Junard has been engaged in his business for more than five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Junard joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Junard has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Junard is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a motorcycle. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Junard from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.use: To repair a motorcyle

loans.name: Firas

texts.en:
Firas has owned a spare-parts shop in his town since 2005. He is 26 years old, single, and has four brothers and sisters.

Firas is a hardworking man and that's the reason why he has a great demand for his spare parts. Thus he wants to buy more spare parts in order to be in demand by his clients.

Firas wants to take a loan of $1,200 to buy more spare parts and to enlarge his shop to meet the requirements of his clients and to make a good income.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts to sell

loans.name: Shah Raza

texts.en:
This young man is Shah Raza the son of M.. He lives in 13th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 25, single, and a hard working boy. He is a taxi driver.

Shah Raza became engaged two years ago and now he wants to get married. He needs money for some of his wedding expenses, so he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani.

Shah Raza would like to mention that Kiva is the best process which can support the entrepreneurs and those who are really in need of money.

loans.use: To pay wedding expenses

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva M. is a trusted member of Kiva partner, ASHI, in the Philippines. She has been receiving loans since she became a member in 2009, and has been able to sustain a small business that provides her family with their basic needs.
Primitiva buys and sells “amakan” (a word which, in Antiqueño dialect, refers to woven bamboo strips that are used to dry rice under the heat of the sun). She started this business with her first loan last year. In partnership with her husband, Lino, they transport this product to other provinces through “RORO", or roll on, roll of – a means of transport whereby vehicles that carry passengers and products, particularly buses, roll on a barge to travel across the ocean and roll off once their destination is reached.
Primitiva is happily engaged in this business activity with her husband. Although their profit is still small, she and her husband enjoy working together to achieve their dream of helping their children, even in a small way. Primitiva and her husband agreed to request another loan to finance their plan of expanding their business. They want to put up a small warehouse for storing the amakan they sell.

loans.use: To purchase more "amakan" to sell

loans.name: Octavio

texts.es: Octavio de 57 años de edad, trabaja para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa como Operador de Maquinaria Pesada desde hace 4 años, es originario de Santo Domingo, es casado con la Sra.Aura Lila Aguilar, con quien procreo 3 hijos, los 2 mayores ya estan casados y el menor de 19 años de nombre Helman estudia. Don Octavio de lunes a viernes pasa trabajando en Juigalpa y el fin de semana se va a Santo Domingo junto a su familia;  esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda, cambiando el techo que se encuentra en mal estado antes que llegue el invierno.  El mayor sueño que tienen es poder tener su vivienda bonita, con las mejores condiciones para que viva su familia.
texts.en:
Octavio is 57 years old, and has spent the past 4 years working for the Juigalpa Muncipality as a Heavy Machinery Operator. He is originally from Santo Domingo, and is married to Aura Lila Aguila. They have 3 children together - two of whom are married adults, and one 19 year old named Helman, who studies. Octavio works from Monday to Friday, and spends his weekend in Santo Domingo together with his family. He is seeking his first loan in order to improve his home before winter and fix his roof, which is currently in poor shape. Octavio's dream is to have a nice home, with better living conditions for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix his roof

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more drinks to serve customers.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a married with three children and her children go to school. She rents a two roomed house where she stays with five people. The family has access to electricity and piped water. Sarah takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses include medication, school fees and feeding the famliy. She owns a restaurant in Ntinda Nsimbiziwome and sells to all categories of people on retail and also practices outside catering. She works seven days a week and receives at least 30 customers a day.  She has been in this business for 10 years and her business challenge is seasonality.  Besides this restaurant business, she also raises chickens at her home.  She has been with MCDT for some years, servicing her 10th loan.  She wants to use this loan to buy more maize flour, Irish potatoes, beans, bananas, and charcoal for her restaurant. Her main customers are hawkers, vendors and passersby. She aspires to build a bigger restaurant and own a permanent house. She joined MCDT because it was near her home and was giving out timely loans.

loans.use: To buy more maize flour, charcoal, irish potatoes, and bananas.

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeun C., 50 (shown in the photo), and her husband, Mr. Neang Chuy, 46, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980 and have six children: one daughter who is a garment factory worker and five sons. One of them is married and lives outside the family home, two attend school and the other two stay at home.   
Thoeun has been a silk weaver since she was 18 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. Mr. Neang Chuy has been a fisherman since he was 20 years old. He fishes from the lake near his house and sells in the local market. 
Thoeun is requesting a loan in the amount of $150 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying traditional "pagnes" fabrics for resale

loans.name: Khoder

texts.en: Khoder is a 36 year old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and their two children. He has 10 years experience in food and home products sales. He is proud of the high quality of his work. He believes that his honesty and experience working in this field has helped him distinguish himself. His customers are people from his region. He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to improve his income by purchasing more merchandise. When he first started his business, Khoder didn’t use to lot of income to diversify his merchandise. This will be his second loan. His previous loan allowed him to diversify his merchandise. He hopes to continue improve his business in the coming year.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Jennifer Njoki

texts.en:
Jennifer Njoki is a 60-year-old married lady and the mother of four children between the ages of 16 and 27.  Only the last born is still in school. The others are working; the first as a counselor, the second as a cook and messenger, and the third working for Kenya motors.

Jennifer operates a food kiosk and she also sells grocery items in the same makeshift stall. She serves tea with snacks like sweet potatoes and doughnuts to her customers who are residents of her area of business in Kiambu area.  The grocery business has items like sweet potatoes, tomatoes, onions and so on.  She is able to make a profit of about $187 per month.

Jennifer was introduced to KADET by staffers who were conducting a marketing initiative in the area. She has applied for her third loan which she will use to expand her business by adding things like charcoal, groundnuts, beans and peas to sell.

She would like to see her business expand more and give her more profit, which she would use to educate all her children, and if possible send them abroad for further studies. She believes that her hard work and faithfulness will get her there.

loans.use: To expand her food stall to sell items like charcoal and groundnuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sale of various products, such as basic grains, sodas, candy, etc.

loans.name: Unidos Alcanzaremos Nuestras Metas Group

texts.es:
Juan es un joven de 26 años su familia tiene un negocio de fumigación “JMW “el apoya en la parte de ventas ofreciendo los servicios  a muchas empresas e instituciones, con su trabajo el puede solventar su carrera  en la universidad   actualmente esta en la mitad  de sus estudios siendo esta su segunda carrera ya que culmino otra de derecho. por otro lado también se ayuda dictando clases particulares a estudiantes de colegios , con la culminación de su carrera el quiere seguir apoyando el negocio de su familia y expandirlo apoyando con los conocimientos adquiridos mediante su profesión, su préstamo le servirá para comprar algunos extintores  para cumplir con su clientela, el grupo del  cuales el presidente  se llama “ UNIDOS ALCANZAREMOS NUESTRAS METAS “  grupo formado por 8 jóvenes   entusiastas y trabajadores.

* Juan M. es el trecero de la foto el mas alto
texts.en:
Juan is a young man of 26 years. His family has a fumigation business called "JMW". He helps in the area of sales, offering services to many companies and institutions. With his work he is able to support his university career. He is currently in the middle of his studies, as this is his second degree since he already completed his law degree. He also helps give certain classes to university students. When he finishes his degree he wants to continue helping his family with their business, expand it, supporting it with the knowledge acquired from his degree. His loan will be used for the purchase of some fire extinguishers for his customers. Their group, of which he is president, is called "Unidos Alcanzaremos Nuestros Metas" ["Together We Will Meet Our Goals"], and made up of 8 young enthusiastic and hard-working people. * Juan M. is the third in the photo, the tallest

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of fire extinguishers for his business

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María de 21 años, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, a su alrededor tiene el estero salado), ella tiene un puesto en el mercado de venta de embutidos. 

Empezó a los 14 años vendiendo legumbres con ayuda de su mama después que llegaba del colegio, poco a poco cuando creció consiguió un puesto en el mercado de su casa. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta 14h00pm, vende mortadelas a $ 2.10, chorizas a $ 1.50.     

Para seguir con su puesto de embutidos ella quiere comprar embutidos con el préstamo, en el futuro quiere tener su propia tienda, y una tienda de embutidos para asegurar su juventud.
texts.en:
María, age 21, lives in the Perimetral de Guayaquil (suburban area bordered by a salt water stream). She has a stand in the market, and she sells sausage. Fourteen years ago, with her mother’s help, she started selling vegetables when she got home from school. Little by little, when she was grown she got her own stand close to her house. She now works from eight in the morning until two in the afternoon. She sells bologna for $2.10 and sausage for $1.50.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sausages

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es: La Señora Anabel tiene 34 años, ella se dedica a la venta de leche natural y cuajada, por iniciativa propia es que ha decidido establecer este negocio en su vivienda, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo, es una persona muy cariñosa con sus clientes, pues se sienten muy bien al venir a comprar y hablar con ella, le gusta la actividad que realiza pues siempre está pensando en mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Este financiamiento es para la compra de más leche ya que tiene una muy buena demanda y así podrá suplir la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Anabel is 34 years old. She sells natural milk and curd on her own initiative, that is, she decided to establish this business in her home. She has three minor children under her care. She is a very warm person with customers, so that they feel good about coming to buy from her and talk with her. She likes what she does and is always thinking of how to improve her family’s quality of living. This funding will be used to purchase more milk as it is in high demand, and thus she will be able to supply her customers.

Translated from Spanish by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Conception

texts.en: Conception A. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 49 years old, separated from her spouse and has two grown-up children. She is from the village of San Miguel, Gingoog City. Conception has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Conception joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Conception has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase products to sell. Conception is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Yaneris

texts.es:
Yaneris C. Ríos es una mujer de 44 años que resuelve el problema mas usual de las amas de casa cuando no tienen lavadoras y les toca hacerlo a pleno sol y manualmente. Esta fue la necesidad que ella observó en si misma para emprender el negocio de ofrecer servicios de rentar maquinas lavadoras desde el año 2006 y también porque su familia requería un ingreso más para mejorar su nivel de visa. En el Milagro, su barrio, hay muy poca competencia y esto ayuda a que su negocio cada día crezca, eso si agregándole el servicio mas cordial a sus clientes y en horaR. desde las 7:00 PM a las 7:00 PM. Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el quiere comprar 5 maquinas mas, pues esto sustancialmente ayudaría a incrementar sus ingreso familiares porque su clientela se ha extendido hacia otras urbanizaciones donde no existe este negocio.
Su sueño es lograr la estabilidad económica de su familia y un futuro mas prometedor, por eso diariamente trabaja y construye la mejor forma de responder a sus clientes, de allí que últimamente extendió su horario, para que cuando lleguen del trabajo las madres de familia puedan en las noches lavar también y tengan mas tiempo para participar  con sus hijos los fines de semana en actividades lúdicas.
texts.en:
Yaneris C. Ríos, 44, solves one of housewives’ most pressing problems when they don’t own washing machines and have to wash clothes by hand in the hot sun.  This is the need she observed in herself so she decided to go into business providing washing machine rentals in 2006.   Also, her family needed more income in order to have a better quality of life.

In El Milagro, her neighborhood, there is very little competition and this helps her business grow day by day.  That is, of course, by providing cordial service from 7am until 7pm.

This is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she wants to use it to buy five more washing machines which will substantially increase family income because her customer base has expanded into residential areas where such a service is nonexistent.

Her dream is to achieve economic stability for her family and a more promising future.  This is why she works daily building a better way to respond to customer needs.  This led her to expand business hours so that when mothers get home from work at night they can wash clothes and thus have time available on weekends to enjoy recreational activities with their children.

loans.use: To buy five washing machines.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en: Olivia G. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Liloan, Santander, Cebu. She earns her living by selling soft drinks and snacks. Her husband, Simeon G., works as a security guard. Olivia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, and through her own efforts, Olivia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2,500, improving her family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to pay for more soft drinks to sell so that she can continue to save up for the future security of her family. Olivia G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela forma parte del banco comunal “Pueblo de Indios Emprende”, perteneciendo a la comuna de San Vicente de Tagua Tagua. Ella tiene un kiosco en un colegio hace 2 años, el cual atiende ella sola. También hace berlines y queques, los cuales vende también en su kiosco. Su esposo, quien trabaja como temporero (trabajo esporádico durante determinadas cosechas), cuando no esta trabajando le ayuda a hacer sopaipillas y a atender el kiosco. Además en su casa hace tortas y otros productos de repostería por encargo.  Con este préstamo quiere comprar una máquina conservadora. Su sueño es tener una casa, ya que vive con su familia, es decir su esposo y sus 2 hijas, de 15 y 10 años en la casa de una tía, por lo que esta ahorrando para eso. Su motivación es poder darle estudios superiores a sus hijas. Esta muy agradecida de la facilidad con la que Fondo Esperanza le ha entregado los préstamos, ya que ni ella ni su esposo pueden obtener préstamos en los bancos. 
San Vicente de Tagua Tagua es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, perteneciente a la región del Libertador General Bernardo O’higgins, emplazada a orillas del río Estero Zamorano. Su principal fuente económica se basa en la producción de limones, naranjas y paltas.
texts.en:
Manuela is a member of the “Pueblo de Indios Emprende” community bank which is located in the San Vicente de Tagua Tagua district.  For 2 years she has had a kiosk in a school where she serves on her own.  She also makes doughnuts and sponge cakes which she sells in her kiosk.  Her husband, who is a seasonal worker (sporadic work during harvest times), helps her to make 'sopaipillas' (a type of fried pastry) and serve in the kiosk when he isn't working.  She also makes cakes and other confectionery at home which she sells to order.  She will use this loan to buy a cooler.  Her dream is to have her own house since she currently lives with her family, that is to say she lives in her aunt's house with her husband and her 2 daughters aged 15 and 10.  She is saving up to buy her own house.  Her motivation is to be able to support her daughters through their higher education.
