She is very grateful for the loans which Fondo Esperanza have given her since neither her nor her husband could obtain loans from the banks.

San Vicente de Tagua Tagua is a district in the central area of Chile in the Libertador General Bernardo O'Higgins region on the banks of the river Estero Zamorano.  The area's main source of income is the production of lemons, oranges and avocados.

loans.use: To buy a cooler

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Juan José M. Z. tiene 20 años, Vive en Unión Libre, vive  con los abuelos y la esposa y el hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos.  Tiene 1 hijo. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. Dole 2 se dedican a labores agrícolas en la hacienda bananera DOLE, ubicada en la cabecera cantonal, todos los miembros viven en el Cantón Ventanas, la mayoría de los socios trabajan mas de un año en la mencionada hacienda, y sus actividades son relacionadas a la bananera. Son aproximadamente 13 socios.

Juan  trabaja en la bananera como pesador de banano, trabaja desde hace tres año, las comprar las realiza en el comisariato  1 en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para ponerse un negocio en la casa y adecuar el local y comprar productos para su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es mejorar la vivienda y cumplir la meta del negocio.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Juan José M. Z. is 20 years old.  He lives with his partner, his grandparents and his son.  He lives in Ventanas Canton in Los Ríos Province.  He has 1 son. 

The members of the communal bank V.R.C. Dole 2 make their livings in agricultural work on the DOLE banana hacienda, which is located in the seat of the Canton.  All of the members live in Ventanas Canton.  The majority of the members have worked for more than a year at the previously mentioned hacienda, and their businesses are connected to bananas.  There are approximately 13 members.

Juan has worked weighing bananas for three years.  He makes his purchases in the Comisariato (Market) 1 in Ventanas.

He is requesting the loan to start a business out of his home, to adapt his premises to the business and to purchase products for his business.  The loan will help him to fulfill his financial needs.  His dreams are to improve his house and to reach his business goals.
He likes sports.

loans.use: To start a business out of his home, to adapt his premises to the business and to purchase products for his business.

loans.name: Orlando Enrique

texts.es:
Orlando, es un joven de 20 años de edad, casado, vive con su esposa y su primer hijo de 2 meses de nacido, se dedica a la venta de verduras en un vehículo, esta venta es una parte de su padre y la otra le pertenece a él, el horario es de 6:00am a 5:00pm, por su experiencia en el negocio no ha tenido dificultades y ha logrado permanecer en el negocio.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de verdura como tomates, pepinos, cebollas, y la otra parte la necesita para construir una pequeña casa para vivir con su esposa. Este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar la cantidad de verdura para ofrecer a los clientes ya que por el momento ofrece más de la de su padre, vendiendo él solo un poco, además construirá una pequeña casa para poder vivir en lo propio con su familia.
Su objetivo es cancelar puntualmente el préstamo, aumentar la venta de verduras para alcanzar independizarse de su padre, para recibir mejores ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia así como también ver crecer a  su hijo sano.
texts.en:
Orlando is a young man of 20, married and living with his wife and his first child, a 2-month-old baby. His work is selling vegetables from a vehicle. The sales business belongs partly to his father and partly to him. His work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Thanks to his experience in the business, he has not had difficulties and he has been able to keep going with the business. 

Currently, he is requesting a loan to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, cucumbers and onions, and he also needs part of the funds to construct a small house to live in with his wife. This loan will help him increase the quantity of vegetables he offers to his customers, since he now mainly sells his father's goods, and only a small amount of his own. In addition, he will construct a small house so that he can live on his own with his family. 

His goal is to pay off the loan punctually and increase his vegetable sales so that he can become independent from his father, so that he can receive a better income and improve his family's quality of life, as well as seeing his child grow up healthy.

loans.use: Buying vegetables

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Maria C. tiene 47 años de edad, vive en la aldea las Piletas de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica al comercio, vende mercaderia como ser: pantalones, camisas, camisetas, blusas, faldas etc. su mercaderia la vende en la aldea en donde vive, ademas cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y de su hijo en las ventas de su mercaderia.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa nueva al por mayor ya que para esta epoca de navidad tiene muchos pedidos de sus clientes.
su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio y de esta manera tener una mejor calidad de vida tanto para ella como para su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Maria C. is 47, and she lives in the village of Las Piletas in the city of Choluteca and she is in sales.  She sells items such as: pants, shirts, blouses, t-shirts, skirts, etc.  She does most of her business in the area where she lives and she has help from her husband and son.

She will use the loan to buy new clothing wholesale since it is Christmas season and she has many orders from her customers.

Her goal is have her business continue growing and thus have a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy shoes, sandals, pants, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, skirts, bathing suits and backpacks

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio C. N. tiene 45 años. Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la conviviente y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LA ESPERANZA NUNCA SE PIERDE, pertenece a la comunidad o recinto el Placer, a una distancia de 120 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura.

Marco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao y arroz. Las compras y ventas las realiza en el Cantón Chillanes en la feria de los días Domingos.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para tener dinero para que los hijos tengan una vida sin necesidades.

Le gusta visitar a la familia, cuidar a los padres, salir de paseo, jugar pelota y ver la pelea de gallos.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio C. N., age 45, is in a common-law marraige.  He lives with his life partner and their children in the Chillanes canton in the Bolívar province.  He has four children.

The members of the La Esperanza Nunca Se Pierde (Never Lose Hope) Communal Bank belong to the Placer community or precinct.  It is 120 minutes from the Chillanes office.  Most of the members of this bank are farmers.

Marco grows corn, cacao, and rice.  He makes his purchases and sales at the Sunday fair in the Chillanes canton.

He is requesting the loan to buy seeds and organic and chemical fertilizers.  

The support of the loan will financially help him to provide the necessities.  His crops face the challenges of pest infestations, diseases, and climate changes.

His dream is to continue working in order to have the money so that his children have the necessities of life.

He likes to visit family, take care of his parents, go for walks, play ball, and watch cockfights.

loans.use: Seeds and natural and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
La señora Maria Estela P. G., es casada y tiene 43 años de edad, su esposo tien 45 años y se fue a los estados unidos de manera ilegal, esto con la finalidad de mejorar la condicion de vida de su esposa y sus tres hijos, que son Oscar, Fatima y  Daniel, a quienes desde hace poco mas de tres años dejo al cuidado de su su esposa, Mari como la conocen todos se dedica desde hace mas de 6 años al negocio de abarrotes, ella tiene una pequeña tiendita, que dia a dia trata de manter con lo necesario de productos basicos y de mayor demanda. 
Al paso del tiempo sus hijos han ido creciendo y junto con ellos la necesidad de estudiar, vestir, calzar, etc. es por eso que las ganacias obtenidas en la tiendita ya no alcanzaba optando su esposo por emigrar a otro pais.
La necesidad de Mari, la vio obligada a solicitar un prestamo para utilizarlo en la inversion de su negocio, ella con este capital, pudo comprar,arroz, azucar, pasta de trigo para preparar sopa,frijoles, huevos, aceite, leche, chiles enlatados, sal, galletas, algunos refrescos y jugos envasados, ella nos platica que con este recurso esta mejorando su negocio y puede ofrecer mas productos a sus clientes, y las ganancias obtenidas son para el pago del credito, para reinvertir y para comprar lo necesario.
El reto al que se enfrenta Maria es la competencia y es que se vueve complicado a veces para ella mantener su negocio, por la alza de algunos productos basicos, asi como el incremento de establecimiemtos a su alrededor, la ventaja que tiene Mari es que ella no paga renta, porque su negocio esta ubicado en su domicilio, pero lo que no le ayuda es el espacio para sus productos ya que el el local es muy pequeño.
Maria Magdalena, comenta que a pesar de todo le va vien en su negocio y que espera hacerlo crecer mas, le gustaria a ella agrandar mas el espacio deonde esta ubicada su tienda, para poder surtir mas variedad de productos, le encantaria mejorar su vivienda y que sus hijos estudien un carrera profesional.
Le agradece a fundacion realidad por su credito ya que es de gran ayuda y lo ha sabido invertir, ella les desea lo mejor a todos los que hacen posible esta ayuda.
texts.en:
Maria Estela is married and is 43 years old. Her husband, who is 45 years old, went to the United States, three years ago, without documentation. He left in order to improve the quality of life of his wife and children, Oscar, Fatima and Daniel. Mari has run a small grocery store for six years, which has become well-known to many.  Each day, Mari strives to keep her store stocked with basic goods as well as products that are in high demand. 

Over time, not only have their children grown, but so has their need for an education, clothing, shoes etc.  Her husband decided to go to the United States when the income from the store no longer was sufficient to meet their family's needs.   Mari's needs prompted her to request a loan to be put towards her business. With the loan, she was able to buy rice, beans, eggs, oil, milk, canned chili peppers, salt, cookies, some soft drinks and bottled juice. She has related to us that with this assistance her business is improving and she is able to offer more products to her clients. The money she earns goes toward loan payments, reinvestments and purchasing necessary items. 

The challenge Maria is facing is with competing stores.  It can be difficult at times to maintain her business due to the raise in the price of commodities as well as the increasing number of near by businesses.  The advantage Maria has is that she does not have to pay rent because her business is located in her home.  However, what is not in her favor is the limited space she has for her products because of the small size of the room where the store is located.  

Maria indicates that in spite of everything her business is doing well and she hopes to make it grow more. She would like to increase the size of the space where her store is located in order to stock it with more products. She would also like to improve her housing and see her children study in a career track. Maria is grateful to Fundación Realidad for the loan. Receiving it and learning how to invest it have been a great help. Maria wishes the best to all those who have made the assistance possible.

loans.use: The loan request described below is to purchase food products and staple goods such as; rice, beans, soup ingredients, milk, sugar, canned chili peppers, canned beans, canned sardines and tuna, salt, eggs, laundry detergent, body soap etc.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle E. is from the village of ZNAC, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 25 years old. Michelle is married and has one school-aged child. 

To make a living, Michelle owns and operates a retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Michelle has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Michelle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Michelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. 

Michelle is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Michelle from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
En el municipio de Masaya, Departamento de Masaya, labora el señor Miguel Antonio M. M. , el cual tiene 6 años de laborar como Analista de cobranza en una empresa ubicada en la misma zona. Es casado solo depende tres personas del cual está compuesto su núcleo familiar.

Actualmente tiene la necesidad de realizar mejoramiento de vivienda en su casa de habitación ya que en enero del 2011 hubieron unos temblores y de dañaron las paredes de su casa y por tal razón visita las oficinas de CEPRODEL para realizar dicho mejoramiento, considera que de esta forma estará dándole un hogar digno a su familia ya que quiere que ellos crezcan saludablemente.
texts.en:
Sr. Miguel Antonio M. works in the town of Masaya in the Department of Masaya. For the past six years, he has worked as a collections analyst for a company located in the same district. Miguel is married and has three people in his family who are dependents.

He currently needs to make improvements to his home. In January 2011, earthquake tremors damaged the walls of his house. For this reason, he visited the offices of CEPRODEL so that he could make repairs. This will enable him to have a decent home where his family can grow in a healthy environment.

loans.use: Repair the walls of his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale

loans.name: Bokk Xalaat Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK XALAAT est créé le 04 décembre 2007. Il est composé de 11 femmes qui habitent le même village. Elles sont unies par des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Leurs principales activités sont le petit commerce et l'embouche ovine. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR NDIAYE BALLE. 

Madame DIOUMA D. (debout à droite de la photo, habillée de vêtement mauve)est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants.

Elle fait un petit commerce de lait caillé, fait de la transformation et vente d'huile de palme et de l'embouche bovine. Elle est très expérimentée dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plus de 5 ans. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra au moins d'acheter un moutons pour l'embouche d'une part, et de continuer son petit commerce d'autre part.

Avec les bénéfices généré par ses activités elle soutient son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille
texts.en:
The Bokk Xalaat solidarity group was created December 4, 2007. It is composed of eleven women living in the same village. They are linked by ties of kinship and community. Their main activities are retail commerce and fattening of sheep. The group is part of the Keur Ndiaye Bale “Banc Villageois”.

Ms. Diouma D. (standing right of the photo, dressed in purple clothing) is responsible for the group. She is 31 years old, married and the mother of six children.

She has a small business retailing milk curd. She also processes and sells palm oil and fattens livestock. She is very experienced in this field of activity having practices it for over five years.

Her new loan will enable her to at least buy one sheep for fattening, and also continue her business activities.

With the profits generated by her activities she is supportive of her husband in taking care of the family.

loans.use: Develop her retai business and fatten livestock

loans.name: Go Before Group

texts.en:
Presented to you are members of the “Go-Before” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 500,000 SLL each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standards of living. 

The leader of this group is Mariama K.. Mariama is 55 years old and was born in Bo City. Mariama is married with eight children. For many years now, Mariama has been selling palm oil, the country’s favorite cooking oil. With this loan, she will expand her palm oil business by buying gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta A., from the village of Diamantina, Cabatuan, Isabela, is 43 years old, widowed, and has three grown children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a business venture raising pigs for fattening and sale. Engaged in her business for over four years, she earns approximately 7000 every three months.

In 2008, Julieta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies, she is now requesting her seventh loan of 15000 PHP for the same purpose. Julieta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang S. is a 33-year-old farmer who lives in Kompong Cham province. She and her husband have been working together in the farming business for many years.  They have two children. 

On average, they can earn about $4 a day to cover the family’s needs. In order to increase the family's income, Heang S. has applied for a loan to buy a used motorcycle which her husband will use to start a motor taxi service.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle which her husband will use to start a motor taxi service.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to provide cement for those who wants to construct buildings

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en: Oyungerel is 50 years old and lives with her husband in a ger—a Mongolian yurt—in Hovd Province, Mongolia. All her grown-up children live and work on their own. She manages a shoemaking business in her town. She started her business in 1993 after working at a private company for 14 years. Now she makes a variety of Mongolian traditional shoes, which she sells large amounts of during holidays. She is a polite woman who is planning to purchase a new sewing machine in order to improve her business. She says, "I want to improve my business, because it is the only source of income for us." She is requesting a loan of 800,000 Mongolian tögrögs (MNT) to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Clothild

texts.en:
Clothild is a hardworking married woman living in her own house, with four children, in Fort Portal Uganda. Her husband is a teacher by profession. Their desire is to build a permanent house, as they are currently living in in a semi permanent one. 

Clothild grows maize and rears pigs for a living. From these activities, she has been able to buy land, despite challenges in seasonal changes and high cost of feed. Her desire is to rear at least 200 pigs. Clothild needs the loan to buy pigs for rearing.

loans.use: to buy pigs for rearing.

loans.name: Munyao

texts.en:
Munyao is a 45-year-old single man. For eleven years, he has been earning a living from his laundry business. Most of his customers are people of his local community. Munyao is known for his good service, and this has helped him to retain his customers. He also farms to generate more income.

Munyao says that since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to save his money. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy detergents. He hopes to expand his laundry business in five years.

loans.use: To buy detergents

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is 24 year-old single man.  He owns a retail shop in Huruma, where he supplies things like airtime vouchers to the residents of that area.  He has been doing this business for the last three years and gets an income of  KES.35,000 per month.

He is applying for his first loan of KES.40,000 from KADET LTD, with which he plans to boost the business by buying more stock of airtime vouchers.  He will save the anticipated profit.  He hopes to venture into the exporting business in the future.

loans.use: To boost the business by buying more stock of airtime vouchers

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Isatu. She is married and has 2 children, ages 12 and 8 years. In 2006, Isatu established her groundnut and beans business. She began her business because she wants to actualize her dream of independence and that is her only source of livelihood. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about 9,560,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy groundnut (2,000,000 SLL) and beans (1,000,000 SLL). She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 1,075,960 SLL. 

In the future, Isatu plans to own a supermarket, erect a house and give her children a quality education. The persistent increase in the general price level is her major challenge, and competition is minimal. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy groundnut and beans

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 54 years old and married. She runs a fishing business with her husband. Her husband operates their fishing boat and she helps him sell his catch at the market. Catalina also buys and resells seashells. She works hard to help provide for her family's needs.

Catalina has three children aged 17, 14 and 10. She hopes to send them to college in the future.

Catalina is requesting a loan to buy paint, plywood and other materials needed to repair her fishing boat. This will help Catalina and her husband continue their fishing business.

loans.use: to buy paint, plywood and other materials needed to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Nar Ana

texts.en:
Nar Ana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of dried fish to sell for her buying and selling of dried fish business.

Nar Ana has been in this business for seven years. Nar Ana earns more income from selling bananas and coconuts.

Nar Ana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: San Antonio Ii Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres D. nombre San Antonio II se conformó en en año 2010. Actualmente está integrado por 11 miembros y con mucho esfuerzo ya se encuentran en el 3 ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.Ellas se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la D. trabajar para apoyar económicamente a sus familias.
Una historia muy conmovedora  es la D. la Sr. Ermelinda quien se dedica a la venta D. pescado, comenta que mediante este negocio la economía D. la familia mejoró bastante y D. esa forma también pueD. ayudar a su marido con los gastos D. la casa y con el estudio D. sus hijos. Uno D. sus proyectos es tener un local donD. pueda ofrecer la variedades D. peces que posee, ya que sabe que D. esa forma atraerá a más clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. pescados, para el abastecimiento D. su negocio. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, ya que D. obtener el crédito le será D. gran ayuda en sus proyectos.
texts.en:
The San Antonio II Women's Committee was formed in 2010.  Presently it is maD. up of 11 members, and with a lot of effort, they are already in their third loan cycle; together and in solidarity within the program. They help one another achieve their objective, which is to work to support their families financially. 

One very moving story is that of Ermelinda, who sells fish.  She says that through this business, her family's finances improved considerably. This enables her to also help her husband with the household expenses, and with their children's schooling. One of her plans is to have a store where she can  sell the varieties of fish that she has, as she knows that in that way she will attract more customers.  

She is applying for the loan in order to buy fish for supplying her business.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it has given to her; since obtaining a loan will be a big help with her plans.

loans.use: To buy fish for later sale.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Rebecca has a shop that sells canned goods, detergents, snacks & noodles. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, detergents & noodles to sell.

Rebecca has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rebecca hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, detergents & noodles to sell.

loans.name: Melita

texts.es: Melita tiene 41 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 13 años, quien depende de ella para tener educación y alimentación, por ello se esfuerza día a día para darle lo mejor. Juntos viven en su casa propia en compañía de sus hermanos y de su papá. Su trabajo consiste en ofrecer el servicio de transporte de pasajeros, y su faena empieza desde muy temprano para salir en busca de los pasajeros, quienes son comerciantes, trabajadores que necesitan ir a sus centros de trabajo. Es así como recorre las diversas calles de su ciudad, y cuyas ganancias le han permitido dar educación a su hijo. Por otro lado, posee otro negocio que es la venta de lubricantes, aceites y demás productos para vehículos, y del que su padre la ayuda poniendose a cargo de dicho negocio. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, porque tiene tiempo para su hogar y administrar ambos negocios. Este será el séptimo crédito con  MFP y esta contenta de trabajar con su grupo comunal, porque le dieron la oportunidad de invertir y ver crecer su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, podrá refaccionar su establecimiento y comprar más productos como lubricantes y aceites, asimismo llevar al mecánico su mototaxi.
texts.en: Melita is 41 years old and a single mother of 13 year old son who depends on her for education and food. For this reason she she puts forth each day to give him the best. Together they live in their own house along with her siblings and her father. She works in a passenger transportation service, and her day begins very early as she goes out looking for passengers who are merchants and workers that need to get to their jobs. So she drives the many streets of her city, and those profits have enabled her to educate her son. Also, she has another business selling lubricants, oils, and other car products, and her father helps her by putting her in charge of that business. She very much enjoys what she does because she has time for her home and for running both businesses. This will be her seventh loan with MFP, and she is happy to work with her communal back because they give her the opportunity to invest in and grow her business. With the loaned amount, she will able to renovate her establishment and buy more products like lubricants and oil as well as take her moto-taxi to the mechanic.

loans.use: to buy more lubricants and oils, refurbish her establishment, and repair her moto-taxi.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa Vergara is from the village of Villa Concepcion, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 27 years old and married, with one school-aged child.

Marissa owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for six years and earns approximately 200 PHP a day.

Marissa is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Parveen akhtar is a 45-year-old educated lady. She completed her education till 8th standard and couldn’t study further due to financial constraints. She is involved in a business making Paranday (an ornament used to tie hair back) and elastics. Her Paranday are very famous among her customers and she makes good sales every month.

She is a mother of five kids: two sons and three daughters. Her elder son is involved in a garment-selling business while her younger son doesn’t do anything. Her elder daughter does sewing works and other two don’t do anything.

Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her elder son’s business. With the loan, he will buy childrens' and ladies' garments in bulk to stock his shop for increasing his sales. Parveen is hopeful that with the loan investment, her son will be able to improve the financial condition of his business.

loans.use: To buy childrens' and ladies' garments for selling.

loans.name: Procora

texts.en:
Procora is from the city of Maquilao, Tangub City, Philippines. She is a widow with five siblings. To supply their daily needs, Procora owns and manage a sari-sari (variety) store. In this type of work, she earns 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month and been in this job for almost 10 years. 

Because she needs to purchase more products for her sari-sari store, Procora requests a loan of 15,000 PHP.

Procora has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. She hopes to gain more income in order for her to let her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase more products for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with 5 children all of who go to school. She takes care of two additional family members (old parents: mother and father). She has a retail shop. She operates a retail business. Mariam works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, rice, flour, and cooking oil. Mariam generates additional income through poultry farming. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a wholesale shop and also to educate her children to university level. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, rice, maize flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as pants, polo shirts, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es: La señora Maricela a sus 30 años de edad es madre de dos hijos de 8 y 6 años. La señora Maricela tiene una pequeña tienda en al sala de su casa desde hace aproximadamente 6 meses. Un familiar de la señora Maricela fue quien la motivo para que montara su propio negocio luego de haberse separado de su esposo, luego de esto la señora Maricela quedo sola para las obligaciones de su hogar. La señora Maricela desea comprar surtido para su tienda como arroz, panela, snakcs, gaseosas, dulces y productos para el aseo personal, que le permitan prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y a su vez incrementar sus ingresos con los que pueda brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. A futuro la señora Maricela sueña con tener un mini mercado y brindarles un excelente bienestar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maricela, 30, is a mother of two children, aged 8 and 6 years old. Maricela has had a small store in her living room for approximately 6 months. One of Maricela's family members motivated her to start her own business after she separated from her husband. After the separation, Maricela was left on her own to support her home. 

Maricela wants to buy an assortment of products for her store, such as rice, panela [brown sugar loaf], snacks, soft drinks, sweets, and products for personal cleaning. These purchases will allow her to provide a better service to her clients and increase her income to provide a better quality of life to her children. 

In the future, Maricela dreams with having a mini-market and providing excellent well-being to her children.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of products.

loans.name: Sope Serign Saliou Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité est créé le 23 novembre 2011. Il est composé de 08 femmes qui sont pratiquement de la même localité. 

Yacine (à gauche de la photo habillé en bleu) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée 62 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un enfant .

Yacine fait du commerce de détail avec la vente de produits halieutiques.

Avec son nouveau prêt de 50000 elle va acheter des paniers de poissons fumés et de poissons séchés destinés à la revente au niveau du marché de son quartier.

A l'aide de ses bénéfices elle va acheter du riz de l huile et du sucre pour son enfant et lui payer des ordonnances en cas de maladie.
texts.en:
Sope Serign Saliou Group was established on November 23, 2001. He's made up of eight women, who are practically from the same town.

Yacine (on the left in the photograph, wearing blue) is responsible for the group. She's 62 years old and the mother of one child. She retails fish products.

With her new loan of XOF 50'000 (ca US$ 92) she will buy baskets of smoked fish and dried fish, and resell them at the market in her neighborhood.

With her profits, she will buy rice, oil, and sugar for her child, and pay prescription costs in case of sickness.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish and dried fish to resell

loans.name: Moris Muthee

texts.en: Moris is a married Kiva borrower. He has 2 children, aged 3 and 4. He describes himself as optimistic. He operates a retail shop where he sells spare parts and home products. He has been involved in this business for 1 year. His shop is located in a conducive business environment. He describes his biggest business challenge as the high cost of the products he sells. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock for his retail store. His business goal is to venture into transportation services within 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his retail store.

loans.name: Fareed

texts.en:
Fareed who is a 49-year-old man who is the father of three sons and four daughters. He is a school teacher with a decent salary. To increase his income, Fareed works in agriculture and additionally wants to start a new internet cafe project.

He wants to prepare well for the opening by purchasing computers, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN since the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay. Getting this loan will enable Fareed to purchase the number of computers he needs to prepare to open his project successfully. This will lead to loyal costumers and will increase his income.

Fareed is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase computers to prepare for opening an internet cafe.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Samira. She is married, and has two children, ages 8 and 2 years old. In 2007, Samira established her Frozen Fish business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in their home affairs. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Samira requires the loan in order to buy more cartons of fish for resale. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits. In the future, Samira plans to get a cool room for herself so that she can make more profit. She is very hardworking.  

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cartons of fish for resale.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is 43 years old; she is capable, responsible and so talented person. Lives in Tampico Tamaulipas and she started to make handmade products since 1993, at first she started to make that because she likes it and then many people looked her and appreciate the excellent job. But she was working in a private enterprise and did not have time to this job, however, one of her little sons was sick and she left her job, at the moment she does not medical insurance and the family expenses were more than before, so she started again her business with her handmade products to parties and weddings. This year she started to cook special cookies that have too much demand.

** She is requesting for a loan of $650 DLLS to purchase raw materials to her job and be prepare to Christmas season. Ofelia hopes your help and hopes to be a better woman.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

** Ofelia tiene 43 años, considerada como una persona capaz, responsable y muy talentosa. Vive en Tampico Tamaulipas y comenzó hacer manualidades desde 1993, inició esta actividad por gusto propio pero también porque la gente buscaba su gran trabajo, trabajaba en una empresa privada y no le quedaba tiempo para esta actividad, sin embargo, uno de sus tres hijos enfermo y tuvo que dejar de trabajar. Sin un seguro medico, los gastos en el hogar comenzaron a elevarse debido a la enfermedad de su hijo. Entonces comenzó su propio negocio, retomando las manualidades, hacia arreglos para fiestas y bodas principalmente. Este año comenzó a cocinar galletas de cajeta, las cuales tienen mucha aceptación.

** Ofelia requiere de $650 Dlls. para enfrentar la alta de demanda de temporada navideña y piden de tu ayuda para comprar los materiales para la producción de sus manualidades e insumos para la producción de galletas para estas épocas navideñas.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.en:
I have worked for several years making all-natural refreshments and I buy seasonal fruits for the drinks and make foods to sell in the markets and home. With this business I have been able to help my family with daily expenses and my children with their studies. Now as the school season approaches I will sell refreshments in local schools as well as fruits, foods and churros.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Tengo varios años de dedicarme a la fabricacion de refrescos naturales, compra la fruta de temporada para frescos y elaboro alimentos para vender en mercados y casa. Con este negocio he podido ayudar a mi familia con los gastos y a mis hijos con sus estudios. Ahora en temporada escolar entrego refrescos en escuelas cercanas a mi casa, al igual que les vendo frutas, comidas y churros.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, bags, thermoses and other items.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.en:
Mr. R. has been selling school supplies for the past 12 years. He has always had the support of his family when it comes to attending clients. Mr. R. says "I would like to keep my store well supplied; I need to sell more products on a daily basis and to achieve this, I must maintain the competition level. I would like to sell office supplies and stationary, thus I need a $1,200 loan."

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. R. lleva 12 años con este tipo de comercio (artículos escolares), siempre es apoyado por su familia para la atención de los clientes. "Quiero mantener bien surtida mi papelería necesito vender cada día mas y para esto debo mantener el nivel de la competencia el propósito es vender artículos y papelería utilizada para oficinas, para esto necesito $1,200.00 dlls

loans.use: Comprar articulos para su papeleria.

loans.name: Chek

texts.en: Mrs Chek C. is 24 and lives in Siem Reap in Cambodia. She earns 3 dollars a day selling fish. Her husband is 27 and earns 7 dollars per day as an electrician and a farmer. They have 3 children.  With their loan, they want to purchase cows to expand their business. In the future, they would like to purchase another stand in the market.

loans.use: To purchase cows

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana Maria is 50 years old and married with 5 children between the ages of 35 and 32. They are all married. Juana’s husband works as a lathe operator in a company in Escobedo in Nuevo Leon where they live. Four years ago, Juana opened her own business selling perfumes and jewelry from a catalog in order to help out with household expenses. She also makes and sells handicrafts for special events. Her patience and originality have allowed her to make tasteful, quality products which have helped her business to grow.

Now, in order to provide more handicrafts due to greater demand, Juana Maria needs a credit of $650 dollars which she will use towards the purchase of material in order to be able to make her products. She promises to repay this amount in 6 months. Please become part of the growth of this business and help Juana improve the life of her family, they will be forever appreciative.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva volunteer.

Juana Maria tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos entre 25 y 32 años, todos ellos ya casados, su esposo trabaja de tornero en una empresa de la localidad de Escobedo en Nuevo León de donde son originarios y para ayudarlo con los gastos de su hogar desde hace cuatro años emprendió su propio negocio con la venta de perfumes y joyería por catálogo, también elabora y vende manualidades para eventos especiales, su paciencia y originalidad le han permitido elaborar productos calidad y muy buen gusto, lo que le ha ayudado a crecer con su negocio.

Ahora surte grandes pedidos de manualidades y necesita un crédito de $650 dólares que empleará en la compra de material que requiere en la elaboración de sus productos, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte del crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a Juana a mejorar la vida de su familia, ellos te lo agradecerán siempre.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys L. C. belongs to the village bank called “Solución,” which is a Spanish word meaning “solution.”

Gladys and her husband are in the type of business known in Spanish as “vender por campañas,” which directly translates into “selling through campaigns.” What this means is that they vary the types of products they sell according to the season and the demand. For example, in September they sell back-to-school supplies to families. When it is time to begin planting a new crop, they sell fertilizer to farmers, and during the Christmas season, they sell decorations. Gladys and her husband sell the majority of their products in “ferias,” or large, open-air markets in the countryside. Sometimes they must travel many hours outside of Ayacucho.

Gladys began with just a small supply of “abarrotes,” which is the name given to the general supply of a variety of bulk food products. These Gladys continues to sell year round. This was twelve years ago, and today Gladys is the owner of a thriving business that has branched out into several different markets. It is a dynamic way to do business, however, Gladys says it is the best way to earn the highest returns. Eventually, Gladys would like to enter the construction market, selling different types of materials to a variety of companies.

Within her village bank, Gladys says she feels like she has a second family. She says it is an incredible resource for women, and the savings aspect has helped her in constructing her very own house where she and her two children, ages ten and two, live. It has also helped her save enough money to buy a van that she and her family are able to use to take their large amounts of goods for sale to the "ferias". Gladys is asking for a $400 loan, with which she will be able to buy a large supply of fertilizer to sell.

loans.use: o buy a large supply of fertilizer for re-sale

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
A 49-year-old widow with 4 chilren, Mrs. Joy O. lives in Benin City. She deals with ladies' used clothes. She worked with someone for a year to learn the business, and then started her own business in 1995.

She is soliciting a loan of $1200 to buy more used ladies' clothing to sell. She is a client of LAPO. She thanks you.

loans.use: Buy more used ladies' clothes to sell

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Romana M.. In 2000 she established a business selling flour, oil and beans, staple foods in Tanzania, that provides a steady income. Romana requires a loan of $700 to purchase additional stock in bulk and expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback."

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of flour, oil and beans in bulk

loans.name: Baldemar

texts.es:
Baldemar has 4 children whom he wishes will study at the University level. However, his dream has been broken due to the fact that his business, a butcher shop, burnt down, but he couldn’t get rid of his interest in selling meat so he began to sell dried, grilled and sausage meat among other things. Thanks to his strength this business has been prospering bit by bit. Nowadays they are offering two pigs at a good price. Because of this he is requesting a loan of $475 USD that is arranged to be paid in one term of 6 months and with this money Baldemar could further his family.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Baldemar tiene 4 hijos a quienes desea darles estudios universitarios. Sin embargo su sueño se había visto roto debido a que su negocio anterior, una carnicería, quebró, sin embargo el gusto por la venta de carne no se le quitó sin embargo comenzó a vender carne seca, chorizo, asado entre otras cosas. Gracias a su esfuerzo este negocio ha ido prosperando poco a poco.

Actualmente le están ofreciendo dos puercos a un muy buen precio. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $ 475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Baldemar podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To buy two pigs that are being offered at a good price.

loans.name: Tuon

texts.en: Tuon Y., 41, owns a plot of farmland growing rice and earns about $1 a day. Her husband is a head worker in the village and typically earns around $7 a day. They have six children, three of whom work in Phnom Penh City and the rest of whom stay at home helping around the house. To create more family income, they are now requesting a $700 loan from Kiva to purchase a motor-bike and a good rice seed reserve for next year. They will plant the rice seed and use the motor-bike as a taxi in the city.

loans.use: To purchase a motor bike and rice seed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase the merchandise she has in the store

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a widow who supports herself with a small business selling fresh fish at a market in Melitopol, Ukraine. Her husband died tragically, leaving Elena and their son, who is now about seventeen. Elena has been selling fish for two years and works with her mother in the business. Her mother has extensive experience as an entrepreneur, which has been a help to Elena.

Elena has requested a loan of 1500 Ukrainian Griven ($325 USD) to add to her business working capital. Her goal is to expand the business in the future. We are happy to be able to offer this financial assistance to Elena and look forward to her continued success.

loans.use: Add to working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase up to date work tools

loans.name: Isrfail

texts.en: Isrfail D. is a 50-year-old man who sells paint and other products for home improvements. He started his business in 1990 in his home region of Saatli. He is married and has three daughters and one son. He has applied for a loan to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand a paint and home improvement store

loans.name: Thi Diep's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Trần Thi Điệp (MS: 11040032) is 40 years old. She is a cadre helping the women of the hamlet. Her family has quite many activities. Her husband is a cadre of the village and she works for the community in the fields, retailing and providing agricultural services. Today, she needs a loan of 3.186.000 VND for retailing. She has some seed capital, but she decided to participate to the Fund because of the convenient payment terms and conditions.

The other members of the group are:

  • Trần Thị Ánh (MS: 11040033), borrowing 3.186.000 VND to buy and sell fruit
  • Nghiêm Thị Quyên (MS: 11040034), borrowing 3.186.000 VND to buy pig feed
  • Nguyễn Thị Phượng (MS: 11040035), borrowing 3.186.000 VND to buy pig feed
  • Nguyễn Thị Mai (MS: 11040036), borrowing 3.186.000 VND to buy more pigs to breed

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Minh, Kiva volunteer

    Chị Trần Thi Điệp (MS: 11040032), năm nay 40 tuổi. Là cán bộ phụ nữ thôn. Gia đình chị có khá nhiều hoạt động. Chồng là cán bộ xã, chị vừa công tác xã hội lại làm ruộng bán hàng (cung cấp dịch vụ nông nghiệp ...). Nay chị đã vay 3.186.000 VND để bổ xung vốn bán hàng.Chị đã được tiếp cận khá nhiều nguồn vốn nhưng nay vì thích hình thức tiết kiêm để hoàn trả của tài chính vi mô bình minh nên đã tham gia.

    Các thành viên khác trong nhóm:

  • Trần Thị Ánh (MS: 11040033), vay 3.186.000 VND để bán hàng hoa quả
  • Nghiêm Thị Quyên (MS: 11040034), vay 3.186.000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • Nguyễn Thị Phượng (MS: 11040035), vay 3.186.000 VND để mua cám lợn
  • Nguyễn Thị Mai (MS: 11040036), vay 3.186.000 VND để lấy vốn đi chợ và mua lợn giống

loans.use: Retailing and breeding

loans.name: Hak

texts.en:
Mr. Hak S., 48, fishes at Tunle Sap Lake, earning about US$2.50 per day. His wife, Mrs. Luy Sheav, is 38 and sells groceries, earning about US$1.25 per day. Mr. Hak has four children, all of whom are living in the family's home and two help Mr. Hak with his fishing. They live in Koktlok Kram Commune, Siem Reap Province. 

To increase the family's income, Mr. Hak is seeking a loan to purchase a battery-charge machine. He will provide this service in his village, and he believes that his new investment will improve his family's financial stability. Mr. Hak's wife is pictured feeding her pigs.

loans.use: To purchase a battery-charge machine

loans.name: Arafa

texts.en:
Arafa is 27 years old and married with a one year old child. She has been a shoes and handbag seller since 2005. She works at her business everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

In the past, Arafa has successfully taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She is now looking for a loan to buy more shoes and handbags for resale.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and handbags for resale.

loans.name: Mastona

texts.en: Mastona T. has been selling dried apricots for many years. It is very hard work. She goes to a city far away and buys apricots there for a cheaper price. Then she brings the apricots home and dries them, which takes about a week. After that she sells the apricots at the market. Everything is more expensive now, and she wants to borrow money to buy more apricots so that she won’t lose her clients.

loans.use: Buying more apricots for sale

loans.name: Eldith

texts.es:
La señora Eldith pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Rosas ubicado en el Jr. Victor Montalvo Nº 354, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 55 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, 2 mayores de edad y 1 que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja preparando panes, es panadero. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de panes. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con una panadería en casa y tiene el apoyo de su esposo para la preparación y administración de su negocio.

Con este préstamo de S/.  2,700, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 2 sacos de harina, 5 kilos de manteca, 2 paquetes de levadura, etc.
 
Eldith se siente contenta por todo lo que ha logrado y agradece al banco comunal por brindarle su apoyo incondicional.
texts.en:
Ms. Eldith A. is a member of the Las Rosas (The Roses) microfinance institute, located on Nº 354 Montalvo Street, in the Callería district of the Coronel Portillo province, department of Ucayali. She is 55 years old and has 3 children, 2 adults and 1 who is still her dependant. She is married, and her husband works as a baker. She decided to invest the first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from Manuela Ramos in bread sales. She has been working with this microfinance institute for 2 years.

She currently has her own in-home bakery, and has her husband’s support in preparing the bread and managing the business.

With this 2,700.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will purchase 2 sacks of flour, 5 kg of butter, 2 packages of yeast, etc.

Eldith feels happy for everything that she has accomplished. She is very grateful to the microfinance institute for giving her its unconditional support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, butter, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Lissi

texts.es: Lissi tiene 28 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Desde su niñez trabaja ayudando a sus padres en las tareas ganaderas, hace más de 5 años se independiza para formar una nueva familia al lado de su esposo, adquirió sus propios animales, aprovecha la venta de leche, así como vender los fines de semana en la feria ganadera los animales y obtener ganancias mensuales. Esta actividad le ha permitido capitalizar y junto a su esposo adquirir un automóvil  para que él se dedique al transporte y así incrementar los ingresos necesarios porque entre sus planes está obtener un propio terreno para construir su casa. Es la segunda vez que Lissi solicita un préstamo con MFP, y ha cumplido en el ciclo anterior fielmente con sus cuotas de pago. Con esta cantidad comprará una animal más (toro pequeño) y también 2 llantas para el carro de su esposo, ya que es un negocio familiar.
texts.en:
Lissi is 28 years old and lives with her husband and child. Since her childhood, she has helped her parents with livestock work. More than five years ago, she became independent and started a new family with her husband. She acquired her own animals and began selling milk and then animals at the weekend livestock fairs to earn her monthly wages. This activity has permitted her and her husband to get an automobile so he can work in transport and further increase their wages. One of their plans is to obtain their own land to construct a house. This is the second time that Lissi has sought a loan with MFP, and in the previous cycle she made all her repayments faithfully. With this loan she will buy one more animal (a small bull) and two tires for her husband's car, as it is a family business.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest A. is a 64 year old man. He is a married with six children. Three of his children are fully independent and the other three are currently in senior high school. Ernest is an agro-chemical seller, who sells various kinds of chemicals like weedicides, fertilizers, and pesticides, as well as spraying machines, to the local farmers. Many local farmers patronize his products because of the current farming season, during which most farmers actively planting their crops.

Ernest wants to use this loan to buy increased supplies of weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines to better serve the needs of his customers. He hopes to raise enough income to sponsor his children's education. With the loan he believes he can have another branch in the next town to serve them rather than those customers coming to him. He feels it’s quite a distance for them to travel. Ernest would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase increased supplies of weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.es: Demetria de 36 años, vive tranquila su soltería, alquilada en una casa cerca de su puesto de trabajo y aunque no cuenta con energía eléctrica, no se desanima e insiste en salir adelante con el negocio que ha emprendido. Sin ayuda de nadie, empujando su carrito, Demetria sale todas las noches a vender sus deliciosos salchimotes (comida hecha a base de mote frito y rodajas de salchichas), los cuales son degustados por las personas que pasan por su puesto, muchos de los cuales llegan a comerse hasta 3 o 4 platos, su negocio es muy rentable, debido a los bajos precios que tienen sus salchimotes. Ella disfruta cuando sus clientes alaban su deliciosa sazón, pero no le gusta tener que soportar el congelante frió que hace por la noches. Ya lleva 10 años en este negocio y ha decidido que es hora de mejorarlo, en el futuro quiere vender más salchimotes  y tener más ingresos, para mejorar su vida. Demetria es una de las socias más amables de su banco comunal, siempre es muy activa en sus reuniones y ahora se encuentra en su segundo préstamo, ella siempre ha pagado todas sus cuotas a tiempo, aunque para ello tenga que amanecerse vendiendo salchimote. Con el dinero del préstamo, Demetria pretende renovar su carrito de salchimote, y comprar más ingredientes para la preparación de su deliciosa comida, adquirir todo esto le costara alrededor de 800 nuevos soles y espera con esto tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Demetria, 36 years old, is unmarried and lives a tranquil life, lodged in a house near her workplace. Although the house does not yet have electricity, she doesn't get discouraged and is determined to get ahead with the business she started. Without anyone's help, Demetria goes out pushing her little cart every night to sell her delicious salchimotes (a food made of fried corn and sliced sausages), which are sampled by passersby. Many people end up eating three or four plates. Her business is doing very well, thanks to her low-priced salchimotes. She loves it when customers praise their delicious flavor, but she doesn't like having to endure the freezing cold at night. She's worked in this business for 10 years and has decided to improve it. In the future she'd like to send more salchimotes and earn a larger income in order to improve her life. Demetria is one of the friendliest members of her "banco comunal" (communal bank); she's always very active in meetings and is now on her second loan. She has always made her payments on time, even if she's had to stay up all night selling salchimote to do it. With the money from this loan, Demetria wants to refurbish her salchimote cart and buy more ingredients for preparing her delicious food. She can manage all this at a cost of about 800 nuevos soles, and hopes in that way to have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbish the cart she uses to sell food

loans.name: Adijat

texts.en: Adijat A. is a 50-year-old married woman with four children.  To support her family, she sells drinks.  She is hoping to expand her business, so she is now requesting a loan in the amount of $700 (100,000 NGN) in order to purchase more drinks for resale purposes.  She thanks Kiva and all of its lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cloth, dyes, and related supplies and equipment

loans.name: Abduhalil

texts.ru:
Абдухалил живет среди гор.  Там хорошо содержать скот, для дома и бизнеса.  С малых лет он выгонял  скот на пастбищах, теперь, имея опыт в откорме скота, сам покупает и продает скот.  В их селе все содержат скот , вот и по очереди он и его соседи  идут на пастбище в горы или где есть корм (трава)- они договариваются чья очередь идти на пастбище всех коров и коз на луг. И так один месяц Абдухалил , или другой его сосед выгуливают скот, а делают они это для того что бы сохранить от волков и других форс мажорных ситуации. 
 Он  является бухгалтером в сельском совете. Сотрудничает с Микроинвест год назад.
texts.en:
Abduhalil lives in the mountains. Its a good place to maintain livestock for his home and business. From a young age he turned animals out to pasture; now, having experience in raising animals to market weight, he himself buys and sells livestock. Everyone in the village keeps livestock. He and his neighbors alternate taking the animals to pasture in the mountains where there is food (grass). They agree on whose turn it is to take cows to pasture and goats to the meadow. So for one month Abduhalil, or another of his neighbors, tend the animals, to protect them from wolves another any other dangerous situations. He is a bookkeeper for the village council. He began working with Microinvest a year ago.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Mrs. Merly A. is 29 years of age and married to Mr. Jovenal A., an Overseas Filipino Worker. They have two lovely children to raise and hope to give them a good education.

Merly is a newly recognized member of Paglaum MPC under its micro-finance program. Her business is dried-fish vending and she sells to her neighbors and friends. She applied for the loan to provide additional capital.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand and resupply her store

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is married and has 4 dependants. She has received no formal education. Ekua sells charcoal in small quantity in Abura, which she has done for the past 10 years. Her husband is a cleaner whose income is too small to take care of his family. Ekua uses all her income for feeding and clothing the family. Ekua will use the loan to purchase bags on a bit larger quantity of charcoal for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to re-invest into the business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal on a bit larger quantity for resale.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina A. is married and has eight dependents. She did not receive any formal education. Sabina sells firewood in small quantities in Esuase. She has been in this business since 1999. Her husband has a driving business from which he earns a very small income. Sabina uses all of her income for feeding their large family, and so she has financial difficulties. Sabina will use the loan to support her small capital for expanding her business. She will invest any new profits back into the business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Lê Thị

texts.en:
D. Lê Thị (1012060354) is a 40-year-old female living in the town of Nghi Lộc. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, D. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. D. has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, D. joined Kiva partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. D. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. D. is now requesting a new loan of 15,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be her seventh from TYM Fund. D. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock

loans.name: Carlos Martin

texts.es: Carlos Martin G. P. vive en casa propia, con su esposa María y sus 4 hijos. Carlos brinda los servicios de alquiler de molino. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, el inicio por cuenta propia, en estos momentos Carlos se encuentra enfermo, la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Por lo que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante con su familia, ya que estos son los ingresos que mantienen a su familia. Es un hombre que ha tenido muy buenas experiencias ya que solamente no se ha dedicado a esta actividad. Es por ese motivo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la proporcionarle el mantenimiento necesario a su molino y comprarle las herramientas necesarias. Su mayor deseo es de recuperarse para ayudar a su esposa con el cuido de sus hijos y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Carlos Martín G. P. owns the home where he lives with his wife, María, and their four children. Carlos rents a mill located in his house. He opened the business on his own and has operated it for the past 6 years. He has put a lot of effort in the business and he and his family have been able to get ahead on the income it generates. He is a well-rounded individual who has been involved in other activities as well. He will use the loan to finance maintenance for the mill and to buy tools for it. Carlos has been ill. His most important goal now is to get better and help his wife take care of the children so that they can grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make and sell food items

loans.name: Heldita

texts.en: Heldita B., 60 years of age and single, resides at La Roche, Sindangan Zamboanga del Norte. She has been an active member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since May 2008. She decided to join PMPC because she knows that this is a good opportunity for her to put some additional capital into her business retailing candles. She deeply hopes that this opportunity can help to grow her business someday.

loans.use: additional capital for her candle retail

loans.name: Ayabavi Renée

texts.fr:
A. Ayabavi Renée est née en 1953 à Abidjan en Côte-d’Ivoire. Ayabavi Renée est allée à l’école jusqu'en classe de CM2. Ayabavi Renée est Mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Ayabavi Renée et ses enfants habitent dans sa maison familiale au quartier Sainte Rita à Cotonou. Ayabavi Renée a été très tôt initiée au commerce par sa tutrice. Apres plusieurs années de services rendus à cette dernière, Ayabavi Renée s’est installée à son propre compte pour mener son petit commerce: vente de balais et de paniers. Ensuite, Ayabavi Renée a vendu des vivres (farine de manioc, haricot, maïs). Aujourd'hui Ayabavi Renée
 fait la transformation de soja en fromage. Ayabavi Renée veut pouvoir acheter le soja en gros et commencer par livrer aussi le fromage de soja en gros aux revendeurs et à ceux qui vendent à manger. C’est pour cette raison Ayabavi Renée sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Ayabavi Renée was born in 1953 in Abidjan, Cote-d’Ivoire. She went to school through the 5th grade. She is the mother of six children who are all in school. Ayabavi Renée and her children live in the family house in the Sainte Rita district in Cotonou. Early on, she was introduced to commerce by her guardian. After several years of service rendered to her, Ayabavi Renée got situated on her own running a small business: selling brooms and baskets. Then, she sold staple foods (cassava flour, beans, corn). Today, she makes soybeans into tofu (soy cheese). She wants to be able to buy soybeans in bulk and to start by delivering tofu wholesale to retailers and to food caterers. For this reason, she's requesting financial support from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of soybeans and drums of vegetable oil

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is Neema K., a 30 year old woman from Mbeya. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 9 and 14. Neema has been running a crops business since 2006. Her business is purchasing and selling crops. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, 6 days per week. Neema currently earns about 50 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to open the same business at a new location. Neema K. thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie G. lives in the village of Brgy. Abahaw, Hinigaran Negros Occidental. She is 40 years old and is married to Dionito G. who is presently engaged in buying and selling cows, hogs and other farm animals. She has three young children who are between 1 to 16 years old, with the older two kids going to school. She aspires to be able to send all her children to college and earn their degrees so that they can have their own careers and be independent.

When she started, Lanie had little knowledge of handling a general store but she tried her luck, and was willing to learn from each experience, because it was the easiest way to earn money and help her husband earn a living. She asked for capital from her husband and invested it in a general store, but she is happy because she is proving that she can do it and help her family at the same time. She discovered that she enjoyed being in business and continued to improve operations until she realized that she needed a fresh infusion of capital to take her business to the next level.

She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 so that she could add to her current capital and invest it in a general store. As time moved on and her business steadily improved with each new loan, she was able to help her husband in his business as well. Now the combined monthly net income of their two businesses earns approximately PHP 8,000, which goes a long way in defraying the family's expenses.

In the previous loan, she borrowed Php 19,500 and used it for her general store business and the livestock business of her husband. This amount was paid in weekly installments and was fully paid without any delays. Now she is borrowing  Php 22,000 for her 15th cycle loan which she intends to use as additional capital for her general store and to buy more livestock to sell. The income from it will be used to improve their living conditions.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store and to buy and sell livestock

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema S. is a married Tanzanian entrepreneur. She runs a grocery business at Lumo Ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of drinks including coca cola, juice and drinking water. She also sells food stuffs to her customers. She has five children: one is in kindergarten, three are in primary school and one is in secondary school. She manages to pay the school fees from her business income. She is requesting a loan of TZS 600,000 to boost up the business by buying more goods to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: Expand the business by buying more goods

loans.name: Foundo Group

texts.fr: Palmarin est un village sérère où la population consomme beaucoup de céréales notamment sous forme de couscous ou de bouillie. Face à cette situation, le groupement des femmes de Foundo a pensé bénéfique de créer une banque de céréales pour la transformation de produits céréaliers. Le prêt acquis, la première tâche sera d’aller acheter dans les marchés hebdomadaires les produits (mil, maïs, sorgho) à bon prix et de les revendre. La seconde sera de transformer les céréales pour disposer d’un produit fini (araw, thiacri, couscous)  bien ensaché qui est un produit très prisé par les villageois.
texts.en:
Palmarin is a village of the Serer people where they consume a lot of grains, especially in the form of couscous or porridge. With regard to this situation, the women’s group Foundo thought it beneficial to create a grain bank for processing cereal products. With the loan in hand, the first task will be to go and buy supplies (millet, corn, sorghum) at the weekly markets at a good price and then to resell them. The second task will be to process the grains to obtain a nicely packaged finished product (araw, thiacri, couscous). These products are highly prized by the villagers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell local cereals

loans.name: Gouye Gui 2 Group

texts.fr: Le Groupement Gouye Gui est composé de femmes très dynamiques qui travaillent dans l'achat vente de poissons .Généralement les maris sont des pécheurs et à leur retour de la mer ils donnent une partie aux femmes pour la gestion de leur quotidien et ces dernières achètent avec leur moyen pour le renforcement de leur activité . ce prêt va contribuer à l'achat de produits halieutiques et d'avoir une certaine autonomie vis à vis de leur maris.
texts.en:
The members of the Gouye Gui Group are some very dynamic women, whose business is buying and selling fish. Most of their husbands are fishermen and when they come back from the sea they give some of the caught fish to the wives so that they can manage the daily household. The women use their revenue to reinforce their business, buying other fish products, so that they can achieve some independence from their husbands.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fishing

loans.name: Elkhan

texts.en: Elkhan Q. is 48 years old and is married with two adorable daughters. He opened his grocery 7 years ago. Elkhan provides his neighbors and occasional clients with products like bread, rice, sugar, meat, milk, and other staples. He tells us that, thanks to his grocery’s early opening hours and the good service he offers his customers, he has been able to move forward with the business. Elkhan wants the loan to purchase more merchandise, such as tinned products, sweets, and drinks. He and his family appreciate your support in helping him improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase more food products

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Ana Silvia T. D. M. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos menores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar, Ana posee una floristería, la cual esta ubicada en su hogar, ahí las personas hacen los pedido y llegan a recogerlos. Ana elabora  arreglos con flores y globos para decorar los salones e iglesias en diferentes ocasiones especiales, como bautizos y bodas. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. globos, flores y todo tipo D. materia prima para la elaboración D. los arreglos D. decoración D. fiestas y el hogar, así mismo desea poder saldar una deuda que posee. Ana desea poder mejorar su negocio y que más personas puedan conocerla, es por ello que desea poder invertir en el y D. esta manera poder mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ana Silvia is 37 years old and resides in the Department of San Salvador. She lives with her husband and 3 minor children who are students. Ana has a flower shop which is located in her home. Here people come to place orders and to collect them. She creates gifts for all occasions, including baptisms and weddings. She is soliciting a loan to buy more balloons, flowers, and all types of primary materials to make gifts. She also wishes to pay off a debt she has. Ana wants to improve her business so that more people will get to know her. It is for that reason that she wants to invest in her shop and in this manner, to be able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY BALLOONS, FLOWERS, AND SUPPLIES FOR HER FLOWER SHOP

loans.name: Paulino

texts.en:
