Paulino U. is from the village of Sagay in Camiguin Province.  He is 55 years old. Paulino is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Paulino owns and operates a bakery where she bakes and sells bread to the local community. Paulino has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Paulino joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paulino has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional cooking ingredients. Paulino is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to expand his business. This will be Paulino's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fortunata tiene 47 años, es casada y tiene tres hijos (Rocio tiene 25 años, Edit tiene 23 años y Genera tiene 20 años, ellos son independientes). Fortunata vende artesanía en la puerta de los hoteles, en la Plaza de Armas y en los monumentos arqueológicos de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella ofrece a los turistas chompas, chalinas, guantes todo de material de lana. La socia nos cuenta que ella compra sus productos de los mayoristas de la Av. Tupac Amaru que se encuentra al lado del Mercado “San Pedro”. Ya son 30 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Fortunata es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora que con el pequeño negocio de venta de artesanía saco adelante a sus hijos. Fortunata requiere el préstamo para comprar más  chalinas, chompas y guantes de lana. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

Fortunata pertenece al banco comunal “Inti” de la Asociación Arariwa. 
(Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol)
texts.en:
Fortunata is 47 years old, married, and has three grown children: Rocio (age 25), Edit (age 23), and Genera (age 20). She sells various handicrafts at hotel entrances, the Plaza de Armas, and different archaeological monuments around the city of Cusco. Fortunata sells to tourists articles made of wool such as sweaters, scarves, and gloves. She acquires her products in bulk along Tupac Amaru Avenue next to the San Pedro Market.

Fortunata has been in business for 30 years and has done very well as a result of her efforts. She is a determined and hardworking woman who manages a small handicraft business so that her children can get ahead. Fortunata is requesting a loan to buy more wool products such as scarves, sweaters, and gloves. She is thankful for this opportunity and promises to make her payments on time.

Fortunata is a member of the “Inti” Communal Bank, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. (“Inti” means “sun” in the Quecha language.)

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase woolen articles such as sweaters, scarves, and gloves

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace C. is from Barangay Lunao in Gingoog City. She is 47 years old. Grace is married and has 2 adult children. 

To make a living, Grace owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Grace joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Grace is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Grace's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sony

texts.en:
Mrs. Sony B. is 40 years old and is a villager who lives in Chuos village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Sao Sam, is a construction worker who is able to earn a small salary to support his family. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

Aside from farming, Mrs. Sony B. raises pigs at her house. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for 2,000,000 Riels from AMK to buy twenty more piglets to enlarge her business. With this loan she hopes to increase her income to improve her family living.

This couple has three children who are all students in the public school.

loans.use: To buy twenty more piglets

loans.name: Beginning Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth S. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Beginning Group.  She is 45 years old, widowed, and has six children who range from 5 to 24 years old.  Elizabeth was able to attend school through 11th grade.

For 6 years, Elizabeth has been selling charcoal at the Parker Point Market in Paynesville, which is near Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.  She says that she provides her customers with good quality charcoal, which keeps them coming to her for business.  One of her challenges is that there are many competitors in the market.

Elizabeth plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more charcoal.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Elizabeth is the one holding the sign.  Oretha G. is inset at lower left.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde has a shop where she sells groceries and fufu. She buys groceries in bulk and at retail. The fufu is a locally made food, which is derived from the fermentation of cassava and can be eaten with any soup of one's choice. She has been in this business since 1990. Kehinde is 50 years old, married and has three children who are between 32 and 25 years old. With a part of her profit and what the husband brings in, they are able to clothe, feed and take care of their rented apartment, as they are yet to put a finishing touch to their own place. Kehinde is requesting a loan of N50,000 to buy more provisions for sale. She says thank you and promises to repay promptly

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Madai

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Madai P. le está haciendo falta la barda alrededor de la casa. 
No cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargará de realizar la mejora. 
Es por eso que solicita el préstamo, ya que necesita la seguridad de su familia ya que trabaja casi todo el día y su esposo el señor Luís Reyes trabaja de noche de guardia de una compañía. 
Desean que sus dos hijos estén seguros y cómodos en su casa.
texts.en:
Madai P.'s home is missing a fence around it. She doesn't have the necessary funds to be able to purchase the materials and pay someone to make the improvements. It's for this reason she is requesting the loan, since she needs to ensure her family's security since she works practically all day and her husband, Luís Reyes, works at night as a guard for a company. They want their two children to be comfortable and secure in their home.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a fence

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde F.,  47, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Cezar F., a fish vendor, they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been managing her own variety store and food vending business for several years.

Matilde has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than two years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow six times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy added inventory for her store. Her business allows her earn a profit of PHP 4,400 per month.  

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 14,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business; She will be buying food ingredients for her food vending business.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that their standard of living will improve as well. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Agusto Cesar

texts.es: Agusto Cesar tiene 1 hijo de 5 años a su cargo, por lo que él le brinda la oportunidad de estudio a su hijo. El se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva desde hace 7 años, cuando el dio inicio fue por su hermano ya que él le proporcionaba los productos para que Agusto los vendiera a precios favorables, así fue como poco a poco ha ido creciendo y mejorando su actividad. Por lo que actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Su deseo es mejorar cada día con el servicio al cliente así obtendrá mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Agusto has a five year old son, to whom he provides the opportunity for an education. He has been selling clothing for the past seven years. When he began, his brother would provide the products for him to sell. Little by little he has been growing and improving his business. He is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies. He wants to improve his customer service and increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Dany Teodoro

texts.es: El solicitante es casado, vive en casa de su madre con cual comparte gastos familiares. Cuenta con una movilidad que brinda el servicio de taxi; su esposa vende productos de belleza Avon. El destino del credito es para cambio de motor y arreglos de su movilidad.
texts.en:
This applicant is married and lives with his mother, with whom he shares the household expenses, in her house. He has the use of a vehicle that he uses to provide taxi services. His wife sells Avon beauty products. The loan would be destined to replace an engine and make repairs to his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs for his vehicle.

loans.name: Atma

texts.en:
Atma A. is currently in the business of selling bags of charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Atma is 49 years old and is a widow.   She has seven children and only one child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rufo Alcivar

texts.es:
Rufo Alcivar L. M. tiene 30 años.  Estado civil Unión Libre vive en el cantón de Chillanes en el Recinto San Jose Parroquia el Estero Salado. Tiene 2 hijos, Paola (9) y Alejandro (6). 

Rufo  es un socio de la ventanilla rural Fronteras Unidas, esta Ubicada a quince minutos de la Parroquia  Estero Salado, a dos horas de la agencia en Chillanes, esta ventanilla integran 19 socios,  la Comunidad se dedican a la agricultura.

Rufo se dedica a la agricultura, al cultivo cacao y maracuya. Realiza sus compras cada mes, en Matilde Esther, las ventas las realiza en las misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para la compra de cacao y maracuya para siembra e incrementar el negocio. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Su sueño es tener dinero para tener un negocio propio. El desafío que enfrentamos es en el tiempo de cosecha, ya que las vías de acceso se dañan por la lluvia.

Le gusta las festividades de la localidad y los programas en nuestro Recinto.
texts.en:
Rufo Alcivar L. M., 30, is in a common law relationship. He lives in Chillanes canton, Recinto San José, Estero Salado parish. He has two children: Paola, 9 and Alejandro, 6. Rufo is a member of the Fronteras Unidas (United Frontiers) communal bank fifteen minutes from Estero Salado parish, two hours from the Chillanes agency. It has 19 members who are farmers. Rufo farms cacao and passion fruit. He makes his purchases monthly in Matilde Esther and his sales in the same location. He is asking for funding to buy cacao and passion fruit to plant and increase his business. He believes that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. His dream is to have enough money to own his own business. The challenge he faces is during harvest time because rains damaged the access roads. He enjoys the locality’s festivals and the programs in our Recinto.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cacao and passion fruit.

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El socio vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
El socio es el Sr. Juan; el tiene 34 años de edad y el socio es conviviente el tiene 2 hijos, el socio es empleado del INC en Pinaya, Esta institución lo obliga a viajar y a hacer de su trabaja toda una experiencia enriquecedora, ya que este instituto cuida el patrimonio cultural de Cusco y están encargados de preservar los bienes y de descubrir nuevos hallazgos Inkas y pre Inkas. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar una camisa y para sus pasajes.

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Introducing Juan, a member of the “Choquequirao” Communal Bank (Choquequirao is a ruined Incan city; the name is Quechua for “cradle of gold”). He lives in the Huanchac district, located in the province and department of Cusco. Juan is 34 years old and he lives with his live-in partner and two children. He works for the INC (Instituto Nacionál de Cultura - National Institute of Culture) in the Pinaya office: he travels a lot because of his job, and he makes enriching experiences during his journeys, as this institution takes care of the cultural heritage of Cusco, and it is in charge of the preservation of cultural premises and goods and to discover new findings of the Incan and pre-Incan periods. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a shirt and for his journeys. He is really thankful and endlessly values the loan he has been granted, as this allows him to improve the quality of his life; at the same time he commits to complying with paying his dues at the set deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a shirt and for his journeys.

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia es profesora de profesión, es casada, tiene 38 años y 1 hijo, Zenobia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. 
Zenobia es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas y solicita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que sera invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y cerveza.
Los sueños de Zenobia son ampliar su bodega, construir un ambiente mas grande para su tienda.
texts.en:
Zenobia, 38, is married and has one son; she’s a teacher by profession. She has a grocery store in her home where she stocks assorted groceries, vegetables and fruit. She is open for business every day from 6am until 9pm. Zenobia is a member of the Azucenas (Easter Lilies) communal bank and is asking for a 1250 sol loan to buy rice, sugar and beer. Zenobia’s dream is to expand her stock and build a larger space for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and beer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy material for a party supply business

loans.name: Jagapar

texts.en: Jagapar Z. is 46 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayan-Ulgiy province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His oldest son is a student, his middle daughter attends a local elementary school and his youngest daughter is in kindergarten. His wife works as a nurse in a local hospital. Jagapar has been operating a small outdoor billiards area at the local market in his town since 2005. He owns a billiard table that people can use while they are shopping. He has used his daily earnings to provide for his household's needs and has not created any savings yet. He hopes to expand his business and to operate a clothes trading business in the near future . He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase one more billiard table.

loans.use: To purchase one more billiard table
